story:
Hello everyone!

Nina, here. You may know me as your bartender, or as the cello player in Pauly Creep-O. You may not know that one of my earliest aspirations was to become an independent animator. I studied many forms of art & animation at several Bay Area universities including San Francisco. At that time, two-dimensional animation was on its last leg. Then came the revolution of the internet. This brought about the power for artists & individuals alike to be heard, seen and believed on a mass public level without sponsors or corporate involvement. 

Producing animation in a corporate environment has never really appealed to me, as I’ve never been a fan of feeling like a cog in the machine. I have valuable perspectives to share, perspectives that don't typically come from the mainstream entertainment industry. I love and respect the art of animation, and also I believe that a piece is only as strong as the message it conveys. My goal is to use my art to inspire compassion, understanding, growth, and change. My work will include themes such as existentialism & related philosophies, anarchism, post-leftism and more. Some pieces will be stand-alone episodes, but some topics will be explored serially. The form may shift over time but the primary focus will be on personal stories and perspectives on drugs, substance abuse, mental health, and destruction of toxic-shame.

My experience recording and editing music with my husband Pauly Creep-O will go a long way towards crafting films that are equal parts visual and auditory experience. I'd like to work hand in hand with musicians to amplify the expressions they have in their music in a beautiful and striking way. I am fortunate to be connected with a large network of very talented  musicians across genres whose work will complement the stories we choose to tell.

Animation has been a huge influence in my life since my earliest memories. I’d love to make people feel the same way I have felt. I stand on the shoulders of giants, and I hope to build on their work while creating something new, daring, and challenging. I am looking to work with many other talents from the community on different aspects of this, from voice acting and soundtracks to anything else we can come up with. Together we can create something beautiful and meaningful. 

Of course, we cannot do this without support from friends, family, and the broader community. This campaign includes nearly bare minimum essentials. If you’d like to help contribute beyond our marked goal, all additional funds will go towards upgraded quality of audio & visual. In addition to financial support, we are gratefully accepting any equipment donations such as mic stands, microphones, cables, pedals/loops, etc. 

Thank you all so much. I can’t tell you all how excited I am to start this journey as soon as possible!!! 

- Atheo Genesis

ps: I will be adding more perks. Please message me with any questions!

story:
I have been making things since I can remember. Ever curious, I was drawing, painting, baking, and creating my way through life. In June 2003, as a rising Junior at St Olaf College, I had a freak accident while working grounds crew. I had a very serious traumatic brain injury (TBI). I also had a TIA, or an almost stroke, due to a blood clot that passed through a hole in my heart and took temporary residence in my brain. The doctors called me a miracle patient because with lots of hard work and their diligence, I was able to return to college in the fall.

I dropped a math class and took ceramics, because I already knew how to throw. That’s when I got bitten by the clay bug! Since then I have continued my education at some of the top clay institutions in the country: RISD, The Clay Studio in Philadelphia, Red Dirt Studio in DC, and Cranbrook Academy of Art (where I earned my MFA). 

Since returning home to Virginia, I have set up my studio in Charlottesville and started my business, Möbius Keramikk.  I have become an active part of the Cville arts scene, and taught at VCU and in my studio.  Most of my effort has been focused on developing my work and showing it at direct-to-consumer shows; highlights include The Brooklyn Museum this past fall, and this spring I will be at The American Craft Council show in St Paul.

Louis Sullivan stated form follows function. I have adapted that to color and line follow form. As a businesswoman, my aim is to let my work follow where it is asked to go. I have worked the craft-show circuit; the overwhelming response I have gotten from customers is that my work belongs in high-end retail stores.  The next step for me is to enter the wholesale market.

My goal for 2018 is to see if I can make a living as a maker through wholesale contracts, web sales, and regional fairs. In early December, I was formally invited to participate in NYNOW. A huge honor and a hefty price tag.  This campaign will give me the opportunity to explore the wholesale marketplace.  As it is a new venture I cannot know exactly what will happen or what I expect to happen, other than continue to learn where my pots want to end up.

I wish instead of keys this were a sketchpad as I do not have the words to express the gratitude I have for anyone helping me get my work where it wants to be. NYNOW will be an expensive show for me to attend, but it is “the big time”.  If I can make it there…

Costs:

·       Booth $4,095

·       Electrical: $124.35

·       Mileage Reimbursement (682 miles): $371.69

·       Tolls: $78.70

·       Parking: $250 

·       MTA: $50

·       Food: $210

Total $5179.74

This opportunity presented itself last minute. In a sense you could say I was "discovered" at the 11th hour. As a result I have had to commit to doing this show without securing the funding first. Whatever money you are able to give me will be used for my show expenses. While committing to this show – and raising the money to attend – is scary, one upside is that it has given me the perfect excuse to begin an online sales presence. It is an unexpected boon on many levels.

The Perks for you!

I love what I make and I want you to love it too. You will become part of how my business as it grows. As a thank you for donating, you have the option to receive a custom piece of art. If you decide you want logo cups I will work with your design goals. My plan is to listen and take advice. Have you thought about this type of form? This market? This show? I have said yes to everything possible (including this show) and it has helped define Möbius Keramikk. With this show and campaign I am entering into a new developmental stage and you get to be a part of it. I couldn't be happier! 

Of course this is a risk as there is the potential for me to incur a lot of debt that could hinder Möbius Keramikk's ability to move laterally and vertically in the marketplace. But the positive possibilities outweigh the negative and with your assistance I am confident this is a risk worth taking.

What I would love from you: Obviously whatever level of financial assistance you can give, but also support and ideas. I have a lot of money to raise in a very short period of time. What could I do that I haven't tried? Do you know anyone who would be interested in my work and want to support it? Can you share this campaign? Or if you know that I have a product you love and it is not a perk let me know and I will work to make it yours by swapping perks. I am open! I love making these objects and using them and want to share my joy with you. 

So thank you, thank you, thank you! Digital fist bumps are on me!!!

story:
Do you know Museum artists? 

  • We are a labor community of artists who organically formed through working at The Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City.
  • We are soliciting funds to help bring our Museum Union Art Workers (MUAW) show to completion this March.
  • Your support will not only help make the show a success but will highlight the importance of labor within musuems which often goes overlooked. You will also help us bring the history and significance of labor unions to the community of El Barrio, New York. 

What We Need & What You Get

Your donation would help towards

  •  $500.00 to help with food and refreshments 
  • Funds for the renting of the venue underneath the gallery for the closing party, where live performances will take place
  • A banner which will communicate the history of our local union 1503
  • We are unable to campaign in exchange for gifts, as this could be considered a conflict of interest with the Museum and the Union, as well. You're gifts would be a donation which would aide in the fruition of a project that means a great deal to us and is a positive endeavor for society. If you love museums or you like art, please support this project. Thank you and virtual hugs from magical leprechauns that will make all your dreams come true!! From all the organizers of this project!!! (Maureen Catbagan, Maura Falfan, Michael Sump, Arthur Polendo, Maraya Lopez and Pavol Roskovensky)

The Impact

Our union consists of security guards and maintainers. The union provides excellent benefits for it's employees and offers job stability in a precarious and ever changing city, like New York. For many of us, working at the museum makes a huge impact on our personal art work and creative endeavors. We believe that art is intrinsic to our well being and is needed in order to foster a healthy and confident society. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you are unable to contribute to our project. If you live in New York and want to support this project, please reach out to us at muaw1503@gmail.com.

Come see the show: March 11 - March 22, 2018, Opening reception in March 11th, from 6PM-9PM

Gallery location: 215 E 99th St. between 2nd Ave and 3rd Ave, 10029

Hours: Monday - Sunday, 12PM 5PM

Historic PS109 building, now a community artist run space in El Barrio (location of show)

story:
Help My Mom Launch her Art Career

(and help me become a fearless leader!)

  • My name is Jenna Soard, and I'm an entrepreneur and leader with an audience of over 20,000 women, who has a FEAR of asking for help... I do everything myself. 
  • My mom is a self taught artist who lives on a very limited fixed income and tries to sling paintings on Etsy.  She struggles with learning how to sell her work and feeling confident in it.
  • This campaign is important to me, because I know (and she's already AGREED TO GO) that attending this program called The Ascension Leadership Academy is going to be the secret sauce to her getting through her blocks... to become the confident, fearless, artist she wants to be.  I know this because some of my best friends and mentors went through this program and go on to do amazing things! 
  • If you can help her achieve this, she will be able to believe in herself and sell her art!  I also will finally understand the power of asking for help which is going to help me achieve huge things within my own business....such as HELPING more people because I will have faith in asking for help to do this. Some things on the horizon is helping businesses become more universally accessible!

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • We need $3,000 for tuition for her to go to the Ascension Leadership Program
  • You will get really awesome PERKS for your donation such as either copies of her work for your phone wallpaper up to higher priced donations that will go to her painting your furry friend.
  • If we don't reach our goal, the funds will STILL go to her attending the program, I will either personally pay for the rest, or we will find other fundraising methods

The Impact

  • My mom is not only a brilliant artist, but an amazing furniture maker, she will be on fire.  She might just change the world with her work.
  • My plan is to find a way to scale my business to help MORE WOMEN create profitable businesses.

Challenges

The challenge here  is I have been scared to ask for help.  What if I fail? Will I ever ask for help again?   My mom might lose faith in her art. I might lose faith in my ability to motivate people.  This is why we need your help!  I do have the support of what I've learned in ALA to help me get through this hurdle. Think of how much you'll be helping both of us, especially if I have ever personally helped you in your life.  This is your opportunity to give back!

Other Ways You Can Help

Go like my mom on instagram @thepoochpainter

story:
A CITY OF NEIGHBORHOODS 

Hello! My name is Andrew Soria, and I am a digital artist who specializes in creating photo collaged cityscapes of urban environments. For the past seven years, I've been creating and exhibiting these pop surreal cityscapes in galleries, and my work has even been featured in well-known art magazines. (Juxtapoz magazine, Hi-Fructose magazine, Upper Playground, Plastik magazine, Mutant Space). I first moved to LA with the intention of creating one of these iconic cityscapes. As I began to explore, I attained a deeper understanding of what the City of Los Angeles really is. I realized I could not simply encase the entire city in one of my detailed composites; rather, I quickly learned that LA is a complex and vibrant city made up of multiple unique neighborhoods.

    At first glance, people recognize LA's many stereotypes—but its roots run much deeper. In reality, each neighborhood operates as its own unique community, acting as a sort of "mini" city within the greater Los Angeles area. In other words, you can experience a different lifestyle and culture simply by moving to a different neighborhood. Moreover, LA caters to just about everything and everyone, making it easy to find the lifestyle and community you want to be a part of. "Welcome to the Neighborhood," will expose LA's one-of-a-kind world in the form of fifteen pop surrealism cityscapes. By embracing and blending LA's stereotypes with its idiosyncracies, I hope to showcase the raw, real, and honest version of Los Angeles! 

    "Welcome to the Neighborhood" will include the following Los Angeles cityscapes: Venice, Skid Row, Santa Monica, Beverly Hills, Culver City, West Hollywood, Fairfax district, Hollywood, Koreatown, Silver Lake, Echo Park, Downtown LA, Fashion district, Arts district, and Boyle Heights. While there are many more habitats to include, I have chosen to start with these neighborhoods and add to this project overtime.  

THE PURPOSE

"Welcome to the Neighborhood" aims to preserve the culture of  Los Angeles today, through the form of these cityscapes. Exclusively through this platform, I'll be offering postcards, limited prints, and original artworks. The funding raised through these sales will go toward the production and creation of these artworks. If I'm able to reach my stretch goal, I'll have a solo exhibition here in LA!

 

YOUR REWARD!

A One-of-a-Kind 4"x6" Postcard of Hollywood

Signed, numbered, and hand-inscribed postcards. These postcards will be a unique, collectible mini art print!

Limited edition fine art prints

You'll have the option between 10 different cityscapes, with 4 different print sizes. All on archival acid-free matte paper. These museum quality prints, will be signed, numbered and shipped to you safely!

Original limited edition artworks

For the avid art collector. An original c-print on fuji crystal paper, face mounted behind 1/4" acrylic plexiglass with an aluminum dibond backing. These artworks are typically displayed in galleries, starting at $5,000. You will have your choice of cityscape, up to 60"x30". 

   ••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••

With the complexity of this project. I've decided to offer these artworks as part of a collection. Normally, you'd produce limited editions prints of individual artworks. I will close the collection when the project is over, and number them accordingly. 

 

IMPACT & PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE

    "Welcome to the Neighboorhood" will document LA in a way that's never been seen before. In addition, you will be owning a valuable, limited-edition artwork. 

    In 2015, I embarked on a similar journey to explore my Ecuadorian heritage. I successfully created surreal artworks, encasing the span of the country. In addition, created a follow-up short video exposing my artistic process, and inspirations.

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

These cityscapes can take as little as 20 hours, and upwards of 160 hours to complete. I've never attempted to create an entire body of work in a short span of time. I'm confident that I will finish these artworks in the allotted timeframe. Over the years, I've organized my work flow, speeding up the process and making it as efficient as possible. 

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

Sharing and talking about this project is one of the most helpful things you can do. Please comment, and share. Additionally, let me know what you'd like to see in these cityscapes. Your input is greatly appreciated!

I will close the collection when the project is over, and number them accordingly.  IMPACT & PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE    "Welcome to the Neighboorhood" will document LA in a way that's never been seen before. In addition, you will be owning a valuable, limited-edition artwork.     In 2015, I embarked on a similar journey to explore my Ecuadorian heritage. I successfully created surreal artworks, encasing the span of the country. In addition, created a follow-up short video exposing my artistic process, and inspirations. RISKS & CHALLENGESThese cityscapes can take as little as 20 hours, and upwards of 160 hours to complete. I've never attempted to create an entire body of work in a short span of time. I'm confident that I will finish these artworks in the allotted timeframe. Over the years, I've organized my work flow, speeding up the process and making it as efficient as possible.  OTHER WAYS TO HELPSharing and talking about this project is one of the most helpful things you can do. Please comment, and share. Additionally, let me know what you'd like to see in these cityscapes. Your input is greatly appreciated!

story:
A pupil once asked his master: "How can I serve others?"
He replied: "There is no other".

ONE is an artwork about self/collective reflection. As observers stand in front of the work, they will face ME. The very moment they read the word ME, observers will simultaneously encounter WE in its reflection. Both exist together. The inherent connectivity between ME and WE stands as a reminder of our nature: we are all ONE.  



ONE is a call for empathy, compassion and non-judgement, breaking down barriers and bringing people together. It reminds us that we do not live in a binary world of WE and ME, but rather an intersectional world, where everything is connected.

Just as both words and meanings reside within the single sculpture, ME and WE live, survive and grow simultaneously as ONE.

Come together!

Right now, ONE is only a fragment of "ME", a vision. However, it needs "WE" to come to life at Burning Man 2018. That is why we need your support to raise $8,000 - which will cover the costs of this artwork's materials, construction and transportation from Los Angeles to Black Rock City, as well as the fees taken out by IndieGogo (totalling 8%).  Any donation amount will be so appreciated, and will go a long way!
 

A Giant Step for Womankind

In supporting ONE, you will also help its creator to become the
FIRST BRAZILIAN FEMALE ARTIST to bring an art installation to Burning Man. Contamos com sua ajuda, Brasil! 

Whose Idea Was This?

Stephanie Sartori is a Brazilian fashion designer, artist and writer living in Los Angeles. She holds Burning Man close to her heart as this is where she reconnected with her creative voice years ago. Stephanie has dedicated the last years to sewing at BM, helping citizens in need of clothing alterations or fashion aid.

This will be her fifth year at BRC, and her first bringing an artwork to the Playa. She is building ONE alongside a team of lovely volunteers. 

Want to Know More?

The word sculpture reads ME in block letters. A large-scale mirror (approx. 16' by 9') , placed on the ground right in front of the letters, reflects ME into the word WE. Each letter is 7-8 feet high and 6 feet wide and 1.5 feet thick. Both letters are fixed directly into the ground.

The base of the letters is made of plywood, which will be entirely covered with mirrored squares, as seen in disco balls. The application of mirrors on clothing and other objects is a trademark of Stephanie Sartori's. 

The mirrors permit the act of reflection: the self-reflection of participants who will see themselves in the installation, as well as the reflection of the sun and lights - which will capture the attention of observers, near or far. 
 

Understanding your $UPPORT:

Right now, ONE is an entirely self-funded project. It will be built with the aid of volunteers, but nevertheless, its costs are high (mirrors and acrylic panels are to blame). 

Your donations will help pay for: 

  • Construction materials and tools
  • The laser cutting of mirrors/acrylic panels
  • Rent for the building space
  • LEDs for night lighting and safety signage 
  • Transportation from Los Angeles to Black Rock City and back

If we do not achieve our full funding goal, we will use less expensive (and less durable) materials and try our best to bring the installation to life nevertheless. That is why we say that any amount will go along way!


THANK YOU SO MUCH!
MUITO OBRIGADA!

Even if you can't make a donation, you can also help by sharing about ONE and its campaign with others! If you would like to connect with us, please email us at stephaniesartori@gmail.com

A special THANK YOU to:
LUIZA CAMPOS for our video 
VANESSA ADAO and RICHARD LOVELESS for our renderings
RAPHAEL MAMBERTI + AHLMA for video images of Burning Man 2017
RAUL ARAGAO for some of the above photos

story:
My name is Nick Salter, I am a third year student at CU Denver's Digital Design program. This year, they have a 20 day Summer Study Abroad program in Scandanavian Design, in Copenhagen, and I have thrown my hat in the ring to go.

The study abroad program in Copenhagen, a 20 day intensive design course with extensive tours and interviews with top design companies, game companies, architecture companies, etc,  is core to my reason for going, it will be a precious view of a completely integrated approach to design, that will include a field trip to Stockholm Sweden as well. I am also planning on extending my stay, and doing an “Art Tour” of Europe, (depending on funding), via Eurail and staying with friends along the way. My “target” art and European city tour looks like this:

Copenhagen -20 day intensive design classes and workshop

Germany- 4 days visiting a friend of the family and hitting the museums in Berlin. Berlin has major exhibitions with art works from across the ages – starting with masterpieces from the classical and modern world on Museum Island, including the legendary bust of Egyptian Queen Nefertiti.

Romania- My high school art teacher is from there, and she is finding places for me to stay, and recommending various museums there as well. I am also a bit curious of its cultural similarities to Brazil (I come from a bilingual household and my mothers family lives in Brazil).

Istanbul- This is my dream spot, the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, and more.

Greece- Parthenon, Athens, the birthplace of Western civilization.

Italy- Florence, Rome, Venice, from the classic Roman art and architecture to the flower of the Renaissance.

France-Lyons and Paris, the Louvre, Palais de Versailles.

London- The British Museum, (housing the "plunder" of the British Empire), from the Rosetta Stone to exquisite Tibetan Buddhist art.

My project goals are to record, photograph, write and document my trip, from a few perspectives.

As an American student abroad. I worry about the impact of the xenophobic administration on both American and international perspectives. I believe that we have a lot to learn from each other, but this is my moment to bring back some of the best of what I find and share it with my peers and fellow citizens.

As an artist, this trip to Scandinavia will be mostly exploring cutting edge design concepts and work, and ultimately how “design thinking” (the art of solving human problems) works when we work together. On the other hand, I am extending my stay, (a week? A month? A summer?) to see first hand the fruits of Western civilization as reflected in the greatest art and architecture of Europe. I want to find a way to integrate the old, even ancient, and the new, into my creative life.

Its the biggest thing I have ever done in my life, so far.

I plan to not only gather this information, but to create a number of “work products”, ranging from the trivial (but cool!)  t-shirts to an introspective multimedia art journal, and then to create video essays about the places and things I will be seeing!

Obviously very ambitious, which is why I am writing to you! This exchange program and extended trip will not even be possible without outside support. I saved a few thousand by working construction all last summer, along with my work study job and some design gigs, and in fact took the plunge to buy my flight tickets early to save money, and have enough left over to get my Eurail pass. A scary decision, since they are not easily refundable, but I decided to go big and do my best. I found out that the college will grant me at least $1400 toward the $5300 study abroad program, (which does not include travel) but that is not enough. However, I received some scholarships also through the school that cover me up to two thirds of my tuition for Copenhagen!

So I am breaking down my needs into two big buckets. I need to raise/earn at least $1500 to finish the basic cost of the program. That gets me to Europe for the 20 day exchange program. Then, with the Eurail pass in hand, I need a minimum of about $40 a day average room and board to make my way to see the great museums, buildings and art treasures of Europe. Starting at the 10th of June out of Copenhagen, and coming home from London on the 2nd of August, that means about 50 days, times $40-$50 (depending on what part of Europe), or about $2000 minimum if I am frugal and lucky.

I am both already, as we have people willing to put me up in Germany (2) Romania (2) Greece (1), Austria (2), Italy (3), France (2) and London (1), with possibilities in Hungary and looking for help in Istanbul.

So, I am launching this IndieGoGo crowdfunding campaign to help with those expenses. I may have to cut the travel back a bit, or dramatically, but I am hopeful that I can take full advantage of this once in a lifetime opportunity to experience both the best of cutting edge modern design and drink up the ancient and classical art of the ages.

As ambitious as this seems, I am hopeful that you can help me, even with just $20 or $40 dollars, the cost of a meal, or a day's room and board, and I can put together enough to live this dream fully and creatively. Still looking for more friends and family to stay with in Europe, (and I need a really good back pack), so if you know of other ways you can help, I am all ears.

I want all of you to feel like you are going on this journey with me, so as part of that will be committed to giving back various “perks”. I thought about these as “what would I like if one of my friends went and I wanted to support them?” while still following my strengths of digital and analog art.

So, for those that choose to support this wild quest, I will be creating the following items for my patrons, large and small.

A Recipe and Food Ebook- OK, part of this journey is cultural, and what is more cultural than food? I will gather recipes where I can, take in-context pics of the people and food I discover, and include a few things I try that I cannot get the recipes for, but that you should know about when you go. More like an eBook.

A physical Food and Recipe calendar of the above!

An Art Tour Ebook- I am creating a printed Art Tour Calendar for my $100 patrons to hang on the wall. For this perk, a digital version of that in the form of an Ebook, with 12 of the best art images I capture on my journey through Europe's greatest museums, churches and relics. This will include some personal reflections and facts about the images.

The physical calendar from these images. The Hagia Sophia and Bernini’s David amongst the must see exhibits I hope to capture on film and in sketches.

T-Shirts designed by me- I have designed multiple t-shirts for my church group in the past, they can choose that or one that I will be personally designing from my experience there, as a thank you. (I expect to be quite inspired by the design school projects!)

My Art Journey Ebook- This Ebook will include some of the art, recipes, personal stories, and some video of my Art Tour. This will be the closest to going on the journey with me, with lots of extras, miscellaneous digital versions of my sketches, silliness, learning and stories. Think of it as a multimedia scrapbook, but with a thread and a journey to tell a tale.

I will make a personal sketch of some of the artwork/architecture pieces I will be seeing. I will choose together with my patrons the piece of work before I go so that I am sure to see it live. This will be an original, signed, one of a kind, though I request the digital rights to it.

I am going to create video essays. I will be posting them online for the public as well as trying to get other people to take the leap and study abroad. I will share a “post-mortem”, the good, the bad, and the ugly of the whole process, fundraising, travel and results, so it can help others stretch as well.

I hesitated to put this out there, as this campaign is not for a cure for cancer, or some other noble cause. It is simply to support one artist's thirst to learn, a kind of art pilgrimage or walkabout. For those of you who do not even know me, I cannot fathom what might move you to support me, so I thank you from the bottom of my heart. Will it change the world? Unlikely. Will it change my life and perspective for the better? Absolutely. Will you enjoy coming along for the ride? I sure hope so. Please share this, and I am wide open to more ideas for artwork, food, locations, and people to meet on this journey.

story:
Bridging Art and Business

Art World Forum was founded by Anni Oates and Veronica Neo in Singapore in 2016 in reaction to a lack of independent global platforms that invited the expertise and insight of art and thought leaders to network and engage in market-led discussions.

As Asia’s only art business conference organiser, with expansion events in Europe, Art World Forum has attracted over 500 art and business professionals last year.

As a platform that values innovation and inclusion, we aim to broaden audiences with an interest in the art industry, strengthen our platform that brings the arts to you, and finance our upcoming events in London and Singapore.

We Need Your Support

As a start-up, we are proud to have collaborated with renowned organisations, reputable institutions and experienced speakers. As we are in it for the long term, we need a helping hand to sustain our business at this early stage while our network grows, our discussions strengthen, and we establish Art World Forum in the world’s key art markets. 

Our crowdfunding goal of $30,000 will help us cover expenses, logistics, marketing outreach and audio-visual documentation at our upcoming events in Singapore and London. For your commitment and financial contributions, we are offering early bird tickets, branding and speaking opportunities and access to all our post-event materials.  

 

Lasting Impacts

Networking is the key element at our global events which have already attracted over 500 art and business professionals (from more than 20 countries) in Singapore, Hong Kong, Berlin, and Florence since 2016 and London later this year.

Our speakers and sponsors gain invaluable market exposure at our global events, online and in the art press, have been approached to sit on advisory boards and have been nominated for awards. Our guests get to interact with highly active and recognisable names in the art industry, question the unfamiliar, while meeting the key people that propel their businesses to ever greater levels.

At Art World Forum, we are a unique platform that has the capacity to become the flag carrier of art business conferences and events globally. We position ourselves as mediators of lasting partnerships, motivators of informational clarity in the art market, and cross-pollinators of the creative sectors and their thought leaders.

 

Spread the Word!

We are very grateful for all the support we get, and every contribution and pledged perk gets us closer to our goal. 

We kindly ask that you contribute and share the link so we may reach as many art collectors, dealers, investors, owners, exhibitors and overall art lovers, who would like to join us and share our mission in providing a quality-led platform for arts-led networking and market-driven discussions.

story:
Summary

(Une version française apparaît après la version anglaise).

Who I am

Hello. My name is Natali Leduc. I build interactive sculptures, I do performances and experimental puppet shows. You can view two of my previous projects here:

  • The Churnatron 1400, a two-story bicycle for 4 riders that churns ice cream: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=58mtlkLWpCI
  • The Tunatron 2000.03, a mobile bottle organ: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rHG05IXIuMs

I am a founding member of the American Consumer Consortium, a group of artists with a sense of humor. We are interested in the way people interact within society, with objects, and with the environment.

 

The Project

The Jokeatron 5200 is an interactive large-scale sculpture (12ft tall x 24ft diameter). It’s a banana peel made out of steel that a prankster robot threw on the ground. Inside the Jokeatron 5200, you can record a joke of your choice, which gets broadcast around the sculpture. All jokes are followed by prerecorded laughs.

This is my most ambitious project so far. I am very excited, and I hope that it will lead me to more challenging projects.

As a contributor, you will help me and my team to achieve a beautiful, sturdy, safe and fun interactive large-scale sculpture that thousands of people will enjoy... maybe even yourself! It will be shown at Burning Man 2018, and, if everything goes according to the plan, the central section of the Jokeatron 5200 will be previewed at the Festival de la francophonie in Victoria, BC, Canada (June 23-24, 2018). I am looking for more venues beyond Burning Man, so who knows? The Jokeatron 5200 might come to your town...

By contributing, you will also help sending to Burning Man the only Canadian project that was awarded an honorarium grant from Burning Man this year.

For more information about Burning Man, click here: https://burningman.org/

 

The Team

Nichole Hamilton, Esther Mera, Charles Shoemaker, Nine Reed-Mera, John Reed, Jon Alloway, Dana Albany, Flash Hopkins, Albanie Noël, and Natali Leduc

 

What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution will be used for :

  • Materials & Tools
  • Lighting / Electrical
  • Sound
  • Transportation
  • Fabrication
  • Insurance

In addition to our immense gratitude, we have some fun perks to offer you:

  • Album of the best jokes recorded at Burning Man (MP3)
  • Sticker pack
  • Little homemade books (the latest one is entitled Bob Dylan and the Banana Peel)
  • Very cool banana hats
  • Weird quirky jewelry (Jon said I should include jewelry)
  • Stationery (yes, you read that correctly)
  • Unique banana-poems written just for you and sent through the mail
  • A very cool photo of a skeleton on a banana
  • Chainsaw poem excerpt residue (uh?)
  • American Consumer Leaukatrons (what is that?)
  • Selection of crazy consumer letters
  • Surprise gift
  • Four sculptures made out of wood and bicycle inner tubes

Note: some of the perks might be mailed before October 2018.

 

The Impact

By contributing to the Jokeatron 5200, you will help spreading some much needed joy in the world.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you pay taxes in the USA, you can make a tax-deductible donation to our project through the Burning Man Project, a 501(c)(3) organization. Click here to make a donation: http://bit.ly/Jokeatron5200

If you prefer sending a check or using Paypal, please contact me (click on "ask a question" at the top of the page, next to my name).

If you cannot contribute financially, please help to get the word out. Share this campaign with your friends, through e-mail or through your favorite social media (Indiegogo says to remind you of their very fine share tools).

 

Updates

The I-beam base and wooden platform are finished. The frame is under construction. It starts to look like a banana peel.

Check our Facebook page for updates and more photos. https://www.facebook.com/jokeatron5200/?ref=br_rs

 

 

Thank you a thousand times for your support.

 

__________________________________________

 

En bref

Qui je suis

Bonjour. Je m'appelle Natali Leduc. Je fais des sculptures interactives, des performances et des spectacles de marionnettes expérimentaux. Vous pouvez voir deux de mes réalisations ici:

  • Le Churnatron 1400, une bicyclette à deux étages pour quatre cyclistes qui fait de la crème glacée: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=58mtlkLWpCI
  • Le Tunatron 2000.03, un orgue à bouteilles mobile: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rHG05IXIuMs

Je suis co-fondatrice de l'American Consumer Consortium, un groupe d'artistes avec un sens de l'humour. Nous nous intéressons à la façon dont les gens agissent en société et à leur façon d'interagir avec les objets et l'environnement.

 

Le projet

Le Jokeatron 5200 est une sculpture géante interactive en acier (12’ de haut x 24’ de diamètre) qui représente une peau de banane qu’un robot farceur aurait jetée sur le sol. Le Jokeatron 5200 se veut un point de rencontre pour l’humour de tous les horizons. Les participants sont invités à entrer dans la partie centrale du Jokeatron 5200 et à y enregistrer une blague de leur choix, qui est ensuite diffusée autour de la sculpture. Toutes les blagues sont suivies de rires pré-enregistrés.

C'est mon projet le plus ambitieux à ce jour. Je suis très contente d'avoir la chance de le réaliser et j'espère qu'il mènera à d'autres défis encore plus grands.

En tant que contributeur, vous m'aiderez ainsi que mon équipe à réaliser une sculpture géante, belle, sécuritaire, robuste et amusante dont profiteront des milliers de personnes... peut-être même vous! Le Jokeatron 5200 sera présenté à Burning Man en 2018, et, si tout va comme prévu, la section centrale du Jokeatron 5200 fera une avant-première au Festival de la francophonie à Victoria, en Colombie-Britannique (les 23 et 24 juin). Je cherche d'autres occasions de l'exposer au-delà de Burning Man. Alors qui sait? Peut-être que le Jokeatron 5200 viendra près de chez vous...

En contribuant, vous aiderez également à envoyer à Burning Man le seul projet canadien à avoir reçu une subvention de Burning Man cette année.

Pour plus d'information sur Burning Man, cliquez ici: https://burningman.org/

 

L'équipe

Nichole Hamilton, Esther Mera, Charles Shoemaker, Nine Reed-Mera, John Reed, Jon Alloway, Dana Albany, Flash Hopkins, Albanie Noël, et Natali Leduc

 

Ce dont nous avons besoin & ce que vous recevrez

Nous utiliserons votre contribution pour :

  • Les matériaux & les outils
  • L'éclairage et l'électricité
  • Le son
  • Le transport
  • La fabrication
  • Les assurances

En plus de notre immense reconnaissance, nous avons des cadeaux amusants à vous offrir :

  • Un album des meilleures blagues enregistrées à Burning Man (MP3)
  • Un ensemble d'autocollants
  • Des petits livres faits main (le dernier a pour titre Dalida et la peau de banane)
  • Des chapeaux bananes super cool
  • Des bijoux étranges un peu stupides (Jon m'a dit que je devais inclure des bijoux)
  • Du papier à lettre (oui, oui, vous avez bien lu)
  • Des poèmes-bananes uniques écrits spécialement pour vous et acheminés par la poste
  • Une photo super cool d'un squelette sur une banane
  • Un extrait de résidu de poème à la tronçonneuse (hein?)
  • Des leaukatrons de l'American Consumer Consortium (mais qu'est-ce que c'est que cela?)
  • Une sélection de lettres de consommateur drôles
  • Un cadeau surprise
  • Quatre sculptures faites de bois et de chambres à air

Note: Certains cadeaux pourraient être envoyés avant octobre 2018.

 

L'impact

En contribuant au Jokeatron 5200, vous aiderez à répandre de la joie dans le monde, ce dont nous avons grandement besoin.

 

D'autres façons d'aider

Si vous payez des impôts aux États-Unis, vous pouvez faire une contribution déductible d'impôts auprès de Burning Man Project, un organisme caritatif 501(c)(3). Cliquez ici pour faire un don: http://bit.ly/Jokeatron5200

Si vous préférez envoyer un chèque ou contribuer via Paypal, contactez-moi (cliquez sur "ask a question" en haut de la page, près de mon nom).

Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer financièrement, vous pouvez nous aider en faisant connaître le projet. Partagez cette campagne avec vos amis, par e-mail ou sur vos médias sociaux favoris (Indiegogo dit de vous rappeler d'utiliser leurs outils de partage).

 

Des nouvelles

La base faite de poutres d'acier ainsi que la plateforme en bois sont terminées. L'armature est présentement en construction. Ça commence à ressembler à une peau de banane.

Visitez notre page Facebook pour rester au courant des derniers développements et pour voir plus de photos. https://www.facebook.com/jokeatron5200/?ref=br_rs

 

 

Merci mille fois de votre soutien.

Summary

Who I am
Hello. My name is Natali Leduc. I build interactive sculptures, I do performances and experimental puppet shows. You can view two of my previous projects here:


The Churnatron 1400, a two-story bicycle for 4 riders that churns ice cream: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=58mtlkLWpCI


The Tunatron 2000.03, a mobile bottle organ: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rHG05IXIuMs


I am a founding member of the American Consumer Consortium, a group of artists with a sense of humor. We are interested in the way people interact within society, with objects, and with the environment.
 
The Project
The Jokeatron 5200 is an interactive large-scale sculpture (12ft tall x 24ft diameter). It’s a banana peel made out of steel that a prankster robot threw on the ground. Inside the Jokeatron 5200, you can record a joke of your choice, which gets broadcast around the sculpture. All jokes are followed by prerecorded laughs.
This is my most ambitious project so far. I am very excited, and I hope that it will lead me to more challenging projects.

As a contributor, you will help me and my team to achieve a beautiful, sturdy, safe and fun interactive large-scale sculpture that thousands of people will enjoy... maybe even yourself! It will be shown at Burning Man 2018, and, if everything goes according to the plan, the central section of the Jokeatron 5200 will be previewed at the Festival de la francophonie in Victoria, BC, Canada (June 23-24, 2018). I am looking for more venues beyond Burning Man, so who knows? The Jokeatron 5200 might come to your town...
By contributing, you will also help sending to Burning Man the only Canadian project that was awarded an honorarium grant from Burning Man this year.
For more information about Burning Man, click here: https://burningman.org/

story:
All About Me

My name is Mae and for several years, I have been in love with the world of art first through art therapy then later through special needs art camp and online classes. My family and I discovered early on that nothing helps me cope with my anxiety like art does. I can let everything else fade into the background, immersing myself fully in the project that I have in front of me. It is an escape, but it is also a form of sharing, a way for me to connect with the outside world.

Even though I am only in 7th grade, I already own and operate my own business called Mae I Design. I have worked hard to win legitimacy for my brand and as an artist, earning enough money to attend camps, buy supplies, take classes, and expand. My years of practicing and learning every day are starting to pay off with my biggest accomplishment so far being given the opportunity to attend ClexaCon as a vendor. This is where you come in.

My Goal

I am looking to raise $897.00 in order to cover part of the costs of Mae I Design being represented at ClexaCon.   I've been working hard and raised the money for the majority of the expenses. The money raised through this campaign will be used to help pay for:

  • Convention  Business WiFi Costs- $225 
  • Convention Business Electricity- $135
  • Art Supplies & Show Equipment- $315
  • Air fare- $222

 Every dollar towards this goal helps immensely, and by supporting me, you will be supporting my goal of being a young entrepreneur who will be able to help other kids like me in the future.  This is a chance that many kids my age never get so I really REALLY want to achieve my goal so that I can share the art that helps me cope with my anxiety and PTSD.

I appreciate all of your help, and I thank you for taking the time to read about what I am doing.

story:
I am Camila Restrepo

from Medellín, Colombia. I am an artist in development. I dance, I sing, I perform and I create through Illustration. 

Always been an Arts lover, but for the first time in 3 years I decided to take my drawings into a new place: Instagram. Not only for posting and sharing what I do, but to be an artistic influence to other people. 

In my work I use anything as inspiration; Could be the sun, or the nature, people or fantasies, spiritualism and science. 

Come and be part of this creative process I am just starting and expand with me!

 

Economics

The fundings for my campaign will be destinated to create a full brand which includes: printables,clothing,materials,Digital exposition,creative projects and all of this with one specific purpouse: TAKING MY ART TO EUROPE! 

which takes us to the second phase: Once I take my art to Europe, what would I do? Keep expanding with the simultaneous process of looking for galleries and sponsors. for that moment I must have minimum 3 Big expositions, including all the process of printing, stamping, framing and shipping, plus the fees and production.

There is so many people looking for investors to fund their campaigns, and mine cannot be an extraodinary one in this page. but it's my personal project. Is my north and my daily motivation.It's my seed to this world and my internal motor. I won't ever stop drawing, and dreaming about this beautiful process that is becoming an artist in development.

 

I can't promise you any extraordinary in exchange for your support. but be sure, I will never forget the impact you had in my carreer as an artist, and don't get too surprised if in the next few years a big canvas with my art is sent to you as a pure gest of grattitude.

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP?

 

Follow me on Instagram!:

 

 (spread the word )

https://instagram.com/ahincol?utm_source=ig_pro...

BE MY FAN!, simple.

Emotional support is important!

story:
In 2018, Digital Dalang became the first Indonesian art project to be awarded funding from Burning Man. The interactive art installation combines traditional wayang kulit shadow puppetry with motion reactive projection mapping. Digital Dalang was handpicked by the festival’s founder, Larry Harvey, to receive an Honoraria Art Grant and he shortlisted the project as one he was most excited to see. Sadly, due to his untimely passing, Larry never got to see the project in action when they debuted Burning Man iRobot to much appraise. Since its premiere at the annual, weeklong gathering in Black Rock City, Digital Dalang has gone on to tour the globe at various festivals, raising funds for local causes whilst promoting the cultural arts.

 

Performing for no profit, the project is now faced with considerable  taxes that threaten the future of this cultural collaboration. Our goal is to raise the $2,500 needed to pay off this debt and all funds received will help the project continue its mission. Digital Dalang was recently invited to be partially funded to perform in Nevada City and any additional funds received from this campaign will be used to realize this tour. The campaign’s stretch goal of $7,500 will not only be sufficient to save the project but also support a self financed return to Burning Man this year.

 

In addition to the authentic Indonesian memorabilia the project gifted to donors last year, this campaign will also be offering new unique perks. A limited edition run of gold print artworks, painted and signed by the lead artist Ali Agus, who stenciled the image from one of the original custom wayang kulit puppets used at Burning Man 2018 as well as a one-off metal engraved framed wayang puppet in tribute to Larry Harvey.

 

To date, Digital Dalang has raised over $1,000 in funding, contributed directly to preserving the world’s rainforests, tsunami victims in Indonesia and cultural art programs. Your donations will help Digital Dalang retain the specialty projection equipment needed to resume their project and multiply this contribution ten fold.

 

In the event that this campaign does not reach its target, Digital Dalang will be forced to sell off their projection equipment to pay off their taxes but will use any funding received for equipment rental of planned future installations of the project. Every contribution helps and even the sharing of this campaign is worth its weight in gold. If you are interested in supporting the project in other ways, contact: digitaldalang@gmail.com

 

Bersama (together) we can keep the dream of cultural collaboration for a cause alive!

Terima Kasih (thank you). - Ali Agus (Digital Dalang Creator)
