story:
(See Portuguese & German translations at the end / Veja a versão em português no final /Siehe portugiesische und deutsche Übersetzungen am Ende)

 

What is this project about and why do we need you

Big Snake Ziggzagging in Me is a multi-disciplinary art project that creates immersive, online and live art experiences. It is co-created by photographer and Shaman Dhan Ribeiro (Brazil), actress and performance artist Kyara Orlando (Brazil, UK) and artist, performer and curator Katerina Barampouti (Greece, UK). We joined forces to decisively tell a story: how powerful we, as humans, can be when we allow enchantment into our lives; when we attune to our sacredness and consciousness. So, we want to give you a taste of that.

We offer an experience that reflects upon how we relate to the environment, the elements of nature and to ourselves. Through a photographic narrative by Dhan Ribeiro, a solo performance by Kyara Orlando and related art events (workshops, Q&A, discussions, short performances) directed and curated by Katerina Barampouti. Big Snake Ziggzagging in Me evokes the enchantment and mysteries of our world. This project suggests a creative relationship with life, it refers to the myth of the Great Cobra (Cobra Grande) that permeates the Amazonian territory which represents the fertile life force that we carry within our DNA and that is perpetually creating and connecting all beings.

Have a look at our virtual exhibition with some of Dhan's photographs:

https://www.artsteps.com/view/607c9ca3fd9455a4fd6b9da1

This project was launched online on 12th November 2020 with an online performance, Q&A and a short workshop. A virtual exhibition is currently taking place, which you can access on the link above. The photography exhibition that includes live performances will take place in London at The Koppel Project Hive Gallery from July 2021 (until 6 August 2021).

This is where we need your help, to manifest the aforementioned exhibition. The Koppel Project is generously supporting us with an exhibition space in the heart of London (www.thekoppelproject.com) and by producing and managing the project. Your financial support will fund: materials, installation equipments, digital equipment, high quality prints for the exhibition, props for the performance, documenting and marketing costs. 

Help us spread the word, trusting in the power of art to inspire, educate and challenge human perception. Expressed through visuals, sounds, movement, storytelling, environmental art-ivism and shamanism. You can can be part of this!

Lastly, we look forward to seeing you at our live exhibition and/or virtual events.

Our deepest gratitude.

What we need & what you get

In essence, funds will go to:
 
  • 70% Production costs in the UK including all materials (i.e. paper, clips, nails, stands), high quality prints, audio-visual equipments, technical requirements and insurance. 
  • 20% Artists/performers travel, prep and rehearsals expenses.
  • 10% Admin & marketing.

If the campaign exceeds its goal, then any additional fund will go towards the artist's out-of-pocket expenses. Additional funds will also be donated to the Terra Mirim Foundation, which is the shamanic community where the photos of this exhibition where taken. Terra Mirim is located in Bahia-Brazil, in a preserved area of the Atlantic Forest and depends on donations like this to continue its tireless work of receiving people from all over the world who are seeking healing and a life path of communion and co-creation with nature.

If the campaign does not reach its full goal, it will still be of great help as any amount will subsidise part of the costs. No donation is too small, we are extremely grateful for your collaboration and support. 

Perks!

To show our gratitude we've prepared various perk for you - including the opportunity to experience this project first hand. Here's a list of some perks we are offering:

1) A ticket to see Kyara Orlando's live private-view performance in London, in July 2021. 

2) A place to participate in Kyara Orlando's Four Elements Creative Flow workshop either online (June) or in person in London (July). 

3) A place to participate in Katerina Barampouti's Creative Mindfulness workshop either online (August) or in person in London (July).

4) A high-quality print of one of Dhan Ribeiro's photographs, 3 different sizes available.

5) An A5 photographic booklet of the exhibition and A6 postcards of the photos .

Risks & challenges

We trust and hope that everyone will be in good health. Considering the current worldwide crisis and any unforeseen events, we are determined to make this project happen and share a truly meaningful and constructive experience with our audience. We are flexible and able to reschedule the exhibition and presentation dates and to do additional virtual events.

We have been putting together art events for more than two decades. We aim to use sustainable, fair trade material. 

Project description - the myth and the experience

The myth of the 'Great Cobra' ('Cobra Grande' in Portuguese) permeates the Amazonian territory. Its presence is felt along the great rivers and the wide and open expanses of the Brazilian savannas. The story of an ancient cosmic presence in the form of a feathered snake, also known as 'The Enchanted One' or 'Caianinha', is passed down from genaration to genaration through storytelling by the indigenous people of the forest. The myth of an enchanted snake that brings life to this planet and to humans, weave into our playful and sacred imagination. Metaphorically, we are born from the womb of 'Mother Earth' ('Pachamama') as we all carry within us the same seed that reflects our oneness with everything and the great diversity and abundance of this planet. 

The 'Cobra Grande - Big Snake Ziggzagging in Me' photograpy exhibition shares the essence of the 'Cobra Grande' myth. It's about the creature that zigzags along the banks of the river, fertilising itself and the riverside dwellers who watch it flow towards the great cosmic ocean. It is an attempt to depict and reveal the matrimonial dance of 'Cobra Grande' who becomes empregnated through the fertility that emanates from the Magical Kingdom of the Enchanted People of the Forest.

Performing actress Kyara Orlando expressed the mythical relationship between the visible and the invisible, embodying the spirit of the 'Enchanted Serpent' through a shamanic performance in the dark waters of the Itamboatá river. Photographer and Shaman Dhan Ribeiro documented this process creating a visual record that resulted in a narrative composted of 45 coloured photographs. The first rays of sunshine that bathed the space with a golden light generated depth and contrast in the images, thus enabling the narrative to develop within a beautiful concept of pure magical realism. Supported by a soundscape of tribal songs and sounds of the forest, this exhibition invites the viewer to immerse in the ancestral space of the people of the forest. 

​Katerina Barampouti will curate a sacred space for Kyara Orlando and Dhan Ribeiro to deliver the Cobra Grande mythical experience. She will also invite other creatives and thinkers to exchange views on the subject and share practices and knowledge.

Who we are

https://www.dhanribeiro.com/sobre-mim

https://kyaraorlando.wixsite.com/mysite

https://www.katerina-barampouti.com/about

Other ways you can help

If you cannot financially contribute,  there are other ways you can help us:

  • Spread the word, share this campaign on your social media and help us create a buzz. 
  • Like our Big Snake Ziggzagging in Me Facebook page and leave a comment to support its visibility. Here is the link:  https://www.facebook.com/bigsnakeziggzagging 
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Our deepest gratitude.

____________________________________________________________________________________

Tradução em português

Sobre o que é esse projeto e porque precisamos de você

Cobra Grande Ziguezagueando em Mim é um projeto artístico multidisciplinar que cria experiências artísticas imersivas, presenciais e online. É uma co-criação entre o fotógrafo e xamã Dhan Ribeiro (Brasil), a atriz e performer Kyara Orlando (Brasil, Reino Unido) e a artista, performer e curadora Katerina Barampouti (Grécia, Reino Unido). Juntamos forças para contar uma história de forma decisiva: como nós, humanos, podemos nos tornar mais fortes se abrimos espaço para o encantamento em nossas vidas; quando estamos conscientes e sintonizados com nossa própria sacralidade. Então, queremos lhe proporcionar um gostinho disso.

Oferecemos uma experiência que reflete sobre como nos relacionamos com o meio ambiente, os elementos da natureza e com nós mesmos. Através de uma narrativa fotográfica de Dhan Ribeiro, uma performance solo de Kyara Orlando e eventos artísticos (workshops, painel de conversas, debates, performances curtas) com direção e curadoria de Katerina Barampouti. Cobra Grande Ziguezagueando em Mim evoca o encantamento e os mistérios do nosso mundo. Esse projeto sugere uma relação criativa com a vida, tendo como referência o mito da Cobra Grande que permeia o território Amazônico e representa a força vital fértil que carregamos em nosso DNA e que está perpetualmente criando e conectando todos os seres.

Veja a nossa exposição virtual com algumas das fotografias de Dhan:

https://www.artsteps.com/view/607c9ca3fd9455a4f...

Cobra Grande Ziguezagueando em Mim foi lançado online no dia 12 de novembro de 2020 com uma performance online, um painel de discussão e um workshop. Uma exposição virtual, que você pode acessar no link acima, está acontecendo até meados de junho. A exposição fotográfica que inclui performances presenciais acontecerá em Londres na galeria Hive do The Koppel Project em julho de 2021 (até 6 de Agosto de 2021).

É ai que precisamos da sua ajuda, para manifestar a performance-exposição mencionada. The Koppel Project está generosamente nos apoiando com uma galeria no centro de Londres (www.thekoppelproject.com) e produzindo e administrando esse projeto. Seu apoio financeiro será revestido para financiar: materiais, equipamentos de instalação, equipamentos digitais, impressão em alta qualidade, materiais cênicos, custos de documentação e divulgação. 

Nos ajude a divulgar essa campanha, confiando no poder que a arte tem de inspirar, educar e desafiar a percepção humana. Expressa por meio de recursos visuais, sonoros, movimento, histórias contadas, art-ivismo ambiental e xamanismo.  Você pode fazer parte disso!

Finalmente, esperamos vê-los em nossa exposição presencialmente ou em nossos eventos virtuais.

Nossa mais profunda gratidão.

O que precisamos & o que você receberá

Essencialmente, os fundos irão para:

  • 70% Custos de produção no Reino Unido incluindo todos os materiais (ex. papel, clips, pregos, linhas, plataformas), impressões em alta qualidade, equipamentos audio-visuais, seguro e todos os requerimentos técnicos.
  • 20% Despesas de trabalho, ensaios e viagens dos artistas/performers.
  • 10% Administração e marketing.

Se a campanha exceder seu objetivo, qualquer fundo extra irá para cobrir despesas pagas pelos próprios artistas. Fundos adicionais também serão revestidos para a Fundação Terra Mirim, comunidade xamânica onde as fotos foram feitas. Terra Mirim fica na Bahia,Brasil, numa área de preservação da Mata Atlântica e conta com doações como essa para continuar o trabalho incansável de receber pessoas do mundo inteiro que procuram cura e um caminho de vida em comunhão e co-criação com a natureza. 

Se a campanha não alcançar seu objetivo total, ainda assim será de grande ajuda pois o valor arrecadado pagará parte dos custos. Nenhuma doação é pequena demais, estamos muito gratos pela sua colaboração e apoio. 

Vantagens!

Para mostrar nossa gratidão, preparamos diversos tipos de vantagens para vocês – incluindo a oportunidade de experienciar esse projeto em primeira mão. Aqui está a lista de algumas das vantagens que estamos oferecendo:

1) Um ingresso para a performance de Kyara Orlando em Londres, em julho 2021

2) Um lugar para participar do workshop de Kyara Orlando Fluxo Criativo com Os Quatro Elementos. Presencialmente em Londres em julho ou online em junho. 

3) Um lugar para o workshop de Katerina Barampouti Mindfulness Criativo. Presencialmente em Londres em julho ou online em agosto.

4) Uma impressão em alta qualidade e uma das fotografias de Dhan Ribeiro, disponíveis em três tamanhos diferentes.

5) Um livreto da exposição em A5 e cartões postais das fotos em A6.

Riscos e desafios

Esperamos que todos estejam em boa saúde. Considerando a atual crise mundial e quaisquer eventos imprevistos, estamos determinados a realizar esse projeto e compartilhar uma experiência verdadeiramente significativa e construtiva com nosso público. Somos flexíveis e capazes de remarcar a performance-exposição e realizar novos eventos virtuais. 

Temos organizado eventos artísticos por mais de duas décadas. Nosso objetivo é usar materiais de comércio justo e sustentável. 

Descrição do Projeto – o mito e a experiência

O mito da "Cobra Grande" permeia o território Amazônico. Sua presença é sentida nos grandes rios e nas vastas extensões das savanas brasileiras. A história de uma presença cósmica milenar em forma de uma serpente emplumada, também conhecida como “A Encantada’ ou ‘Caianinha’, é passada de geração em geração pelos diversos povos da floresta. O mito de uma serpente encantada que trás vida a esse planeta, é tecido no nosso imaginário lúdico e sagrado. Metaforicamente, nós nascemos do útero da Mãe Terra (Pachamama) pois carregamos dentre de nós a mesma semente que reflete nossa união com tudo e ao mesmo tempo a grande diversidade e abundância desse planeta. 

A exposição fotográfica Cobra Grande Ziguezagueando em Mim  compartilha a essência do mito da "Cobra Grande". Trata-se de uma criatura que ziguezagueia pelas margens do rio, fertilizando a se própria e aos ribeirinhos que a vêem passar fluindo em direção ao grande oceano cósmico. É uma tentativa de retratar e revelar a dança matrimonial da ‘Cobra Grande’ que se torna grávida através da fertilidade que emana do Reino Mágico do Povo Encantado da Floresta.

A atriz e performer Kyara Orlando expressou o relacionamento mítico entre o visível e o invisível, incorporando o espírito da ‘Serpente Encantada’ através de uma performance xamânica nas águas escuras do Rio Itamboatá. O fotógrafo e Xamã Dhan Ribeiro documentou esse processo criando uma registro visual que resultou numa narrativa fotográfica composta por 45 fotografias coloridas. Os primeiros raios de sol que banharam o espaço com uma luz dourada geraram profundidade e contraste nas imagens, permitindo assim que a narrativa se desenvolvesse dentro de um belo conceito de puro realismo mágico. Apoiada por uma paisagem sonora de canções tribais e sons da floresta, esta exposição convida o espectador a mergulhar no espaço ancestral do povo da floresta.

Katerina Barampouti será a curadora de um espaço sagrado para que Kyara Orlando e Dhan Ribeiro possam realizar a experiência mítica Cobra Grande. Ela também vai convidar outros artistas e pensadores para trocar impressões sobre o assunto e compartilhar práticas e conhecimentos.

Quem somos

Dhan Ribeiro - https://www.dhanribeiro.com/sobre-mim

Kyara Orlando - https://kyaraorlando.wixsite.com/mysite

Katerina Barampouti - https://www.katerina-barampouti.com/about

Outras maneiras em que você pode ajudar

Se você não pode contribuir financeiramente, existem outras maneiras de nos ajudar:

  • Divulgue e compartilhe essa campanha nas suas redes sociais, ajude-nos a  criar um barulho.
  • Curta nossa página do Facebook Cobra Grande Ziguezagueando em Mim e deixem um comentário para apoiar sua visibilidade. Acesse esse link: https://www.facebook.com/bigsnakeziggzagging  
  • Por favor use a ferramenta de compartilhamento do Indiegogo.

Nossa profunda gratidão.

__________________________________________________________________________________________

Deutsche Übersetzung

Worum geht es in diesem Projekt und warum brauchen wir dich?

Das Projekt Big Snake Ziggzagging in Me ist eine Entdeckungsreise, die durch Online- und Live-Kunst-Erlebnisse, die alle Sinne umfassen, ausgedrückt wird. Es wird gemeinsam von dem Fotografen, Künstler und Schamanen Dhan Ribeiro (Brasilien), der Schauspielerin und Performance-Künstlerin Kyara Orlando (Brasilien, Großbritannien) und der Künstlerin, Performerin und Kuratorin Katerina Barampouti (Griechenland, Großbritannien) gestaltet. Wir haben uns zusammengetan, um eine Geschichte zu erzählen: wie mächtig Menschen sind, wenn wir uns verzaubern lassen; wenn wir in Kontakt mit unserer Heiligkeit und unserem Bewusstsein sind. Davon wollen wir dir eine Kostprobe geben.

Lasst uns erleben und überprüfen, wie wir Menschen uns zu den Elementen der Natur, zur Umwelt und zu uns selbst verhalten. Durch Performances von Kyara Orlando, eine fotografische Erzählung von Dhan Ribeiro und damit verbundene Kunstaktionen, die von Katerina Barampouti geleitet und kuratiert werden, beschwört Big Snake Ziggzagging in Me den Zauber unserer physischen Welt herauf und legt eine kreative Beziehung zu all den existenziellen Dynamiken, die unseren Planeten so besonders machen, nahe. Das Projekt verwendet den Mythos der Großen Kobra (Cobra Grande) als Bezugspunkt: Dieser Mythos durchdringt das Gebiet des Amazonas und spricht von der fruchtbaren Lebenskraft, die ständig die Welt erschafft - und die wir in unserer DNA tragen.

Wirf einen Blick auf unsere virtuelle Ausstellung mit einigen von Dhan's besten Fotografien:

https://www.artsteps.com/view/607c9ca3fd9455a4fd6b9da1

Dieses Projekt wurde am 12. November 2020 online mit einer Diskussionsrunde, einem Mini-Workshop und einer Online-Performance gestartet. Eine virtuelle Ausstellung findet derzeit statt und eine physische Fotografie- und Kunstausstellung zusammen mit einer Reihe an Live-Workshops wird im Juli 2021 in der Galerie The Koppel Project Hive in London stattfinden (5. Juli bis 6. August 2021).

An dieser Stelle brauchen wir deine Hilfe bei der Realisierung der physischen Ausstellung. The Koppel Project unterstützt uns großzügig mit einem erstaunlichen, gut ausgestatteten Raum im Herzen Londons (www.thekoppelproject.com) und mit der Produktion und dem Management des Projekts. Deine individuelle Unterstützung wird uns ermöglichen, die Anforderungen an die Ausstellungsinstallation an das Aufführungsmaterial zu erfüllen, qualitativ hochwertige Fotos zu drucken und auch die Veranstaltungen zu dokumentieren und zu vermarkten. 

Leitet das Projekt weiter, im Vertrauen auf die Fähigkeit der Kunst, die menschliche Wahrnehmung zu inspirieren, zu erziehen und zu bewegen. Ausgedrückt durch Bilder, Klänge, gesprochenes Wort, Umweltaktivismus, Schamanismus und die Kraft des Geschichtenerzählens. Du kannst dazu beitragen!

Und vor allem hoffen wir darauf, dich während unserer physischen Ausstellung und/oder unserer virtuellen Veranstaltungen zu sehen!

Unsere tiefste Dankbarkeit.

 

Was wir brauchen & was du bekommst

Im Wesentlichen werden die Mittel für Folgendes verwendet:

70% Produktionskosten in Großbritannien, einschließlich aller Materialien, Drucksachen, IV, technische Anforderungen und Versicherung 

20% Reise- und Vorbereitungskosten der Künstler/Darsteller

10% Verwaltung und Marketing

Wenn die Kampagne ihr Ziel übersteigt, werden alle zusätzlichen Gelder für eine Rückerstattung an alle teilnehmenden Künstler und auch an die Terra Mirim Foundation, die schamanische Gemeinschaft, in der die Fotos dieser Ausstellung aufgenommen wurden, verwendet. Terra Mirim befindet sich in Bahia, Brasilien, in einem Schutzgebiet des Atlantischen Waldes, und ist auf Spenden wie diese angewiesen, um seine unermüdliche Arbeit fortzusetzen und Menschen aus der ganzen Welt zu empfangen, die Heilung und einen Lebensweg in Gemeinschaft und Ko-Kreation mit der Natur suchen.

Wenn die Kampagne ihr Ziel nicht erreicht, wird sie uns dennoch helfen, weil sie einen Teil der anfallenden Kosten zusteuert und wir werden für immer dankbar sein! Jede Hilfe wird sehr geschätzt.

 

Dankeschöns!

Als Dankeschön haben wir großzügige Vergünstigungen für dich vorbereitet - einschließlich der Möglichkeit, dieses Projekt aus erster Hand zu erleben. Hier ist eine Liste der Vergünstigungen:

1) Reservierung eines Platzes für Kyara Orlandos Auftritt in London, am 6. Juli 2021 + fotografisches Handout/Ausstellungserinnerungspaket.

2) Reservierung eines Platzes für Kyara Orlandos "Four Elements"-Workshop in London am 12. Juli 2021 + Fotohandout/Ausstellungserinnerungspaket.

3) Reservierung eines Platzes für den Workshop "Kreative Achtsamkeit" von Katerina Barampouti in London am 7. Juli 2021 + Fotohandout/Ausstellungserinnerungspaket.

4) Erhalt eines hochwertigen Abzugs von einem von Dhan Ribeiros erstaunlichen Fotos.

5) Erhalt eines Memoirenpakets von der Ausstellung.

 

Risiken und Herausforderungen

Wir vertrauen und hoffen, dass wir alle bei guter Gesundheit sind; unter Berücksichtigung der aktuellen weltweiten Krise und aller unvorhergesehenen Ereignisse sind wir entschlossen, dieses Projekt zu realisieren und eine wirklich sinnvolle und nützliche Erfahrung mit unserem Publikum zu teilen. Wir sind flexibel und in der Lage, die Präsentationstermine zu verschieben und auch mehr virtuelle Veranstaltungen durchzuführen.

Wir stellen seit mehr als zwei Jahrzehnten komplexe Veranstaltungen zusammen und sind zuversichtlich, dass wir auch diese Veranstaltung reibungslos organisieren können. Wir halten, was wir versprechen, und verwenden umweltfreundliche, fair gehandelte Materialien. 

 

Projektbeschreibung - Der Mythos und das Erlebnis:

Der Mythos der "Großen Kobra" ("Cobra Grande" auf Lateinisch) durchdringt das Gebiet des Amazonas. Ihre Präsenz ist entlang der großen Flüsse ebenso zu spüren wie in den weiten und offenen Flächen der brasilianischen Savannen. Eine uralte Präsenz - die auch als 'die Verzauberte' oder 'Caianinha' bekannt ist - wird in den Rädern der Geschichten bewahrt, die von den verschiedenen Waldvölkern erzählt werden und die uns durch deren Weitergabe geschenkt wurden und sich in unsere spielerische und heilige Vorstellungskraft einweben. Obwohl wir nicht direkt aus dem Schoß der 'Mutter des Waldes' ('Madre Floresta') stammen, tragen wir die Gene der Vielfalt und des Überflusses in uns. Ein fruchtbarer Zustand der Verzauberung, der uns oft durch die vier Ecken dieses Kontinents führt.

Die Fotoausstellung 'Cobra Grande - Big Snake Ziggzagging in Me' teilt die Essenz der 'Cobra Grande'-Geschichte und erschafft den Mythos durch Aktionen und Bilder neu. Sie erzählt von der Kreatur, die im Zickzack an den Ufern des Flusses entlangläuft und sich selbst befruchtet, und von den Bewohnern des Flusses, die sie vom Schatten des Waldes aus auf ihrer Suche nach dem kosmischen Ozean beobachten. Es ist ein Versuch, den Ehetanz der 'Cobra Grande' darzustellen und zu enthüllen, die von der Fruchtbarkeit, die vom magischen Königreich der verzauberten Menschen des Waldes ausgeht, schwanger wird. Die Schauspielerin Kyara Orlando bringt die mythische Beziehung zwischen der Sichtbarkeit und Unsichtbarkeit der Welt zum Ausdruck und verkörpert den Geist der 'Verzauberten Schlange' durch eine schamanische Performance in den dunklen Gewässern des Flusses Itamboatá, während der Fotograf und Schamane Dhan Ribeiro den Prozess in einer fotografischen Erzählung aus 45 Farbfotografien dokumentiert. Diese Fotografien versuchen, den Betrachter in den angestammten Raum der Menschen des Waldes eintauchen zu lassen; umgeben von Stammesgesängen, 'Icaros' und Klängen des Waldes - und eine visuelle Aufzeichnung der expressiven Entfaltung zu schaffen, die jedem Moment vor der Kamera folgte. Inmitten der Vegetation tauchten die ersten Sonnenstrahlen den Raum in ein goldenes Licht und erzeugten Tiefe, Kontrast und Volumen in den Bildern, welche am Morgen des 6. Januar 2019 aufgenommen wurden. Die gesamte Arbeit wurde innerhalb der Szenerie ausgeführt, die die Natur selbst geschaffen hat, und ermöglichte so die Entwicklung der Geschichte innerhalb eines schönen Konzepts des reinen magischen Realismus: wo Realität und Magie unsere spielerische Fähigkeit inspirieren, sich vollständig dem Ausdruck zu öffnen.

Katerina Barampouti kuratiert einen heiligen Raum für Kyara Orlando und Dhan Ribeiro, um die mythische Erfahrung der Cobra Grande zu gewährleisten und bringt darüber hinaus verschiedene Kreative und Denker zusammen, damit diese sich austauschen und Praktiken und Wissen zu teilen. 

 

Wer wir sind

https://www.dhanribeiro.com/sobre-mim

https://kyaraorlando.wixsite.com/mysite

https://www.katerina-barampouti.com/about

 

Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

Wenn du keinen Beitrag leisten kannst, mach dir bitte keine Sorgen! Es gibt andere Möglichkeiten, wie man uns helfen kann:

Verbreite die Nachricht! Teile diese Kampagne in deinen Netzwerken und mit Freunden - und mache ordentlich Wirbel darum!

Like unsere Big Snake Ziggzagging on Me Seite auf Facebook, kommentiere sie, unterstütze ihre Sichtbarkeit! Link: https://www.facebook.com/bigsnakeziggzagging

Bitte nutze die Indiegogo-Share-Tools!

Ein großes Dankeschön an alle.
story_txt:
(See Portuguese & German translations at the end / Veja a versão em português no final /Siehe portugiesische und deutsche Übersetzungen am Ende)
 
What is this project about and why do we need you
Big Snake Ziggzagging in Me is a multi-disciplinary art project that creates immersive, online and live art experiences. It is co-created by photographer and Shaman Dhan Ribeiro (Brazil), actress and performance artist Kyara Orlando (Brazil, UK) and artist, performer and curator Katerina Barampouti (Greece, UK). We joined forces to decisively tell a story: how powerful we, as humans, can be when we allow enchantment into our lives; when we attune to our sacredness and consciousness. So, we want to give you a taste of that.
We offer an experience that reflects upon how we relate to the environment, the elements of nature and to ourselves. Through a photographic narrative by Dhan Ribeiro, a solo performance by Kyara Orlando and related art events (workshops, Q&A, discussions, short performances) directed and curated by Katerina Barampouti. Big Snake Ziggzagging in Me evokes the enchantment and mysteries of our world. This project suggests a creative relationship with life, it refers to the myth of the Great Cobra (Cobra Grande) that permeates the Amazonian territory which represents the fertile life force that we carry within our DNA and that is perpetually creating and connecting all beings.
Have a look at our virtual exhibition with some of Dhan's photographs:
https://www.artsteps.com/view/607c9ca3fd9455a4fd6b9da1
This project was launched online on 12th November 2020 with an online performance, Q&A and a short workshop. A virtual exhibition is currently taking place, which you can access on the link above. The photography exhibition that includes live performances will take place in London at The Koppel Project Hive Gallery from July 2021 (until 6 August 2021).
This is where we need your help, to manifest the aforementioned exhibition. The Koppel Project is generously supporting us with an exhibition space in the heart of London (www.thekoppelproject.com) and by producing and managing the project. Your financial support will fund: materials, installation equipments, digital equipment, high quality prints for the exhibition, props for the performance, documenting and marketing costs. 
Help us spread the word, trusting in the power of art to inspire, educate and challenge human perception. Expressed through visuals, sounds, movement, storytelling, environmental art-ivism and shamanism. You can can be part of this!
Lastly, we look forward to seeing you at our live exhibition and/or virtual events.
Our deepest gratitude.
What we need & what you get

In essence, funds will go to:
 

70% Production costs in the UK including all materials (i.e. paper, clips, nails, stands), high quality prints, audio-visual equipments, technical requirements and insurance. 
20% Artists/performers travel, prep and rehearsals expenses.
10% Admin & marketing.

If the campaign exceeds its goal, then any additional fund will go towards the artist's out-of-pocket expenses. Additional funds will also be donated to the Terra Mirim Foundation, which is the shamanic community where the photos of this exhibition where taken. Terra Mirim is located in Bahia-Brazil, in a preserved area of the Atlantic Forest and depends on donations like this to continue its tireless work of receiving people from all over the world who are seeking healing and a life path of communion and co-creation with nature.
If the campaign does not reach its full goal, it will still be of great help as any amount will subsidise part of the costs. No donation is too small, we are extremely grateful for your collaboration and support. 


Perks!
To show our gratitude we've prepared various perk for you - including the opportunity to experience this project first hand. Here's a list of some perks we are offering:
1) A ticket to see Kyara Orlando's live private-view performance in London, in July 2021. 
2) A place to participate in Kyara Orlando's Four Elements Creative Flow workshop either online (June) or in person in London (July). 
3) A place to participate in Katerina Barampouti's Creative Mindfulness workshop either online (August) or in person in London (July).
4) A high-quality print of one of Dhan Ribeiro's photographs, 3 different sizes available.
5) An A5 photographic booklet of the exhibition and A6 postcards of the photos .

Risks & challenges
We trust and hope that everyone will be in good health. Considering the current worldwide crisis and any unforeseen events, we are determined to make this project happen and share a truly meaningful and constructive experience with our audience. We are flexible and able to reschedule the exhibition and presentation dates and to do additional virtual events.
We have been putting together art events for more than two decades. We aim to use sustainable, fair trade material. 
Project description - the myth and the experience
The myth of the 'Great Cobra' ('Cobra Grande' in Portuguese) permeates the Amazonian territory. Its presence is felt along the great rivers and the wide and open expanses of the Brazilian savannas. The story of an ancient cosmic presence in the form of a feathered snake, also known as 'The Enchanted One' or 'Caianinha', is passed down from genaration to genaration through storytelling by the indigenous people of the forest. The myth of an enchanted snake that brings life to this planet and to humans, weave into our playful and sacred imagination. Metaphorically, we are born from the womb of 'Mother Earth' ('Pachamama') as we all carry within us the same seed that reflects our oneness with everything and the great diversity and abundance of this planet. 
The 'Cobra Grande - Big Snake Ziggzagging in Me' photograpy exhibition shares the essence of the 'Cobra Grande' myth. It's about the creature that zigzags along the banks of the river, fertilising itself and the riverside dwellers who watch it flow towards the great cosmic ocean. It is an attempt to depict and reveal the matrimonial dance of 'Cobra Grande' who becomes empregnated through the fertility that emanates from the Magical Kingdom of the Enchanted People of the Forest.
Performing actress Kyara Orlando expressed the mythical relationship between the visible and the invisible, embodying the spirit of the 'Enchanted Serpent' through a shamanic performance in the dark waters of the Itamboatá river. Photographer and Shaman Dhan Ribeiro documented this process creating a visual record that resulted in a narrative composted of 45 coloured photographs. The first rays of sunshine that bathed the space with a golden light generated depth and contrast in the images, thus enabling the narrative to develop within a beautiful concept of pure magical realism. Supported by a soundscape of tribal songs and sounds of the forest, this exhibition invites the viewer to immerse in the ancestral space of the people of the forest. 
​Katerina Barampouti will curate a sacred space for Kyara Orlando and Dhan Ribeiro to deliver the Cobra Grande mythical experience. She will also invite other creatives and thinkers to exchange views on the subject and share practices and knowledge.
Who we are
https://www.dhanribeiro.com/sobre-mim
https://kyaraorlando.wixsite.com/mysite
https://www.katerina-barampouti.com/about

Other ways you can help
If you cannot financially contribute,  there are other ways you can help us:

Spread the word, share this campaign on your social media and help us create a buzz. 
Like our Big Snake Ziggzagging in Me Facebook page and leave a comment to support its visibility. Here is the link:  https://www.facebook.com/bigsnakeziggzagging 
Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Our deepest gratitude.
____________________________________________________________________________________
Tradução em português
Sobre o que é esse projeto e porque precisamos de você
Cobra Grande Ziguezagueando em Mim é um projeto artístico multidisciplinar que cria experiências artísticas imersivas, presenciais e online. É uma co-criação entre o fotógrafo e xamã Dhan Ribeiro (Brasil), a atriz e performer Kyara Orlando (Brasil, Reino Unido) e a artista, performer e curadora Katerina Barampouti (Grécia, Reino Unido). Juntamos forças para contar uma história de forma decisiva: como nós, humanos, podemos nos tornar mais fortes se abrimos espaço para o encantamento em nossas vidas; quando estamos conscientes e sintonizados com nossa própria sacralidade. Então, queremos lhe proporcionar um gostinho disso.
Oferecemos uma experiência que reflete sobre como nos relacionamos com o meio ambiente, os elementos da natureza e com nós mesmos. Através de uma narrativa fotográfica de Dhan Ribeiro, uma performance solo de Kyara Orlando e eventos artísticos (workshops, painel de conversas, debates, performances curtas) com direção e curadoria de Katerina Barampouti. Cobra Grande Ziguezagueando em Mim evoca o encantamento e os mistérios do nosso mundo. Esse projeto sugere uma relação criativa com a vida, tendo como referência o mito da Cobra Grande que permeia o território Amazônico e representa a força vital fértil que carregamos em nosso DNA e que está perpetualmente criando e conectando todos os seres.
Veja a nossa exposição virtual com algumas das fotografias de Dhan:
https://www.artsteps.com/view/607c9ca3fd9455a4f...
Cobra Grande Ziguezagueando em Mim foi lançado online no dia 12 de novembro de 2020 com uma performance online, um painel de discussão e um workshop. Uma exposição virtual, que você pode acessar no link acima, está acontecendo até meados de junho. A exposição fotográfica que inclui performances presenciais acontecerá em Londres na galeria Hive do The Koppel Project em julho de 2021 (até 6 de Agosto de 2021).
É ai que precisamos da sua ajuda, para manifestar a performance-exposição mencionada. The Koppel Project está generosamente nos apoiando com uma galeria no centro de Londres (www.thekoppelproject.com) e produzindo e administrando esse projeto. Seu apoio financeiro será revestido para financiar: materiais, equipamentos de instalação, equipamentos digitais, impressão em alta qualidade, materiais cênicos, custos de documentação e divulgação. 
Nos ajude a divulgar essa campanha, confiando no poder que a arte tem de inspirar, educar e desafiar a percepção humana. Expressa por meio de recursos visuais, sonoros, movimento, histórias contadas, art-ivismo ambiental e xamanismo.  Você pode fazer parte disso!
Finalmente, esperamos vê-los em nossa exposição presencialmente ou em nossos eventos virtuais.
Nossa mais profunda gratidão.
O que precisamos & o que você receberá
Essencialmente, os fundos irão para:

70% Custos de produção no Reino Unido incluindo todos os materiais (ex. papel, clips, pregos, linhas, plataformas), impressões em alta qualidade, equipamentos audio-visuais, seguro e todos os requerimentos técnicos.
20% Despesas de trabalho, ensaios e viagens dos artistas/performers.
10% Administração e marketing.

Se a campanha exceder seu objetivo, qualquer fundo extra irá para cobrir despesas pagas pelos próprios artistas. Fundos adicionais também serão revestidos para a Fundação Terra Mirim, comunidade xamânica onde as fotos foram feitas. Terra Mirim fica na Bahia,Brasil, numa área de preservação da Mata Atlântica e conta com doações como essa para continuar o trabalho incansável de receber pessoas do mundo inteiro que procuram cura e um caminho de vida em comunhão e co-criação com a natureza. 
Se a campanha não alcançar seu objetivo total, ainda assim será de grande ajuda pois o valor arrecadado pagará parte dos custos. Nenhuma doação é pequena demais, estamos muito gratos pela sua colaboração e apoio. 
Vantagens!
Para mostrar nossa gratidão, preparamos diversos tipos de vantagens para vocês – incluindo a oportunidade de experienciar esse projeto em primeira mão. Aqui está a lista de algumas das vantagens que estamos oferecendo:
1) Um ingresso para a performance de Kyara Orlando em Londres, em julho 2021
2) Um lugar para participar do workshop de Kyara Orlando Fluxo Criativo com Os Quatro Elementos. Presencialmente em Londres em julho ou online em junho. 
3) Um lugar para o workshop de Katerina Barampouti Mindfulness Criativo. Presencialmente em Londres em julho ou online em agosto.
4) Uma impressão em alta qualidade e uma das fotografias de Dhan Ribeiro, disponíveis em três tamanhos diferentes.
5) Um livreto da exposição em A5 e cartões postais das fotos em A6.
Riscos e desafios
Esperamos que todos estejam em boa saúde. Considerando a atual crise mundial e quaisquer eventos imprevistos, estamos determinados a realizar esse projeto e compartilhar uma experiência verdadeiramente significativa e construtiva com nosso público. Somos flexíveis e capazes de remarcar a performance-exposição e realizar novos eventos virtuais. 
Temos organizado eventos artísticos por mais de duas décadas. Nosso objetivo é usar materiais de comércio justo e sustentável. 
Descrição do Projeto – o mito e a experiência
O mito da "Cobra Grande" permeia o território Amazônico. Sua presença é sentida nos grandes rios e nas vastas extensões das savanas brasileiras. A história de uma presença cósmica milenar em forma de uma serpente emplumada, também conhecida como “A Encantada’ ou ‘Caianinha’, é passada de geração em geração pelos diversos povos da floresta. O mito de uma serpente encantada que trás vida a esse planeta, é tecido no nosso imaginário lúdico e sagrado. Metaforicamente, nós nascemos do útero da Mãe Terra (Pachamama) pois carregamos dentre de nós a mesma semente que reflete nossa união com tudo e ao mesmo tempo a grande diversidade e abundância desse planeta. 
A exposição fotográfica Cobra Grande Ziguezagueando em Mim  compartilha a essência do mito da "Cobra Grande". Trata-se de uma criatura que ziguezagueia pelas margens do rio, fertilizando a se própria e aos ribeirinhos que a vêem passar fluindo em direção ao grande oceano cósmico. É uma tentativa de retratar e revelar a dança matrimonial da ‘Cobra Grande’ que se torna grávida através da fertilidade que emana do Reino Mágico do Povo Encantado da Floresta.
A atriz e performer Kyara Orlando expressou o relacionamento mítico entre o visível e o invisível, incorporando o espírito da ‘Serpente Encantada’ através de uma performance xamânica nas águas escuras do Rio Itamboatá. O fotógrafo e Xamã Dhan Ribeiro documentou esse processo criando uma registro visual que resultou numa narrativa fotográfica composta por 45 fotografias coloridas. Os primeiros raios de sol que banharam o espaço com uma luz dourada geraram profundidade e contraste nas imagens, permitindo assim que a narrativa se desenvolvesse dentro de um belo conceito de puro realismo mágico. Apoiada por uma paisagem sonora de canções tribais e sons da floresta, esta exposição convida o espectador a mergulhar no espaço ancestral do povo da floresta.
Katerina Barampouti será a curadora de um espaço sagrado para que Kyara Orlando e Dhan Ribeiro possam realizar a experiência mítica Cobra Grande. Ela também vai convidar outros artistas e pensadores para trocar impressões sobre o assunto e compartilhar práticas e conhecimentos.

Por favor use a ferramenta de compartilhamento do Indiegogo.

Nossa profunda gratidão.
__________________________________________________________________________________________
Deutsche Übersetzung
Worum geht es in diesem Projekt und warum brauchen wir dich?
Das Projekt Big Snake Ziggzagging in Me ist eine Entdeckungsreise, die durch Online- und Live-Kunst-Erlebnisse, die alle Sinne umfassen, ausgedrückt wird. Es wird gemeinsam von dem Fotografen, Künstler und Schamanen Dhan Ribeiro (Brasilien), der Schauspielerin und Performance-Künstlerin Kyara Orlando (Brasilien, Großbritannien) und der Künstlerin, Performerin und Kuratorin Katerina Barampouti (Griechenland, Großbritannien) gestaltet. Wir haben uns zusammengetan, um eine Geschichte zu erzählen: wie mächtig Menschen sind, wenn wir uns verzaubern lassen; wenn wir in Kontakt mit unserer Heiligkeit und unserem Bewusstsein sind. Davon wollen wir dir eine Kostprobe geben.
Lasst uns erleben und überprüfen, wie wir Menschen uns zu den Elementen der Natur, zur Umwelt und zu uns selbst verhalten. Durch Performances von Kyara Orlando, eine fotografische Erzählung von Dhan Ribeiro und damit verbundene Kunstaktionen, die von Katerina Barampouti geleitet und kuratiert werden, beschwört Big Snake Ziggzagging in Me den Zauber unserer physischen Welt herauf und legt eine kreative Beziehung zu all den existenziellen Dynamiken, die unseren Planeten so besonders machen, nahe. Das Projekt verwendet den Mythos der Großen Kobra (Cobra Grande) als Bezugspunkt: Dieser Mythos durchdringt das Gebiet des Amazonas und spricht von der fruchtbaren Lebenskraft, die ständig die Welt erschafft - und die wir in unserer DNA tragen.
Wirf einen Blick auf unsere virtuelle Ausstellung mit einigen von Dhan's besten Fotografien:
https://www.artsteps.com/view/607c9ca3fd9455a4fd6b9da1
Dieses Projekt wurde am 12. November 2020 online mit einer Diskussionsrunde, einem Mini-Workshop und einer Online-Performance gestartet. Eine virtuelle Ausstellung findet derzeit statt und eine physische Fotografie- und Kunstausstellung zusammen mit einer Reihe an Live-Workshops wird im Juli 2021 in der Galerie The Koppel Project Hive in London stattfinden (5. Juli bis 6. August 2021).
An dieser Stelle brauchen wir deine Hilfe bei der Realisierung der physischen Ausstellung. The Koppel Project unterstützt uns großzügig mit einem erstaunlichen, gut ausgestatteten Raum im Herzen Londons (www.thekoppelproject.com) und mit der Produktion und dem Management des Projekts. Deine individuelle Unterstützung wird uns ermöglichen, die Anforderungen an die Ausstellungsinstallation an das Aufführungsmaterial zu erfüllen, qualitativ hochwertige Fotos zu drucken und auch die Veranstaltungen zu dokumentieren und zu vermarkten. 
Leitet das Projekt weiter, im Vertrauen auf die Fähigkeit der Kunst, die menschliche Wahrnehmung zu inspirieren, zu erziehen und zu bewegen. Ausgedrückt durch Bilder, Klänge, gesprochenes Wort, Umweltaktivismus, Schamanismus und die Kraft des Geschichtenerzählens. Du kannst dazu beitragen!
Und vor allem hoffen wir darauf, dich während unserer physischen Ausstellung und/oder unserer virtuellen Veranstaltungen zu sehen!
Unsere tiefste Dankbarkeit.
 
Was wir brauchen & was du bekommst
Im Wesentlichen werden die Mittel für Folgendes verwendet:
70% Produktionskosten in Großbritannien, einschließlich aller Materialien, Drucksachen, IV, technische Anforderungen und Versicherung 
20% Reise- und Vorbereitungskosten der Künstler/Darsteller
10% Verwaltung und Marketing
Wenn die Kampagne ihr Ziel übersteigt, werden alle zusätzlichen Gelder für eine Rückerstattung an alle teilnehmenden Künstler und auch an die Terra Mirim Foundation, die schamanische Gemeinschaft, in der die Fotos dieser Ausstellung aufgenommen wurden, verwendet. Terra Mirim befindet sich in Bahia, Brasilien, in einem Schutzgebiet des Atlantischen Waldes, und ist auf Spenden wie diese angewiesen, um seine unermüdliche Arbeit fortzusetzen und Menschen aus der ganzen Welt zu empfangen, die Heilung und einen Lebensweg in Gemeinschaft und Ko-Kreation mit der Natur suchen.
Wenn die Kampagne ihr Ziel nicht erreicht, wird sie uns dennoch helfen, weil sie einen Teil der anfallenden Kosten zusteuert und wir werden für immer dankbar sein! Jede Hilfe wird sehr geschätzt.
 
Dankeschöns!
Als Dankeschön haben wir großzügige Vergünstigungen für dich vorbereitet - einschließlich der Möglichkeit, dieses Projekt aus erster Hand zu erleben. Hier ist eine Liste der Vergünstigungen:
1) Reservierung eines Platzes für Kyara Orlandos Auftritt in London, am 6. Juli 2021 + fotografisches Handout/Ausstellungserinnerungspaket.
2) Reservierung eines Platzes für Kyara Orlandos "Four Elements"-Workshop in London am 12. Juli 2021 + Fotohandout/Ausstellungserinnerungspaket.
3) Reservierung eines Platzes für den Workshop "Kreative Achtsamkeit" von Katerina Barampouti in London am 7. Juli 2021 + Fotohandout/Ausstellungserinnerungspaket.
4) Erhalt eines hochwertigen Abzugs von einem von Dhan Ribeiros erstaunlichen Fotos.
5) Erhalt eines Memoirenpakets von der Ausstellung.
 
Risiken und Herausforderungen
Wir vertrauen und hoffen, dass wir alle bei guter Gesundheit sind; unter Berücksichtigung der aktuellen weltweiten Krise und aller unvorhergesehenen Ereignisse sind wir entschlossen, dieses Projekt zu realisieren und eine wirklich sinnvolle und nützliche Erfahrung mit unserem Publikum zu teilen. Wir sind flexibel und in der Lage, die Präsentationstermine zu verschieben und auch mehr virtuelle Veranstaltungen durchzuführen.
Wir stellen seit mehr als zwei Jahrzehnten komplexe Veranstaltungen zusammen und sind zuversichtlich, dass wir auch diese Veranstaltung reibungslos organisieren können. Wir halten, was wir versprechen, und verwenden umweltfreundliche, fair gehandelte Materialien. 
 
Projektbeschreibung - Der Mythos und das Erlebnis:
Der Mythos der "Großen Kobra" ("Cobra Grande" auf Lateinisch) durchdringt das Gebiet des Amazonas. Ihre Präsenz ist entlang der großen Flüsse ebenso zu spüren wie in den weiten und offenen Flächen der brasilianischen Savannen. Eine uralte Präsenz - die auch als 'die Verzauberte' oder 'Caianinha' bekannt ist - wird in den Rädern der Geschichten bewahrt, die von den verschiedenen Waldvölkern erzählt werden und die uns durch deren Weitergabe geschenkt wurden und sich in unsere spielerische und heilige Vorstellungskraft einweben. Obwohl wir nicht direkt aus dem Schoß der 'Mutter des Waldes' ('Madre Floresta') stammen, tragen wir die Gene der Vielfalt und des Überflusses in uns. Ein fruchtbarer Zustand der Verzauberung, der uns oft durch die vier Ecken dieses Kontinents führt.
Die Fotoausstellung 'Cobra Grande - Big Snake Ziggzagging in Me' teilt die Essenz der 'Cobra Grande'-Geschichte und erschafft den Mythos durch Aktionen und Bilder neu. Sie erzählt von der Kreatur, die im Zickzack an den Ufern des Flusses entlangläuft und sich selbst befruchtet, und von den Bewohnern des Flusses, die sie vom Schatten des Waldes aus auf ihrer Suche nach dem kosmischen Ozean beobachten. Es ist ein Versuch, den Ehetanz der 'Cobra Grande' darzustellen und zu enthüllen, die von der Fruchtbarkeit, die vom magischen Königreich der verzauberten Menschen des Waldes ausgeht, schwanger wird. Die Schauspielerin Kyara Orlando bringt die mythische Beziehung zwischen der Sichtbarkeit und Unsichtbarkeit der Welt zum Ausdruck und verkörpert den Geist der 'Verzauberten Schlange' durch eine schamanische Performance in den dunklen Gewässern des Flusses Itamboatá, während der Fotograf und Schamane Dhan Ribeiro den Prozess in einer fotografischen Erzählung aus 45 Farbfotografien dokumentiert. Diese Fotografien versuchen, den Betrachter in den angestammten Raum der Menschen des Waldes eintauchen zu lassen; umgeben von Stammesgesängen, 'Icaros' und Klängen des Waldes - und eine visuelle Aufzeichnung der expressiven Entfaltung zu schaffen, die jedem Moment vor der Kamera folgte. Inmitten der Vegetation tauchten die ersten Sonnenstrahlen den Raum in ein goldenes Licht und erzeugten Tiefe, Kontrast und Volumen in den Bildern, welche am Morgen des 6. Januar 2019 aufgenommen wurden. Die gesamte Arbeit wurde innerhalb der Szenerie ausgeführt, die die Natur selbst geschaffen hat, und ermöglichte so die Entwicklung der Geschichte innerhalb eines schönen Konzepts des reinen magischen Realismus: wo Realität und Magie unsere spielerische Fähigkeit inspirieren, sich vollständig dem Ausdruck zu öffnen.
Katerina Barampouti kuratiert einen heiligen Raum für Kyara Orlando und Dhan Ribeiro, um die mythische Erfahrung der Cobra Grande zu gewährleisten und bringt darüber hinaus verschiedene Kreative und Denker zusammen, damit diese sich austauschen und Praktiken und Wissen zu teilen. 
 
Wer wir sind
https://www.dhanribeiro.com/sobre-mim
https://kyaraorlando.wixsite.com/mysite
https://www.katerina-barampouti.com/about
 
Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann
Wenn du keinen Beitrag leisten kannst, mach dir bitte keine Sorgen! Es gibt andere Möglichkeiten, wie man uns helfen kann:
Verbreite die Nachricht! Teile diese Kampagne in deinen Netzwerken und mit Freunden - und mache ordentlich Wirbel darum!
Like unsere Big Snake Ziggzagging on Me Seite auf Facebook, kommentiere sie, unterstütze ihre Sichtbarkeit! Link: https://www.facebook.com/bigsnakeziggzagging
Bitte nutze die Indiegogo-Share-Tools!
Ein großes Dankeschön an alle.

story:
$50-$75 will receive a Native Art Market coffee mug and free sticker

$75-$100 donations will receive  a Native Art Market travel mug with metal straw, and free sticker

over $100 will recieve xmas ornament, a Native Art Market coffee mug and free sticker

Over $150 will receive xmas ornaments, Native Art Market mug, travel mug, sticker and dri fit facemask with our logo. 

Logo Created by OXDX. Photo of dancers by Boxing Bear Photography

The Native Art's and Crafts industry is a billion dollar industry yet Native Americans see less then a million of that (Source: National Geographic). Native Art Market was created in 2018 to provide a safe and affordable avenue for Native Americans to sell their artwork directly to consumers. While gaining economic empowerment, the outdoor market brings cultural awareness and offers local residents and tourists a chance to immerse themselves in Arizona’s rich Indigenous culture and art. The festival offers food, entertainment, storytelling and demonstrations. We are proud to have over 400 Native families and performers registered for the program. We are even more proud, this community has become the 36th of “100 Things to do in Arizona and Scottsdale” (Source: Tripadvisor). The market functions on a weekly basis from October to March and is located in a parking lot near Talking Stick Casino in Scottsdale, AZ. Native owned and operated, all participants are of Native American descent, giving visitors a chance to interact and directly support elders, mothers, fathers, and college students.  

Our goal today is to provide awareness, and give the community a chance to get involved in our newest venture of creating a second location that will serve as a brick and mortar for Indigenous artists. This location will be a permanent and a-year-around venue located in Old Town Scottsdale. It will be one of the first Native owned shops in the area. Over the last 10 years, Navajo Secrets has saved over funds from their personal jewelry business. This long time dream and $17,000 later, we have excitedly secured a space on Main Street. All funds collected from this effort will be used for renovations as well as the start up costs for the return of our 3rd season of the outdoor market, scheduled for November 2020.

Thank you so much for visiting our page. With the help of the community, we hope to launch more of Arizona’s best cultural experiences. 400 families and performers happily awaiting your response. With Love, The Native Art Market Community.

$50-$75 will receive a Native Art Market coffee mug and free sticker

$75-$100 donations will receive  a Native Art Market travel mug with metal straw, and free sticker

over $100 will recieve xmas ornament, a Native Art Market coffee mug and free sticker

Over $150 will receive xmas ornaments, Native Art Market mug, travel mug, sticker and dri fit facemask with our logo. 

Logo Created by OXDX. Photo of dancers by Boxing Bear Photography

All donors will also be submitted into future raffles and giveaway. Items are currently being donated by artists from Native Art Market. 

THE HISTORY

Native Art Market was created and funded by the mother-daughter team Denise and Heather Tracy. Denise was born into the Native Arts and Craft industry in 1968. A Navajo descendant, she followed in her family's footsteps and built a small successful Native Arts and Crafts business. Still vending to date, she has successfully created and sold Navajo art for over forty years.  In 2011, her daughter Heather Tracy, branded them “Navajo Secrets.” This brand would represent four generations of their family’s Native Artistry. The brand made them recognizable, contactable, and trustable. And just like the market, this family-business only showcases authentic handmade Native items. Though successful, “Navajo Secrets” still relies on pop-up art events throughout Arizona and California. Most are only hosted once a year. That, in turn, was how the vision of Native Art Market was born. And now operates weekly in the Phoenix Metropolitan area. To launch, Navajo Secrets invested over $20,000 of their own funds to start Native Art Market.  

Fast forward two years, Native Art Market is a huge success, and eagerly awaits season three. What started out with a simple vision became a significant community effort.  The market has now operated successfully for two years and now offers over 2,000 opportunities a year for individual Native artists and entertainers.  Native Art Market has also collaborated with entities such as Cornerstone Productions from Los Angeles and ASU Gammage in Tempe. Organizing Indigenous markets for their larger events. They are currently working with AIA (Arizonas Indigenous Agriculture) to add-on an Indigenous Farmers Market. This expansion was scheduled for the Fall of 2020 but has been postponed to the Fall of 2021 due to COVID-19. 

THE OBSTACLE

It has already been estimated that the Native arts and crafts industry generates a billion dollars annually(Source: National Geographic). Yet, Native Americans see LESS than a million of this.  For many Native Americans, making and selling handmade jewelry, pottery, carved figurines, and other crafts provide livelihoods. In addition, Native Americans are subjected to cultural appropriation and imitation, including fake handcrafts being manufactured overseas and brought back to the United States. The sale and misrepresentation of imitation goods has been occurring for decades and there are no signs this will abate. 

In March 2020, like many businesses globally, Native Art Market was impacted by the pandemic, resulting in the cancellation of the last few weekends of the season. Covid-19 has also impacted the sole sponsors Navajo Secrets. Who in the past, have provided funds for the market's start-up each year. With that in mind, it also opened the doors for vacant spaces in Old Town Scottsdale. 

Most retail stores in this area are non-native owned. The unique selling point for the second location is it will be one of the first Native owned shop operated by passionate, experienced, and knowledgeable Native Americans. It will also ensure Native American artisans can sell their goods and know they will receive a fair price to support their livelihoods. We will feature different artisans every week with live demonstrations of their artwork. Shoppers can enjoy a cup of cowboy coffee or Navajo tea while witnessing rug weaving, silversmithing, kachina carving, live painting, and storytelling.

Thank you for your time. 400 Native families eagerly await your response. Either way, always support small businesses. <3
story_txt: $50-$75 will receive a Native Art Market coffee mug and free sticker$75-$100 donations will receive  a Native Art Market travel mug with metal straw, and free stickerover $100 will recieve xmas ornament, a Native Art Market coffee mug and free stickerOver $150 will receive xmas ornaments, Native Art Market mug, travel mug, sticker and dri fit facemask with our logo. Logo Created by OXDX. Photo of dancers by Boxing Bear PhotographyThe Native Art's and Crafts industry is a billion dollar industry yet Native Americans see less then a million of that (Source: National Geographic). Native Art Market was created in 2018 to provide a safe and affordable avenue for Native Americans to sell their artwork directly to consumers. While gaining economic empowerment, the outdoor market brings cultural awareness and offers local residents and tourists a chance to immerse themselves in Arizona’s rich Indigenous culture and art. The festival offers food, entertainment, storytelling and demonstrations. We are proud to have over 400 Native families and performers registered for the program. We are even more proud, this community has become the 36th of “100 Things to do in Arizona and Scottsdale” (Source: Tripadvisor). The market functions on a weekly basis from October to March and is located in a parking lot near Talking Stick Casino in Scottsdale, AZ. Native owned and operated, all participants are of Native American descent, giving visitors a chance to interact and directly support elders, mothers, fathers, and college students.  Our goal today is to provide awareness, and give the community a chance to get involved in our newest venture of creating a second location that will serve as a brick and mortar for Indigenous artists. This location will be a permanent and a-year-around venue located in Old Town Scottsdale. It will be one of the first Native owned shops in the area. Over the last 10 years, Navajo Secrets has saved over funds from their personal jewelry business. This long time dream and $17,000 later, we have excitedly secured a space on Main Street. All funds collected from this effort will be used for renovations as well as the start up costs for the return of our 3rd season of the outdoor market, scheduled for November 2020.Thank you so much for visiting our page. With the help of the community, we hope to launch more of Arizona’s best cultural experiences. 400 families and performers happily awaiting your response. With Love, The Native Art Market Community.$50-$75 will receive a Native Art Market coffee mug and free sticker$75-$100 donations will receive  a Native Art Market travel mug with metal straw, and free stickerover $100 will recieve xmas ornament, a Native Art Market coffee mug and free stickerOver $150 will receive xmas ornaments, Native Art Market mug, travel mug, sticker and dri fit facemask with our logo. Logo Created by OXDX. Photo of dancers by Boxing Bear PhotographyAll donors will also be submitted into future raffles and giveaway. Items are currently being donated by artists from Native Art Market. THE HISTORYNative Art Market was created and funded by the mother-daughter team Denise and Heather Tracy. Denise was born into the Native Arts and Craft industry in 1968. A Navajo descendant, she followed in her family's footsteps and built a small successful Native Arts and Crafts business. Still vending to date, she has successfully created and sold Navajo art for over forty years.  In 2011, her daughter Heather Tracy, branded them “Navajo Secrets.” This brand would represent four generations of their family’s Native Artistry. The brand made them recognizable, contactable, and trustable. And just like the market, this family-business only showcases authentic handmade Native items. Though successful, “Navajo Secrets” still relies on pop-up art events throughout Arizona and California. Most are only hosted once a year. That, in turn, was how the vision of Native Art Market was born. And now operates weekly in the Phoenix Metropolitan area. To launch, Navajo Secrets invested over $20,000 of their own funds to start Native Art Market.  Fast forward two years, Native Art Market is a huge success, and eagerly awaits season three. What started out with a simple vision became a significant community effort.  The market has now operated successfully for two years and now offers over 2,000 opportunities a year for individual Native artists and entertainers.  Native Art Market has also collaborated with entities such as Cornerstone Productions from Los Angeles and ASU Gammage in Tempe. Organizing Indigenous markets for their larger events. They are currently working with AIA (Arizonas Indigenous Agriculture) to add-on an Indigenous Farmers Market. This expansion was scheduled for the Fall of 2020 but has been postponed to the Fall of 2021 due to COVID-19. THE OBSTACLEIt has already been estimated that the Native arts and crafts industry generates a billion dollars annually(Source: National Geographic). story:
Short Summary

Initial fundraising round in order to carry out necessary maintenance and reinforcement of an M37 military vehicle so that it can be converted to a Mutant Vehicle for the playa in 2021.

What We Need

  1. Wheels & Tires: $3000
  2. Basic Mechanical (brakes/belts/fluids/hoses): $750
  3. Windows & Waterproofing: $750
  • TOTAL: $4500
  • (these are estimated costs, since most most of the parts must be purchased via auction)

The Impact

These costs serve solely as a means to reinforce the vehicle so that it can be safely operated, and converted to a Mutant Vehicle.

story:
SUMMARY

In our new normal in the grips of COVID-19 we need to think about novel ways to share and experience art. In collaboration with the software company afca., we at ARTinTRA, want to create a new type of exhibition platform offering you an innovative, augmented reality (AR) experience using the latest cutting-edge technology. The mobile application (app) will allow you to visit, curate and share virtual art exhibitions from wherever you are; be this from your living room or the desert, via your phone or tablet.

But we can't do this without your help!

 

BACKGROUND INFORMATION (BREXIT, COVID-19, and new realities) 

Our story begins with the timely and exciting project “Complex States: Art in the Years of Brexit” curated by Vassiliki Tzanakou (ARTinTRA director) and Catherine Harrington; the first exhibition we hope to present on our state-of-the-art, AR platform. 

As the Brexit negotiations come to a close, Complex States presents a diverse selection of artworks made between 2016-2019 by leading and emerging artists across the political spectrum; and with many works made as a direct response to the EU referendum vote in 2016. Through this project we aim to cross boundaries both physically and creatively; and create new spaces of dialogue, understanding and collaboration.

This exhibition proposal began two years ago as a one venue, offline show. The project was complete and ready to go, yet COVID-19 brought our plans to a crashing halt. But we didn’t want to give up. In order to realise the exhibition we looked outwards to the world; to our friends; and to the digital sphere. From our living rooms we reached out to art organisations, galleries, creative spaces and innovators asking for solidarity, and calling for collaboration in a time of isolation.

Since then, our exhibition has changed from a one venue offline show, to an international multi-venue project including an innovative digital exhibition platform. With the help of afca., the new platform will consist of a comprehensive and accessible website and a cutting-edge AR app that uses Microsoft's recently released Azure Spatial Anchors. 

Azure Spatial Anchors enable users to install, share and store virtual artworks in their own current location; and thus also see where other users have placed artworks. This technology can then allow Complex States to be installed and viewed virtually, in multiple forms anywhere in the world. Users of our app can design and then publish their own version of the Complex States virtual exhibition in a location of their choice (their home, their garden, their university. etc) using the available virtual artworks in the Complex States exhibition. Other users can then visit the location of this virtual exhibition at any time and view the exhibition with their own AR-capable device.

Thanks to the support of friends and colleagues, we are close to launching this radical reinvention of our project. Yet, we need your support to take that final step.  We want to realise this project to its fullest so that we can offer you a unique tool that allows you to experience and curate great art when-ever and where-ever you are.

 

WHAT WE NEED  

We need to raise £21, 100 to produce the AR application and to create a dedicated website. Complex States will be our pilot project, which will allow us to showcase and test the new digital platform. 

In particular the funds will be used to:

  • Digitise all the artworks (Rendering & processing of 3D content) 
  • Develop the website
  • Develop a mobile AR app for Android and iOS (pilot app)
  • Work on the graphic design
  • Create the experience design for the website and AR app

 

In case we do not meet the target, the funds raised will still go to the development of the platform. However, we will have to cut down on the number of functions and services we are offering. The AR app will be available on Google Play and in the Apple Store.

 

WHAT YOU GET  (CHECK OUR PERKS OUT) 

THE IMPACT 

Our AR application will offer a thrilling and radically-new way of experiencing art. It will also introduce an innovative new format to the arts & exhibition market.

Our application enables anyone to become an art curator! The user can choose from among the uploaded artworks  and place them as holograms in their environment. They can then arrange these artworks (holograms) to create their own  exhibition. Once one user's virtual exhibition has been published, anyone can find and view this exhibition in exactly the same place using their own digital device. Through the app, users will also have access to background information about each artist and artwork. This not only helps users learn more about a variety of artists and artworks but also enables artists to have an additional platform to showcase their work. Further, the added information aids a deeper discussion about key issues in the exhibition and the artworks, and so empowers a critical dialogue among users even in times of isolation.

Importantly, our app connects with users' social media accounts offering a link to the broader public. In this time of social distancing and isolation, our app can then enable users to not only curate and experience art safely in their own space (room, garden, university; wherever they are) but also find new forms of connection, community and communication. In this sense, we hope that the application will also help tackle mental health issues that have arisen during the recent periods of isolation that have been brought about by the global pandemic. The arts have been proven to have therapeutic abilities, and in our app the benefits of exposure to the arts are also combined with the health benefits of connecting with others through the app's social media features and capabilities.

Alongside the cultural and social impact of the app, the project more widely contributes to the technological world as a driver in the uptake of new services. Our AR app is one of the first applications to use Azure Spatial Anchors. In this way, this project will be  a source of discussion and inspiration within the tech community.

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Our app is a bold, new innovation and as something wholly new, it carries certain risks. However with afca.'s teams' technical expertise and experience, we are confident we will be able to respond to the diverse technical challenges the app presents. 

For the Complex States pilot project, we will be able to check the stability of the application, especially with regards to the use of Spatial Anchors, which have  only recently become available on the market. To place the virtual objects in a physical environment, the Spatial Anchors technology uses spatial anchor points. It is possible that straight homogeneous surfaces, such as white walls, could influence the stability and accuracy of the orientation of the virtual objects in the environment. To avoid such technical hurdles, the application has been developed following an agile approach. Early prototyping during short iteration loops allows for continuous improvement and optimisation of the application. Our development team has extensive experience and expertise with such methods to guarantee a user-friendly and scalable result.

The artworks included in Complex States exhibition are located in sites  all over the world and a large number of artists have contributed to the exhibition. Of all the art objects, digital 3D models present particular challenges. Digital 3D models of similar quality must be produced in a very short time for use in the AR application. Clear requirements and guidelines for technical specifications as well as close cooperation with the artists or their representative parties will be necessary to ensure the uniform quality of the 3D models. In addition, the virtual artworks can also be made available successively in the application.

The above challenges could disrupt the timing of the launch of the exhibition platform. Therefore, a staggered introduction of the individual components is already being sought. The accompanying website will be available after the vernissage on 28 October 2020, while the AR application will follow with a 2-3 week time lag.

 

PERKS

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP 

We understand that we live in difficult times and COVID-19 has made things even more challenging. So, in case you cannot contribute financially please keep in mind that there are other ways to support our cause. Help us get the word out and make some noise about our exhibition and campaign. You can use the Indiegogo share tools to do this. It is easy for you and it makes a real difference for us.

story:
Sheilah's Studio

"There are two distinct languages. There is the verbal, which separates people... and there is the visual that is understood by everybody." ~Yaacov Agam

This campaign will help me continue to build on the momentum of my art business that has been slowly growing over the years. In order to produce my work  with excellent quality and in reasonable time to keep my income flowing, I need to upgrade my studio tools.

"Art transcends cultural boundaries." ~Thomas Kinkade
 

What I Need & What You Will Receive

In order to expand, I need to be able to purchase supplies, including a large-bed scanner and a large format printer  as well as Adobe software, in order to create my prints in a more cost-effective manner and with the highest quality.

  Your support will help me buy art production supplies, which are surprisingly expensive.  Aside from the above mentioned items, the cost of making a painting is not cheap. For example, the materials used to make brushes vary greatly.  A brush made from camel hair is not an expensive item and would typically cost $15, while sable brushes could cost upwards of $150 each. The quality of the brushstroke you can get with a sable brush is superior.  Manufacturing art materials is a small market, which also influences cost.  There are very few discount houses for the higher quality art materials.  Additionally, these items  all have a fragile shelf life and that drives prices higher. Because of the short shelf life, the artist has to buy smaller quantities.  There is also certain amount of price gouging since merchants understand that people will pay whatever the price for the right supplies. Because the higher quality of the materials gives a better result, artists are compelled to pay whatever the market will bear.

Here are some typical price points;

  • Paintbrush: $9 - $60
  • Tube of Oil Paint: $11 - $92
  • Canvas: $35 - $150
  • Prismacolor Colored Pencil: $3 - 5
  • Watercolor block tablet: $25 - $209
  • Storage Portfolio: $20 - $200
  • Large Format Printer: $800 - $3,000
  • Large Bed Scanner - $1,500 - $3,500
  • Art Exhibit Entry Fees: $30 - $40 on average per event

I like to think that by supporting my studio, you are helping make the world a little more beautiful. I loved my career, teaching in inner-city public schools, and the opportunity it gave me to teach young students to find their own creativity. Since I have retired,  I have enjoyed guest lecturing, curating exhibitions, and exhibiting my paintings and drawings.  Now, I have a strong desire to make art. Will you help me build my studio?

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to financially support my campaign, you can still endorse me by sharing this campaign or my work on social media. If you are able to do this, I thank you.

 

My Artist Statement

The impulse to create has been with me for as long as I can remember. Since the time I could first hold a crayon, I would draw on anything. Several years back, my older brother was moving across country. As he sorted through years of mementos, he came across a cigar box stuffed with drawings I had given him as a 4 year old. My brother had made notes on them, describing the picture. Many of them were of angels.

My favorite aunt would never fail to bring me a box of crayons whenever she visited us. I loved her for that. She fed my habit. My Mother enrolled me in Art Enrichment classes when I was a very young child at the Toledo Museum of Art. They were famous for their Saturday children’s classes. I remember my disappointment when the teacher insisted that I draw a dinosaur. I was not interested in dinosaurs, and I absolutely hated the fact that charcoal sticks were our only tool. Things got better. The drive to make my own statement has been with me ever since. I consider creating images my heart’s work. As I have matured, that impulse has come into balance with self-trust.

When things are going well, I experience what Michael Csikszentmihalyi (CHICK-zent-mi-high) calls a flow state. In his book Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience (1990) he described the flow state as one in which an athlete or other person performs at his or her best, seemingly without effort, but rather with total concentration, feeling totally in control without thinking about it. Self- consciousness recedes into the background as total focus is upon present activity.

For many years, I enjoyed drawing still life and quiet landscapes. In my most recent work, I am always imagining the unlikely.  Looking at a forest path, hills, or a lake, it is as if I am able to see right through its placid exterior. My mind’s eye restructures the scene into a quietly fantastical realm where birds, flowers, sky, and earth do not behave as one normally expects them to. In that sense, my paintings rebel against reality. The hard part is to plan a picture so as to give to others what has happened to me. I want to give the viewer an experience, to suggest the sense of light and color.

Although I base my paintings on real locations; I embellish them with my own impressions  of real experience and dreamlike perceptions. The pictures are usually making statements about power, joy  and freedom. I have always wanted my work to have a light joyousness to it which never lets the viewer suspect how much effort went into it.

I like to create images using casual pattern and a sense of motion in my pictures.  I use color to suggest lightness and a pristine transcendence. 

 

Would you like to get to know me more? Please feel free to watch this lecture at Thomas More College.

© Copyright Sheilah Grogan
