Things got better. The drive to make my own statement has been with me ever since. I consider creating images my heart’s work. As I have matured, that impulse has come into balance with self-trust.
When things are going well, I experience what Michael Csikszentmihalyi (CHICK-zent-mi-high) calls a flow state. In his book Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience (1990) he described the flow state as one in which an athlete or other person performs at his or her best, seemingly without effort, but rather with total concentration, feeling totally in control without thinking about it. Self- consciousness recedes into the background as total focus is upon present activity.
For many years, I enjoyed drawing still life and quiet landscapes. In my most recent work, I am always imagining the unlikely.  Looking at a forest path, hills, or a lake, it is as if I am able to see right through its placid exterior. My mind’s eye restructures the scene into a quietly fantastical realm where birds, flowers, sky, and earth do not behave as one normally expects them to. In that sense, my paintings rebel against reality. The hard part is to plan a picture so as to give to others what has happened to me. I want to give the viewer an experience, to suggest the sense of light and color.
Although I base my paintings on real locations; I embellish them with my own impressions  of real experience and dreamlike perceptions. The pictures are usually making statements about power, joy  and freedom. I have always wanted my work to have a light joyousness to it which never lets the viewer suspect how much effort went into it.
I like to create images using casual pattern and a sense of motion in my pictures.  I use color to suggest lightness and a pristine transcendence. 
 
Would you like to get to know me more? Please feel free to watch this lecture at Thomas More College.
© Copyright Sheilah Grogan

story:
BLUF (the Bottom Line Up Front)

Our goal is to open a workshop and storefront offering both retail and wholesale goods both to the public as well as to identified wholesalers and through creation of 'blanks'.   Our intent is to bring in veteran's specifically as we are veterans ourselves, and teach them how we do what we do.  Our tactic is to provide a skill through instruction and sharing, and offering opportunity to market their creations immediately.  Our strategy is to provide comradery and sense of purpose; create a community of people who were once part of another community; spark or maintain that sense of belonging while providing a road map on how to operate independently yet in rhythm with others of the group; to create hope, and an opportunity to spread hope to others.  We may not eliminate the 22 Veteran Suicides a day, but we are- you better believe it- going straight at it in the manner that we can and doing everything we can to prevent it, at least in the locality we find ourselves. 

Details- at least some of them: 

 Our small group of Veterans, all disabled in some form or fashion, wish to transform our small business to something that will benefit our extended community of veterans.  

The intent is to expand our operation in scope and to transform it into a learning center and 'boost' for other veterans and active duty military preparing to leave the service.   The objective is to train those service men and women in a viable and marketable skill that will allow them, at the very least, a fall back trade craft. 

We will pay as we 'certify' these men and women, through profit sharing of their productions, and we will offer to make them part of our 'network' of skilled craftsmen for future efforts, allowing them to co-op our mutual goals of production and at the level of involvement they choose.   

Our intent is to remain 'for profit' throughout.  We are offering a 'hand up' to be seized, as opposed to something that strikes at their pride.  We, through our own experience, realize woodworking and crafting is actually therapy, and we realize securing the ability to be self-sufficient critical to successful transition from service to civilian life.   

Something else we know to be truth- maintaining comradery and 'esprit de corps' happens when those of like experiences and understandings look toward each other and know there is support, there is a greater sense of community, and that there will always be hope.  

Needs in Detail - Product Explained

What we need to realize the goal we've set:

  • Funding to either lease or purchase commercial property in location already identified.
  • Funding to expand equipment to meet production volume required by wholesalers in effort to qualify as a vendor.  
  • Funding to set up the new location (our current shop is small and great for one on one but not at the scale we're aiming for) in a safe conditions and suitable for learning and volume of production. 

The Goal

I would like to be supplying goods to wholesalers no later than third quarter of this year, whether from our current shop or the proposed location- or both- and offering training to the first round of veterans as the production commences. 

Likewise, we would like to gain attention from larger veterans outreach and incorporate aspects into this concept that actually engage in a tangible way- such as working with county and state SBA representatives who can come out and give short classes on business structures and licensing.   To work with local retailers who either purchase items from this operation OR set up directly with our mentors as they hone their skills.   There are literally hundreds of opportunities to entwine with existing foundations and non-profits, government and private organizations to achieve what we are truly seeking- and that is to lower the '22 a day' to zero<- if you 'know' you 'know'.  

These men and women will set forth into the world, with backing, knowledge, and a skill- and being who they are they will pass it to others within their reach..... and.... within there is success. 

Risks & Challenges

I've pushed, pulled, kicked and cussed this operation into fruition and by spending my life savings to start it.  

  • I've identified a market that is sustainable for my initial offering as well as modular in approach to future expansion. 
  • The market is identified- it isn't probing. It isn't 'maybe'.  It is there if I can only meet the expectations in volume of production to meet qualifications as a 'vendor' to identified wholesalers.
  • Careful monitoring through ledger and on-the-books purchase requests will allow barometer for limiting expenses and in reconciliation of asset valuations in effort to remain at least solvent during all phases and into future efforts.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please, share the word over this concept.  I'm ambitious enough to take the reigns in this geographical location, but not nearly so to support other areas.  Now if one of those passing through 'my' operation as student takes that initiative? Wow- that would be great.  I'd even help by providing the road map and whatever financial assistance I could.  But for now? Share the word about this concept.  That would be a massive help!

Examples of current products.  Some of the blanks intended to provide wholesalers and the finished products I currently retail are side by side... Then I tossed in a couple others just to show capabilities I intent to share:

story:
The Major Arcana, reimagined.

 

I started working on the Strath Tarot with the intention to use this deck for myself. The idea was to think of the meaning of each card and how I felt about it and create an image that represented, to me, the mood of that card. As the idea grew and I began to share the images with friends and family and across my social media I realized that this deck had its own intention and many readers who wanted to work with it. With that in mind, I made the decision that I would release this deck into the world. I successfully funded this deck on Kickstarter 7/16/20. 

Limited Edition

The first edition of The Strath Tarot will be limited to 500 copies.

I want to keep this campaign as simple and straightforward as possible, 22 cards and a tuck box. The cards were designed with the traditional Rider-Waite meanings in mind but also with the flexibility for your intuition. These cards will be printed at standard Tarot size, 2.75" x 4.75" on Black Core premium (Linen) - 310 GSM card stock with a gloss varnish. They will come in a tuck box.

Decks have been ordered and are due to arrive in September 2020. 

Note: colors you see on screen may vary slightly due to viewing the images through backlit monitors and printer differences. 

 

Who Am I?

My name is Casondra Oatman, I live in a small town in north-central Idaho called Kamiah, with my husband, my two stepsons, and my 2 dogs. I am a self-taught artist who works in many mediums. I started drawing in 2014 at the age of 25 as a form of therapy with a ballpoint pen and a dream. I work in acrylic, charcoal, pencil, and digital art. I also read Tarot. My heart is in every step of the process that it took to create this deck. I have spent hundreds of hours drawing, researching, and working to realize this dream so that I could share it with the world. I believe in the power of healing through The Tarot because I have used it for my own healing and seen the results. Feel free to visit my website www.casondraoatman.com to check out my work or to contact me. 

 

Risks and Challenges

The only problem I see arising is the potential for COVID-19 to possibly delay the arrival of the decks. However, I will work diligently to make sure that all decks are sent out as soon as possible and I will keep in contact with all who preorder should any issues arise.

story:
FREE SHIPPING

Greeting Card Series: Harriet the Hedgehog & The Great Outdoors.

A Year-Long Pen Pal and Coloring Set

Using my first card series, I've created Connection Boxes to nurture meaningful exchanges with loved ones, no matter the physical distance. Each Connection Box will include a stationery set sold as a pair - give one set to a loved one as a gift and keep the other. Write to each other once a month for a year. 

No need to wait for January to start -- you can begin the card exchange on any month of the year.  Snail mail is so fun, and it gives your loved ones something to look forward to each month. 

I designed each card by hand, created for you to color in using your imagination. After falling in love with hedgehogs upon meeting my first one a year ago, I’ve combined the tiny creatures with my love for camping & adventure to form the theme of my first card series.

Fun for adults & children.

Each box will include two stationery sets for a total of 24 cards, 24 envelopes, and 12 monthly writing prompts. Deluxe boxes will also include an assorted set of colored pencils and envelope stickers.

For maximum convenience, you can opt to purchase stamps, at cost, to add to your Connection Box. 

Perfect as keepsakes between grandparents and grandchildren, friends, and anyone you cherish. Share your love, strengthen your connection, and have a year of writing to look back on forever. 
 

There are business delays due to COVID-19 impacting shipping, printing, and communication efficiency. Please allow for several weeks between purchasing and receiving your Connection Box.

story:
Short Summary

100 Women and More has been almost six years in the making. I am both passionate and determined to do justice for my art and the women I am representing. As this project has grown, so have I. Join me in honor of those who have inspired you to pursue your dreams, against all odds!

 

My goal is to stage an exhibit of all 100 portraits, but it’s more than that. As I’ve worked on this series, I’ve had a growing sense of importance that people should be able to have the entire collection at their disposal. While the book will contain my selected 100 influential women, it will also include blank pages for the addition of the amazing and inspirational women in the buyer’s life whether world famous or known only in the family. Why have I included this element in the project? I realized that in one series of portraits, I could never hope to include every woman who has blazed a new trail or inspired others to follow in their footsteps. This opportunity to include those inspiring to you, creates a very personal connection to women’s stories and the owner’s own life.

What We Need & What You Get

All portraits are done!  So now, your funding will:

•       Pay for professional graphic design and layout of the book (about $3000)

•       Pay for printing and binding of 500 copies of the book (about $5000)

•       Pay for expenses to mount a gallery show, including printing of promotional materials

  • Pay for legal consult (almost $2000)

•       Pay for shipping materials

 

What’s in it for you? Check out the Perks to the right!

The Impact

In 2012, I was told that, as a tall woman with a low voice, I was intimidating. It was suggested that I learn to speak in a higher register. That same week, I watched the film “The Iron Lady.” The scene where Margaret Thatcher is coached to speak in a lower register so that her male counterparts would take her seriously hit me hard. “We women just can’t win,” I thought and thus was born the idea for an art project.

 

I wanted to highlight the double standards that exist for women and how successful women are often marginalized or criticized. I began by researching influential women in history and tried to find evidence of the criticisms hurled at them. However, 100 Women and More has taken on a life of its own. The response to sharing the first few pieces was overwhelming. The women chosen for the book were culled from lists of names offered up by friends and Facebook followers. The project is no longer about highlighting the double standard, but instead about allowing these women to stand on their own merit for their achievement. That’s more than enough.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge to this project is in ensuring that there are no copyright violations in what is published. I am working diligently to ensure that all images created are credited and that the words, while sourced, are my own. I have established a timeline for project completion that I am confident I can meet.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate, please don't feel upset!  There are other ways you can help me!  You can share the campaign on Facebook, Twitter, or in your own posts as well!

story:
Hi! I am Xiao.  I make sculptures, and they are often kinetic. 

I received an abandoned truck camper with broken hydraulic jacks mid September 2016.  It is an object that easily triggers one's sympathy, without a truck to travel with, this camper just sits statically, like a lost domesticated pet, or an amputated limb from someone's body.  While building proper support for this camper, I developed an urge to revive it.  

What better way to revive it than letting it walk?

Now I have designed a customized platform for the camper to go on, giving it 6 functional legs to stumble through space.  Feasibility of the project has been confirmed through consulting mechanical engineering, and electrical engineering professionals.  

If I gather enough funds, the camper will be up and running by April 2017!

Want a closer look at plans of this project?  Maquettes and drawings are being shown at Odeon Alley Window Gallery from January 16th to January 30th, Yates Street, downtown Victoria BC. 

Who Controls the Camper's Motion?

The answer is you. 

The camper's motion is controlled by an user inside of it.  A set of pedals will be set in frontal portion of the camper, with large amount of sensors that pick up pedalling pace and orientation, sending a message to control motor's amperage input and rotation direction.  Top bed area will be cut out and replaced by acrylic sheet, providing a wide view of where you are going. 

Who/where I go for technical obstacles

Theo Christiaanse 

Mechanical Advisor

Theo completed a Bachelor of Engineering and Master of Applied Science, currently a PhD student in mechanical engineering.  Luckily, I get to pick his brain for material selections, structural problems, and better assembly methods!

Steven Bjornson

Electrical Technician

Steven recently completed a master program combining computer science and visual arts.  I am in awe of his creativity and wide range of skill set.  I am more than glad to have his help with motor control!

What I Need

To build a platform with structural integrity that has enough power, I need your support to acquire the following parts and expenditures: 

  • I-Beams (legs)
  • Cost for accurate machining housings for axles, and joints. 
  • Motor & motor controller (AmpFlow A28-400-F48-G Gearmotor & VEX high voltage controller)
  • Deep cycle batteries with high ampere hour x 4
  • Hall effect sensors, reed switches
  • Welded hydraulic cylinders x 6
  • Sprockets, roller chain, bearings (Lots of them!)
  • Repair fee for HiJackers (cheapest way to safely lower the camper)
  • Scissor jacks
  • Coupling nuts, threaded metal, bolts (Lots of them!)
  • Rods and sheets of medal 
  • One large acrylic sheet
  • Rental fees for portable TIG welder
  • Cost for accurate machining housings for axles and camper's legs

With scholarship, other committed funding, and savings, there is $6500 still to raise. 

What You Get

Every bit of your contribution will go to producing the camper's platform.  Aside from my eternal gratefulness, you can also get priority test rides before the camper's debut in April, studio tours, prints of drafts, or a mysterious gift from me to you. 

The Impact

The walking camper is built for everyone.  

As the title suggests, the walking camper is meant to be something for people to ponder on.   I am not aiming for the camper to be an extravaganza that takes strides of pride.  It is rather a kinetic tableau of one who accepts vulnerability, and utilize that as a chance to obtain clarity.  This notion is heartwarming to me, and I want to share it with as many as I could through this project. 

Building this camper will not be an one woman job, a diverse group of creative individuals brings this project closer to reality each day by providing insights, discussing assembly solutions, possibility for materials, etc.  Your contribution for this project supports a diverse community, it also make this 1760 pounds truck camper into art, instead of a lump at a junkyard.  

Risks & Challenges

This is the most ambitious project I have ever attempted, with potential engineering challenges, and needs of labour help at some stages of assembly.  So if you feel like volunteering, for offering insight, labour help, etc, please do!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this page!  Tell you friends about the walking camper, the more the merrier!

Don't mind getting your hands dirty?  Enjoy working with medal and machines?  Email me at xiaoxueva@gmail.com   to set up a date working along with me, any help is greatly appreciated!

With scholarship, other committed funding, and savings, there is $6500 still to raise. 
What You Get
Every bit of your contribution will go to producing the camper's platform.  Aside from my eternal gratefulness, you can also get priority test rides before the camper's debut in April, studio tours, prints of drafts, or a mysterious gift from me to you. 

The Impact
The walking camper is built for everyone.  
As the title suggests, the walking camper is meant to be something for people to ponder on.   I am not aiming for the camper to be an extravaganza that takes strides of pride.  It is rather a kinetic tableau of one who accepts vulnerability, and utilize that as a chance to obtain clarity.  This notion is heartwarming to me, and I want to share it with as many as I could through this project. 
Building this camper will not be an one woman job, a diverse group of creative individuals brings this project closer to reality each day by providing insights, discussing assembly solutions, possibility for materials, etc.  Your contribution for this project supports a diverse community, it also make this 1760 pounds truck camper into art, instead of a lump at a junkyard.  

Risks & Challenges
This is the most ambitious project I have ever attempted, with potential engineering challenges, and needs of labour help at some stages of assembly.  So if you feel like volunteering, for offering insight, labour help, etc, please do!

Other Ways You Can Help
Share this page!  Tell you friends about the walking camper, the more the merrier!
Don't mind getting your hands dirty?  Enjoy working with medal and machines?  Email me at xiaoxueva@gmail.com   to set up a date working along with me, any help is greatly appreciated!

story:
Climate Toothpaste is my response to inertia around the issue of climate change. I'm an artist and I also volunteer/fundraise for three carbon-pricing groups. This project is my attempt to educate about climate change, and connect people who care but are not active on this issue, to climate activist groups that need help.

The scale and urgency of the climate change problem seems overwhelming. But there's good news: incredible organizations and volunteers are already working to contain climate change. They need your help, and Climate Toothpaste is here to help you, help them. Give them your time (volunteer!), or give your money...and that money starts by contributing to this Climate Toothpaste IndieGoGo campaign. 

My goal is to print 20,000 boxes, gift them to carbon pricing groups who can use them, and sell them online, and use them as artwork, all while educating and raising awareness about climate change. This fund will cover printing, building an e-commerce site, and shipping to climate activist groups who are working for proactive change. Online sales through the e-commerce sight will help fund future editions of Climate Toothpaste, at heavily subsidized rates for climate groups.

SUPER BONUS: If this campaign gets funded in 2 weeks, we will send Climate Toothpaste to the UN Climate Conference in Paris!

Once the e-commerce site is built, for less than $10 + shipping, you'll get a cool piece of art and help combat climate change. Let's spark some needed conversations about climate change. Let's put a price on carbon. 

Try Climate Toothpaste today!
* Please note the rewards that are Climate Toothpaste boxes can't be shipped until we reach at least $ 8,000 in funding.

Design: The box presents the urgency of the climate problem in an unexpected, funny format. Inside the box, you'll find a message telling you how you can connect with national and local climate-based organizations. (You can swap out this message for something else, since the box has recloseable ends.) Climate activist groups that get Climate Toothpaste free of charge will be able to do what they want with them. 

My art: Climate Toothpaste merges my artwork with my climate activism. I've been a visual artist for 15 years. My art is a running critique of consumer culture (see my website at heidicody.com). I often subvert brands to poke fun at how pervasive consumerism is.

With Climate Toothpaste, I'm drawing attention to an all-important issue by subverting an internationally recognized brand look. I want this unexpected artwork to jump-start conversations and involvement with this issue. What would happen if the word "climate" was as ubiquitous as a grocery product? Would it raise awareness of this important issue? I think so. Can this project serve as an outreach tool for climate groups that need help? Let's try, shall we?

So, why toothpaste?! Toothpaste implies and requires access to potable water. Water supplies are under threat from climate change. Another way to put it is: Without water, we won't be able to use our toothpaste. Then our teeth will fall out and everyone will have bad breath AND we'll be out of water. Let's not go there. As CarbonWA, a carbon-pricing group I volunteer for testifies: “We rely on Climate Toothpaste to help our campaign start every day feeling fresh and clean!”

4 out of 5 climate activists recommend Climate Toothpaste.

What do I do with Climate Toothpaste?

Place it in medicine cabinets of friends or family...Give it as a gift...Leave it in unexpected places...Customize your own message inside the box...Have fun with it! Help get it to the climate activists who can use it best, by supporting this campaign.

Risks: There is always some risk with appropriation of trademarked imagery. However as my website heidicody.com plainly shows, this is how I critique consumerism. With Climate Toothpaste, I am subverting an international brand to address an international problem. If anything, this pseudo-product actually raises brand awareness. I can defend myself with the principle of "fair use." I am exercising my right to free speech with this project, and so can you. My advisors tell me that the biggest risks would occur if someone were to install this pseudo-product in a grocery store. These risks have to do with trespassing, and with confusing customers. I cannot publicly endorse that type of crazy activity.

story:
Background

Jennifer Aos is an Eco-Friendly Interior Designer and artist.  Her 25 year career includes art gallery management, luxury sales, retail styling and interior design.  Her artwork was published in a magazine and featured in a gallery while a student at the Minneapolis College Of Art & Design.  Jennifer also completed an Interior Design Degree and has been awarded Top Interior Design Consultant from many employers.  In 2004, she launched her own company after her new employer in San Diego unexpectedly went out of business. She grew her interior design company, Anatomy Of Style, into a thriving one thanks to a client who began recommending her. Jennifer's success in San Diego continued for five years through referrals alone. 

Challenges

After a series of calamitous events in 2009, Jennifer suffered major financial losses due to numerous misfortunes including real estate fraud, recession, accident, divorce and relocation.  As a result, she has been unable to invest in marketing or maintaining her business which has set her back further.  Her website and technology tools are eight years old and need to be updated.  The industry has changed and is more competitive now than ever requiring her to invest in a marketing plan.  Although the industry was in decline for many years, it is currently improving and growth for this field is at 11%, which is above average.   

Plan

With the support of a crowdfunder campaign, Jennifer has a plan to rebrand and market her company; including a new branch featuring her artwork and green products. She has been studying green design and plans to become LEED certified this year.  She has a team of talented experts in place who are ready to get to work and make this a success.  Jennifer's long-term vision is to find a business partner and open a showroom which features Eco-Friendly home furnishings, local art and design services. 

Pay it forward. 

10% of donations received above campaign goal will be donated to Jewish Family Services of LA, who generously provided free counseling during Jennifer's transition out of an abusive marriage and is dedicated to domestic violence awareness and many charitable services. 

Special Bonus

In addition to the gifts, donors of $250+ will be listed on new website tab "Special Thanks"  and donors of $500+ will be invited to private party in Los Angeles after campaign ends. 

Other ways you can help

​Refer new interior design clients to my business and I will send you a gift!  Share this campaign!

Summary of campaign funds:

Marketing/Photography/LEED certification $5,000; New Website/SEO $5,000; New Macbook $2,000 (Current one is 8 years old); Adobe Creative Suite $1,000; AutoCad software $6,000; Art supplies $1,000; Overhead support during launch $4,000.  ($2,000 5% Indiegogo + CC fees)   

    

                                               

                                             

 

                        

 

 

 

 

        

 

                      

 

                                

                  

Please email me if you have questions or need details of gifts: jennifer@aosdesigns.com

story:
What is Color Vision?

Our eyes can see different wavelengths of light, and our brain perceives them as colors. Some people are awesome at differentiating color, but some people have a bit of trouble telling apart colors - usually greens and reds, but sometimes blues or yellows too. Color blindness affects 8.5% of the population.

What if we could bring color vision to the color blind in one of the most colorful and creative places in the world? 

A company called Enchroma has developed a lens that fits into glasses that can correct most types of colorblindness. After a few months of research and hours on Youtube, I've watched people discover "green" and "purple" and "pink" for the very first time. This year on playa I'd like to bring one pair of Enchroma glasses and find as many people as I can to show them the joys of color. On average of 5,500 people on playa are color blind every year.

ChromaMagic will be a project that develops creative contraptions that people look through using Enchroma's lenses to bring color to the color blind. Last year I built an amazing art project called Zooplankton, but I can't even imagine what it would have looked like without all of the amazing colors of LEDs on it. This year there will be hundreds of art projects on playa. As an artist, I want to help the visually disabled view these art projects in full color vision! I'll be volunteering at Cascadia Serepeum and Black Rock Observatory, but in addition I would like to bring ChromaMagic to other artwork to allow color blind people to view art in color. 


On my own I will be purchasing refraction glasses (the ones that make rainbows at night). If someone were colorblind they might see a scattered version of these rainbow bursts when they wore the glasses, but with the magic of Enchroma, they'll be able to experience nearly the full spectrum of colors. I'll also be bringing design books full of colorful photos and images for people to look at!

ChromaMagic will evolve into a larger art project over the next 2 years involving kaleidoscopes, viewmasters, led panels, a bike trailer with a sign, and space helmets.. but to get this project off the ground this year, we need money to purchase one pair of Enchroma glasses before we hit the playa this year! 

Indiegogo has a project minimum of $500

The funds from this project will go to:

Enchroma Glasses - $429
the remainder of any money raised will go towards the future of ChromaMagic including developing a ChromaMagic viewfinder and kaleidescope.



Risks and challenges

This project is last minute. That's why I'm creating an Indiegogo. If you don't think it's worthy then it's not going to happen this year.

Last year I completed Zooplankton, through all of its challenges. This year I'll be working shifts at greeters, Cascadia Serepeum, and Black Rock Observatory. Between this and my casual wanderings I know that I will be able to change the lives of people by showing them color for the very first time.

What does it mean to me? 
As a photographer and lighting designer, I can't imagine lacking color vision. The vibrancy of the world... my favorite sunsets in the desert, the shades of flowers in the spring, the shades of green that leaves create on the concrete... I want to bring this magic to others.


Rewards
Pledge $1 or more
Thank You
Virtual Thank You! You're helping someone to see color for the very first time!!
ESTIMATED DELIVERYAug 2016

Pledge $10 or more

Postcard from the Playa

I love thanking my backers! I'll send you a thank you postcard from the playa and tell you a story about what it was like when someone saw color for the very first time!

ESTIMATED DELIVERY Sep 2016

SHIPS TOAnywhere in the world


Pledge $20 or more

Rainbow Diffraction Glasses

Your very own pair of rainbow diffraction glasses! Look at the lights in your house! Wow, there are rainbows everywhere!

ESTIMATED DELIVERY Sep 2016

story:
Random Acts Of Poetry: A Moving Movement 

Now more than ever, America needs healing. Hope. Creativity. Kindness. Poetry. 

We need less arguing online. We need more connecting in person. Less hate. More love. Less nasty Tweets. More beautiful haiku. 

I've been hand-writing and hand-delivering (and hiding) Random Acts Of Poetry all across America for seven years now. I've seen first-hand how acts of kindness, in the form of hand-written haiku (and sometimes longer-form poetry), can make people feel appreciated. Honored. Amused. Amazed. Yes, the little things can go a long way. And several times a day, I hear "You just made my day." But I'm not doing this just for me. Or just one random person along the way. Oh no. We ALL need this. Now. More than ever before, maybe. 

There's a LOT of time and effort that goes into my poetic passion project. And I need YOU to help fund me. Help encourage me. Help me buy long-lasting pens. Quality custom index cards. Travel more. Reach out more. Connect. Deeper. I need you to help me share the love. Share the hope. Share the poetry. 

(I'm also doing my personal best to keep handwriting alive and well and flowing...)

Help Me. I'll Help You. And Haiku You! 

Any and all funds received here will go towards my life mission and personal passion project – Random Acts Of Poetry. Over the pasts seven-plus years, I've hand-written, handed out and hidden at least 12,000 Random Acts Of Poetry. This effort and commitment takes time. Energy. Resources. Discipline. Dedication. And funding! Help me out here. And I'll help you – and haiku you. Donate to this noble, needed cause, and I'll gladly send you a custom, hand-written haiku in the mail. I can also send you poetry via social media or email. Your choice!

The Impact Is REAL

I'm doing my best to focus on the common thread and universal connections, wants, needs and hopes of us all here in America. It's not easy these days, but I know that via poetry, we can all reach some common ground. And via kindness, we can all remember that we're all here in this one place, together, pursuing common goals. We all want to feel love. Give love. Be PASSIONATE about something, or someone. Random Acts Of Poetry serve as hand-written reminders of our power and playful agitators of ACTION to make our lives, our society and our planet a better place for all of us to live, work, play, grow and connect in. 

I often receive hugs from Random Acts Of Poetry. Sometimes, people cry a little bit. They often tell me, "You just made my day." Well, we all need to help make each other feel better right now, don't we? Help me help others, via the Peaceful POWER of Poetry. Help me help us all heal – at least a little bit. 

Rewards > Risks

The rewards here far outweigh the risks. But there are real risks. I've been threatened, demeaned, made fun of, called names and kicked out of certain places for Random Acts Of Poetry over the years. You never know what you are getting into with people these days, and to reach out at random to imperfect strangers takes guts and guile and runs some risk, surely. Especially in an angry and armed society. I've done OK and I know how to protect myself. But I'd feel even more emboldened knowing I have sheer numbers backing me up!

Other Ways YOU Can Help

Even if you don't donate, you can help me and Random Acts Of Poetry by sharing the information and link to this project. Even if you don't do that, you can help us all by practicing kindness – and committing various Random Acts Of Kindness. Remember, we all get to choose our actions and reactions in this life and this world. It's not always easy to be kind, but it does always feel good. It doesn't even have to be all that creative – but by being kind, you're helping create a better, sweeter, sexier, gentler, more peaceful and productive place for us all to live in. So get out there and be kind to someone. Think about someone other than just you. Please. Thank you!

story:
Geodesic Temple -CRYPTO- Bedouin Tech 2017

What is Geodesic Temple ?

The Geodesic Temple -SARCOPHAGUS- is an art installation. Geodesic Temple is an expression of the Disorient  Bedouin Tech philosophy: individual cells work together to create the ever-evolving landscape of life. As such, Disorient  Bedouin Tech is inspired by the biological model. It is an art-centered, inspirational and nourishing collective that feeds on positive energy. It is open source and creates systems that can be taken apart by others and from which new systems can be developed.

Geodesic Temple is a modular system that uses the octahedron as a modular building block to create self-supporting structures. The octahedron is one of the five platonic solids. It has been used through the ages in sacred geometry and spiritual architecture. According to various traditions, each of the five platonic solids carries special teachings. The octahedron, also known as “the seed of life,” is symbolic of the union of heaven and earth, which exists within each of us. It also represents the Heart Chakra, serving as an expression of self-love and compassion. The octahedron is connected with the element of Air, consciousness, the breath of life, and new beginnings.

 

What is Bedouin Tech ?

Bedouin Tech is a participatory festival in the desert of the UAE. BT is also a community – a network of friends built upon the collaborative production (and enjoyment) of art, parties, and radical self-expression.

Bedouin Tech is a Disorient event because the founders and many of the members of Bedouin Tech have been part of Disorient for many years. From its inception, Bedouin Tech relied on Disorient for guidance and support, and since then has drawn on a huge repository of practical, creative, and structural knowledge and resources.

Bedouin Tech and Disorient do not seek profit, all the revenue is reinvested in to the art and community.

 

CRYPTO

Geodesic Temple has been created and assembled in many events like Bedouin Tech, Playa Del Fuego, Disorient Country Club, Figment and Burning Man.

We are very excited to present this Cross Continental Disoriental Collaboration premiering again at Bedouin Tech 2017 in UAE

Crypto will be the first skinned Geodesic Temple, serving a social lounge underneeth.


3D model:

http://wiki.disorient.info/index.php?title=Geod...
 

COMPONENTS:

(6) octahedra
(96) 400cm long 2x4 studs (sourced in Dubai)
(96) Simas connectors (made in Dubai)
(36) Lowroad connectors (made in Dubai)
(888) 0.25" x 2.5" bolt/washer/nut combo
(96) 380cm white LED strips with power supply and controller

Templars:

Director, Design, 3D model: The Eye
Producers: The Eye, Firas, Warren
Connector advisors: Simas B., Lowroad
LED / Programming: Warren, Jacob, Robin, Vadim
Wood: Darcy, Jad, Gaurav, Ameed, Omar, Michel, Alper, Kareem, Rashid, John

Shade: Casey, Travis

Decor: Lisa, Joy

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need your support ! yes $$ :)  Funds are going towards: upgrading the shade, LED strips and components, renting a crane, modules !

What you get --> first our appreciation for this gift ! THANK YOU !

We also have very cool limited quantity SWAG for you !!

The Impact

Sargophagus will bring another cell to life, another group another family of individuals from all around the world ! working together to bring this project to life.

An engaged and inspired crowd at Bedouin Tech. Inspired to do something bigger !

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out ! share the project please, tell your friends

Lend a hand in the build, get involved. Email: Firas@Disorient.info

story:
OVERVIEW

If you're a fan of Then She Fell, Queen of the Night and Sleep no More, you will definitely love INSIDE THE WILD HEART. Our upcoming play is a fully immersive theatrical experience which showcases the work of Clarice Lispector's, Brazil's most acclaimed female writer. Our vision is to create a sensory play that serves as an entry point to Clarice's incredible --yet still mostly unknown in the US-- work.

INTRO

Clarice Lispector (1920-1977) is Brazil's most acclaimed female writer. She was described  by researchers such as Iba Mendes and Benjamin Moser as the most important Jewish writer since Franz Kafka, with her trademark stream-of-consciousness writing style often being compared to that of Virginia Woolf and James Joyce. In fact, Clarice's Complete Stories was recognized among the best books of 2015 by the New York Times and the Boston Globe.

The underlying thread across Lispector’s work is the questioning of oneself and humanity. Her work is universal, transcending ethnicity, race, religion, time, gender and place. Many people say, and we agree, that you don’t just read Clarice, you experience it.

We believe that Clarice's amazing talent deserves to be shared beyond just Brazil. In a place as diverse and fast-paced as New York City, people deserve to have their hearts and minds touched by Clarice's incredible world view. This is how Inside the Wild Heart was born, an immersive theatrical experience to transport audiences directly inside Clarice Lispector’s heart, performed by the only Brazilian Theater Company in NYC.

Clarice used to say that "all the world began with a yes." And to turn Inside the Wild Heart into reality we need you to say "yes" too. Support us in making it happen! Your "yes" will be your key into the wonders of Clarice's heart.

ABOUT THE PLAY​

INSIDE THE WILD HEART will be a site-specific, fully immersive and participatory theatrical experience. The performance will happen in a house setting where the audience will be able to walk freely from room to room following the performers and interacting with the environment​. Our vision is to create a show that encourages audiences to be active participants rather than passive spectators, and engage with literature on a sensorial level.

ABOUT GROUP.BR

We are a group of Brazilian artists who live in New York. As the only Brazilian Theater Company in the city, our mission is to bring Brazilian culture to New York stages through the performing arts. We use physical theater --where body movement is a form of communication-- as our main tool to expose the works of most renowned Brazilian artists. We provide audiences with a deeper, more nuanced exploration of Brazilian culture, beyond the familiar depictions of the country, as well as the unique opportunity to enjoy Brazilian dramaturgy and the musicality of the Portuguese language.

Where/ Onde

Immersive Gallery - Williamsburg, Brooklyn

When

November 3rd to 20th

  • Where does the money goes
  • Venue rental, rehearsals
  • Costume and set
  • Copyright 
  • Marketing
  • All the artists and other professionals committed with the project

Our real budget is U$60,000.00 but we want to be realistic about this campaign. If we do not achieve our goal in Indiegogo they get a larger percentage of the campaign. But even if we reach our goal, we still have a long way to go so we need your help like never before.

________________________________________________________________________________________

story:
Heavy Music Artwork launches world’s first and only metal and rock art magazine - Issue three pre-sell

Heavy Music Artwork has evolved into a leading publication for heavy metal and rock art. The brand is widely highly regarded for its outstanding reading material and in promoting heavy metal and rock as art and culture.

Heavy Music Artwork third installment is an introspective outlook on music and art. Rock and metal have a long tradition on existential questions. Our approach is neither analytical or interpretative instead we will go and revisit the creative journey that our feature artists have taken. With this in mind, we named this issue “Human”. 

All Heavy Music Artwork print editions specifications

  • Printed on high-quality uncoated stock, which gives texture and earthy feel
  • Ethically sourced and FSC approved and using vegetable based inks
  • Limited edition of 666 units hand numbered and stamp embossed
  • Perfect PUR binding on 250gsm (cover) Offset Paper
  • 100 pages (approx)
  • 3000 Copies standard edition printed to fulfil distribution commitments
  • 1000 Copies for this campaign which include the 666 limited editions

What We Need

Your contribution will help Heavy Music Artwork launch the 3rd magazine and secure future releases, and is also a way to pre-sell before it hits the stores around the word. As with the first two campaigns, we are looking to raise a base of £5,000. This will get the project off the ground and will give some breathing room to get issue 4 going.

This is an estimate of our costs and where the funds will go towards

  • 30% Production costs
  • 20% Marketing
  • 18% Overheads
  • 25% Printing costs
  • 7% Campaign fees

Our awesome perks

Our perks are simple and include something for everyone, please see side panel.

Vision & Mission

  • Provide the heavy metal community and industry with outstanding resources, material, information, news and updates
  • Promote graphic artists, music artists, record labels and agencies through interviews, biographies, artworks and in-depth profiles
  • Entice people to explore and experience life within the arts
  • Examine through music, art and literature all aspects of the human condition

The Impact

  • Your impact will not only benefit us as a publisher but the artists and the metal community as whole
  • We are dedicated to place the magazine in places where you wouldn't normally see a metal magazine like art galleries and museums
  • Our work has helped young artists getting the attention they deserve as well as getting paid jobs from bands
  • Heavy metal is one of the most relevant and influential art form and it must be celebrated as such, Heavy Music Artwork is the first to make this statement

Since our launch www.heavymusicartwork.com has enjoyed great popularity, reaching yearly 1 million page views, and 25,000+ monthly visitors. Promoted via all HMA social networks 80K+ Followers. Newsletter to 5K HMA email subscribers.

Labels and PRs that helped us along the way

Agonia Records, Century Media, Debemur Morti Productions, Earache, Indie Recordings, Lifeforce Records, Lion Music, Mascot Group, Massacre Records, Metal Blade, Napalm Records, Nuclear Blast, Peaceville, Pitch Black Records, Relapse, Season of Mist, Snapper Music, Southern Lord, SPV, Universal, Spinefarm, Warner Music, Svart Records.

Adrenaline PR, Asher Media, Audacious PR, Clawhammer PR, Cosa Nostra, Devil PR, Dewar PR, Domino Media, Duff Press, Earsplit, Factory Music, Fly PR, Future PR, I Like Press, Noble PR, Noise Cartel, Old Empire, Perfect Storm PR, Pioneer Music Press, Publicity PR, Rarely Unable, Red Sand PR, Savage Gringo, Scream Promotion, Silverblack, Stampede Press, Speakeasy PR, Stereo Sanctity, Team All About The Music, Visible Noise, Wilful Publicity and Work Hard PR.

What are the risks?

As with any project, there are risks involved in releasing a publication. We might not be able to deliver the end product on time, or we might run into problems with the printing and shipping. Our team has over 15 years in delivering creative projects of all sizes and shapes. The 1st issue is ready to go to print, so any problems are very unlikely.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: Ask your fellow metal head to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Please share and make the world know that metal is art in all its forms.

story:
ABOUT "THE BIG SANDWICH THEATRE COMPANY"

The concept of The Big Sandwich Theatre Company is the brain child of Randy Aronson, if not the actual name, which was forced upon him by the four other original troupe members. Randy's dreams included forming his own Santa Clarita acting troupe and casting who he wanted to work with in the productions. His inspirations included legendary melodramatic sketch comedy groups such as Low Moan Spectacular, Monty Python, Kentucky Fried Theatre, and, of course, the Carol Burnett Show.

Having directed most of this original group in previous productions, Randy had his first cast already in mind, including talented young actresses Tyler Joy and Sanya Arnold. Randy turned to entertainment jack of all trades Christopher Flowers, and well established playwright n' more Wade Bradford for help concieving the first production as well as developing the basics of The Big Sandwich as a company.

The trio brainstormed and improv'ed several ideas until finally settling on the groundwork that would become their first full length comedy "Change the Station." The authors then spent the next few months writing and rewriting the play, under their producer's supervision. With a finished script, a rented theatre, and a few more talented performers (with more patiently waiting in the wings!), The Big Sandwich was born.

Originally expected to be a "one off" experiment, those pesky troupe members kept filling Randy's mind with thoughts of rolling any successes from this first show, into a second, then a third, and so on. With some skill and a little luck, The Big Sandwich will hopefully serve up more of its hilarious hammy, cheesy goodness to L.A. County residents in a second show.

With your generous contribution, The Big Sandwich Theatre Company can launch a brand new world premiere production!

story:
Hi everyone,

 

I'm Helena Isis, founder of Magical Black Girl Productions and a nerdlesque performer.

For those not in the know, nerdlesque is a portmanteau of nerd and burlesque and it's exactly what it sounds like.  Nerdy burlesque!

I'm finally making a dream come true and producing my first show!  It's also the first all PoC (Performer of Color) show in my area as well as the first all PoC nerdlesque show in the South!

But, to make this dream come, we need some help!

Be one of the people to help get this first nerdleque show of it's kind off the ground!

story:
The Deck

The Infinite Loup Tarot Deck is a unique take on the archetypes of the tarot. Each card was lovingly illustrated over the course of a year with the hope of both upholding the original meaning of the cards while also giving a fresh perspective on them. Fantastic creatures on both two legs and four help tell several short, visual stories that will help the diviner to distinguish the meaning of each card visually. 

The Artist

For those who don't know, my name is Zack Loup. I've always been inspired by nature, fantasy, anthropomorphic animals, and stories of the paranormal, all of which can be clearly seen in my tarot deck. This deck has been a very personal project; it features several of my most beloved personal characters. I wanted to create a tarot deck full of things that inspire me, and hopefully, it will inspire you as well.

Where Does the Money Go?

If you donated $30 or above, you are getting a deck whether or not I reach my goal. The point of this campaign is to help me to order the first run of these decks so I can share them with the world. The more people who donate, the more I'll be able to order. Any extra money will be going right back into the deck, to help me pack and ship these out to you wonderful folks!

I will try my very best to get these decks to everyone who donates by Christmas, but it'll depend how fast I am able to get them from the printer. You can expect the deck by late December, or at the very latest early January.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're broke, please don't send me your last dollar. I understand, I've been there! Spreading the word about the campaign is a wonderful way to help without spending a dime. Sending encouragement is highly appreciated as well!

story:
ASMR vs théorie

Selon Wikipedia, l'ASMR (de l'anglais : Autonomous Sensory Meridian Response) est un néologisme qui décrit une sensation distincte, agréable et non sexuelle de picotements ou frissons au niveau du crâne, du cuir chevelu ou des zones périphériques du corps, en réponse à un stimulus visuel, auditif, olfactif ou cognitif. Ce phénomène est maintenant exploité via des vidéos de relaxation sur internet. Elles « déclenchent » l'ASMR grâce à diverses techniques : voix douces, tapotements, chuchotement, etc. Cette technique est utilisée pour la relaxation, pour aider à s'endormir… Elle acquiert peu à peu une communauté.

Je veux utiliser ce médium populaire pour narrer plusieurs textes écrits par des artistes, des théoriciens et des auteurs importants. L'objet ainsi créé est à la fois sincère et satirique, fonctionnel et inutile. Il pourra être consommé par le spectateur d'art contemporain ou par un utilisateur aléatoire du web en quête de relaxation. Je souhaite atteindre cet état de réception hétérogène entre la culture de masse et certaines sphères culturelles plus spécialisées.

Besoins et coûts

Je sollicite votre aide principalement pour rembourser l'achat d'un micro particulier qu'il m'a fallu acquérir pour démarrer le projet. Suite à une contribution de 10$, vous recevrez par la poste 3 fabuleux autocollants "I LOVE ANXIETY" (2 x 6") :

Merci!

Elles « déclenchent » l'ASMR grâce à diverses techniques : voix douces, tapotements, chuchotement, etc. Cette technique est utilisée pour la relaxation, pour aider à s'endormir… Elle acquiert peu à peu une communauté.
Je veux utiliser ce médium populaire pour narrer plusieurs textes écrits par des artistes, des théoriciens et des auteurs importants. L'objet ainsi créé est à la fois sincère et satirique, fonctionnel et inutile. Il pourra être consommé par le spectateur d'art contemporain ou par un utilisateur aléatoire du web en quête de relaxation. Je souhaite atteindre cet état de réception hétérogène entre la culture de masse et certaines sphères culturelles plus spécialisées.

Besoins et coûts
Je sollicite votre aide principalement pour rembourser l'achat d'un micro particulier qu'il m'a fallu acquérir pour démarrer le projet. Suite à une contribution de 10$, vous recevrez par la poste 3 fabuleux autocollants "I LOVE ANXIETY" (2 x 6") :
Merci!

story:
What is 'Very Special Arts'?

Very Special Arts (VSA) is an international arts and disability organization founded more than 35 years ago by Ambassador Jean Kennedy Smith to provide arts and education opportunities for people with disabilities, and to increase access to the arts for all. With 52 international affiliates and a network of nationwide affiliates, VSA is changing perceptions about people with disabilities around the world.

Yuba Sutter Arts is proud to be part of VSA California - which in turn is affiliated with the John F. Kennedy Center - in a way that positively impacts special needs students across the Yuba-Sutter Area.

On May 15, 2015 at Yuba-Sutter Mall in Yuba City, Yuba Sutter Arts will celebrate its 31st year of VSA with a specially requested theme of 'Country and Cowboy'.  With each year we serve more special needs students, and provide better art and crafts stations, photo booths, face painting, performances and awards for student showcases - please help us towards this year's goal!

How you can help

Support from  volunteers, community service organizations and businesses is vital - VSA is funded entirely through monetary contributions, in-kind donations and sponsorships. 

ANY amount of support provides special needs students with the experience of quality arts education and gives them an occasion to share their artistic achievements with their families.  However:

  • $500 will fund transportation and wheelchair accessible buses for a school
  • $300 will fund supplies, take home gifts, and program materials for an entire class
  • $100 will fund books and art materials for a class
  • $20 or less - anything you can manage - will be gratefully appreciated and invested in any of the above

How Yuba Sutter Arts 'Very Special Arts' creates impact!

Every year we receive letters from parents of students with disabilities informing us that Yuba Sutter Very Special Arts is their child's favorite event all school year, and thanking us for sponsoring it.  YOU can help us make it happen again this year! 

We positively influence and promote the four principles that guide VSA:

  • Every young person with a disability deserves access to high quality arts learning experiences
  • All artists in schools and art educators should be prepared to include students with disabilities in their instruction
  • All children, youth, and adults with disabilities should have complete access to cultural facilities and activities
  • All individuals with disabilities who aspire to careers in the arts should have the opportunity to develop appropriate skills

Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE HELP US SPREAD THE WORD!  Post this page via Facebook or Twitter, or send this link via email to your friends.  Let your colleagues and family know! We want to spread the word about this fabulous program for our young special needs artists, and raise much needed funds to grow it into the future!

story:
What is the project about?

This winter I was accepted to do an installation for the American Academy of Arts and Letters. My new piece, Taxonomy 23 forms of encounter (memory, afterimages, histories): Displacement is my largest art installation to date, custom designed for the Academy’s historical building in upper Manhattan. The sculpture is 12 feet high, and is an extremely detailed, mixed media composition that requires months of hard work on the part of a whole team of experienced artists to be completed.The piece is conceived as an extension of the Taxonomy project, a series I have been making for the last decade. In this latest elaboration, T-23 collects, even as it reconstructs, impressions of a space—taking into consideration the building’s architecture, historical roots, shifting spatial perspectives, and photographic / digital reinterpretations — making this ‘taxonomic’ collection tangible through mixed media. The materials used are large photographic papers, transparent fabrics, inks, wood and clay materials, cameras and projectors.

Who we are

I am a Brooklyn based multidisciplinary artist, and together with my wife, abstract painter, Marilyn Gold, I founded and run a framing business called Handmade Frames. I continually work with talented artists as collaborators and conspirators, giving younger artists an opportunity to do what they are passionate about and to be an integral part of my work. Whether I am employing sculptural, photographic or other mediums, my process rests on the belief that my artwork is an ‘author-less’ creation. I displace the construction and interpretation of my work to the realms of chance, memory, and the shifting relationships between a viewer and the piece. Please help co-construct this project; we invite you to be part of the collaborative fingerprint we leave in the Academy’s long and rich cultural history.

What we need & what you get

With this project, we are spending much more than we are asking for, so any extra dollar will be used to support 11 freelance artist assistants, and fund the long list of materials needed to produce the piece. While the request for $20,000 is daunting to say the least, we expect the piece to cost a significant amount more, and raising this amount would help offset the costs we are paying out of pocket.

The production costs of this project have been and continue to be large. We are asking for help to fund amongst other costs:

Photographic prints requiring large paper and inks - $2,000

Cameras for time lapsing images - $3,000

Re-creation of space in my studio - $8,000 plus creation of parts of piece -$4000

Both creating in the studio and then installing the piece in the actual space with artist assistants, all fully paid - $5,000

There is a large scope of prizes and opportunities to donate, so we encourage you to give what you can. In return you will receive the best kind of thank you—the ability to actively participate in my realization of this installation at the American Academy of Arts and Letters, and a choice of many of the perks below.

The perks:

For $5 a heartfelt thank you and a shout out on our social media page.  We will also include you on our website under “the people who made this project happen.”


For $10 a signed Paul Baumann postcard. Receive a Paul Baumann taxonomy photograph on a postcard, signed by the artist, for display in your home/office. We will also include you on our website under "the people who made this project happen.” (100 available)

For $50 Paul Baumann’s Yellow Taxonomy book, limited edition. A stunning book detailing Paul’s yellow piece, with both visuals and writing included, and signed by Paul. We will also include you on our website under “the people who made this project happen.” (150 available)


For $60  an archival digital print of the 6 Polaroid collage, from the herewereyou project, artist’s design, (size 13 x 19 inches).  We will also include you on our website under “the people who made this project happen.” (30 available)

For $75 Digital signed Polaroid print, 8"x10",

For $100 Digital large scale Polaroid print. A 24 " x 24 " enlarged archival signed print of a Paul Baumann Poloroid.

For $175 Digital large scale Polaroid print, FRAMED. A 24 " x 24 " enlarged archival, signed print of a Paul Baumann Poloroid.

For $300 A tour of the Academy of Arts and Letters Invitational Exhibition, up March 12-April 12. Meet with Paul Baumann to see the show and discuss the various artworks displayed. Paul will give you a great perspective on the other artists, as well as talk about his piece! We will also include you on our website under “the people who made this project happen.” (2 available)


For $500 A workshop in Paul’s studio. You and your friends will spend time at Paul Baumann’s Brooklyn art studio, learning about Paul’s process, getting your hands in the work, and taking a piece you build home for yourself or leaving it to end up in Paul’s final installation. If there was ever a time to check out the Brooklyn art scene, this would be it! This perk is limited to before March 6th. We will also include you on our website under “the people who made this project happen.” (1 available)


For $900 An original signed Paul Baumann Polaroid, in a frameless display. This speaks for itself, as Paul’s Polaroids are beauty personified. We will also include you on our website under “the people who made this project happen.” (10 available)


For $1,500 A Paul Baumann acrylic work on paper (20" x 30"), in a Handmade Frames white lacquer glazed modern frame, with shipping/delivery paid by you. These acrylic works are rhythmic abstract pieces on mostly rice paper, sure to visually stimulate your home for years. We will also include you on our website under “the people who made this project happen.” (3 available)

available

not available

available 

For $4,000 Paul Baumann's pink taxonomy piece (a life sized photograph 68" x 68") framed in a beautiful Handmade Frames modern frame. This piece was shown at the Sideshow gallery in 2010 and is one of Paul’s most popular pieces to date. Stunning and fun work to be owned by someone very lucky. We will also include you on our website under “the people who made this project happen.”  (1 available)


For $10,000 For the serious and adventurous art collector, Paul Baumann will custom design and install a taxonomy piece in your home (Tri-state NY region, no more than 96" high 18"deep 72" wide). This would speak for itself, and would be a great investment and addition to your thriving art collection. We will also include you on our website under “the people who made this project happen.” (unlimited)

story:
Je m'appelle Séverine j'ai 37 ans maman célibataire par choix pour le moment...
Je suis moitié moitié mi suisse mi française et pourtant  je me sens ni l'une ni l'autre...

Depuis mon adolescence, je perçois un problème qui me dérange : comment peut on envoyer des gens sur la lune et laisser mourir des personnes de faim sur notre terre ? Je pense avoir compris à ce moment le pouvoir et l'argent, les frontières et la politique.

C'est par la danse et la musique que j'ai pu évacuer et transformer ma frustration, colère, tristesse jusqu'à maintenant.

Mais je ne peux me résigner à fermer les yeux et avancer tel un mouton en rentrant dans un cadre, donc une image de moi qui n'est pas moi. J'ai commencé à reprendre ma vie, mon moi à 30 ans, et c'est un long chemin fastidieux douloureux parfois mais libérateur.

Après la création de l'association OseZ en 2011 active dans le sport, la danse et la culture.

2015 Achat d'une maison et petites bâtisses à rénover avec 4 hectares de forêt et prairies près du lac du Vouglans.

Je souhaite créer un endroit de ressourcement et bien être par des ateliers, conférences, stages,weekends, semaines à thèmes.

Il y en aura pour tous les goûts : du physique, mental, émotionnel, spirituel, il n'y aura qu'à choisir.

Je ne souhaite pas devenir riche, juste utiliser ma vie à bon escient et ne plus sentir toute cette souffrance que nous portons depuis trop longtemps maintenant. 

Les fonds versés seront utilisés à mettre l'assainissement, amener l'eau et l'électricité dans les bâtisses. Pour le moment, eau de source non potable et rénovation de la maison principale datant de 1850 environ et inhabitée depuis plus de 20 ans.

20 000 pour un avoir un assainissement autonome végétal, car assainissement quasi inexistant pour le moment.

15 000 pour la réfection, les menuiseries, eaux et électricité appartement.

30 000 pour la rénovation de la grange, eau, électricité et évacuation si possible

5 000 matériels, outillages

Réhabilitation et rafraichissement avec diversification de la forêt. Jardin naturel, un terrain d'expérimentation en respect avec notre terre.

En contrepartie j'offre la possibilité à chacun de venir "s'expérimenter" dans mon humble forêt et être au cœur du projet, créer la vie est un art osons.

En soutenant ce projet c' est un pas vers le changement et le dépassement de  nos frontières personnelles et mondiales.

Vous apportez votre soutien en faisant passer le mot,  en parlant autour de vous, en vous portant volontaire lors de weekend travaux. Je dit déjà merci pour ce soutien que j'ai de mes amis, connaissances et membres de OseZ.

Prochaine étape création de la structure de ce terrain de jeux partageant la suisse et la france cela va-t-il être possible ? 

www.osezgeneve.ch / www.d2f.fr
