story:
Short Summary

Bangin' Studios is the joint production team of Julius DC Bautista, a Chicago based pop artist and USMC veteran, and Michael J. Zdanowicz, a Chicago based writer and comic book enthusiast.  The two of us have been close friends since we first met at an art exhibit in 2013, immediately finding common ground in blurring the lines between 'high' and 'low' art.  Sharing a passion for narrative analysis and deconstruction, we've tossed around ideas related to reinvigorating various genres of art, and how we could make art more accessible to the public.

Our first project will be a Pop Art Exhibition featuring the installation of a life sized comic, where each panel of the story is its own wall sized painting.  We'll be sharing the first part of a three issue narrative, "La Revolución," a story about several unlikely protagonists who band together under the unified cause of revolting against a fictional totalitarian empire.  As an homage to the world of comics and illustration, our rotating cast of heroes are each designed to allude to various narrative tropes, giving our setting a familiar and nostalgic ambiance.  We've finally developed a plan and structure for what we hope is the first of many ambitious projects, but we need your help in taking our dream to the next level.

Incentives: What You Get

As a gallery style art exhibition, we will be selling the work we produce.  It would be unfair for our contributing supporters to not be compensated for their good faith.  By donating to our project, you will have the first pick on our available works.  We will be promoting images of some of the art as they are produced, and we will be sharing non-public photos of completed works with contributors who are interested in selecting a piece to take home.  Though the art will be up for a month's time, selected works will be listed as NSA (not for sale), and will be reserved to those who donate.  The following is the incentive tier. 

  • $30: Limited edition autographed graphic novel of La Revolución, or 1 small scale digital print
  • $50: 2 small scale digital prints or 1 medium scale digital print
  • $100: One original extra small scale canvas painting (8x10 - 11x14)
  • $225: One original small scale canvas painting (12x16 - 16x20) 
  • $350: One original small scale canvas painting (12-16 - 16x20) & One extra small scale canvas painting (8x10 - 11x14).
  • $500: Original medium scale canvas painting (18x24, 20x20, 22x28)
  • $750: Original large scale canvas painting (24x30 - 24x36)
  • $1000: Original extra large scale canvas painting (36x48 in.)
Please expect to receive the works around the beginning of August.  Additionally, contributors of $350 or more have the option of receiving an original commissioned painting instead of a work from the show from the artist of their choosing.  

What We Need:

We have a location and a date set for our first show, as well as enough supplies to give us some initial traction.  What we need now are funds to support the cost of materials and marketing.

MATERIALS:

  • $500: Canvasses of varying sizes
  • $750: Cost of artistic prints (Limited edition prints of digital work, and archival prints of paintings)
  • $250: Budget for brushes, paints, inks, paper, pens, and pencils
While we have the tools and means of marketing ourselves through social media and print, we have an opportunity to set our goals high, so that we can grow and develop our project into a bi-annual release schedule divided into a pre-production and a post-production period.  To reach that goal, we would like to utilize the networks and audiences of established .
MARKETING:
  • $300: Cost of prints for self marketing (fliers, post cards, collectibles)
  • $150: Budget for digital advertising space through social media
  • $250: Budget for digital and printed ad space through established blogs, and news outlets
ADDITIONAL EXPENSES:
  • $150: Estimated cost of two day truck rental during installation period
  • $100: Cost of installation supplies (marking tape, labels, wall print for gallery synopses)
  • $750: Budget for graphic novel print (The exhibition will be converted into a print sized comic for future distribution and promotion of subsequent volumes)
  • $300: 3 day space rental at upcoming Wizard World convention to further promote our concept

The Impact

Because we are collaborating our efforts from different backgrounds, we hope to revolutionize (sorry for the pun) and reinvigorate attitudes pertaining to both scenes.  We believe that art is constantly evolving, constantly reflecting the attitudes of the society it represents.  With the advent of technology, communication, and social media, we have strong beliefs pertaining to the idea that art of all backgrounds should be more accessible.  

Risks & Challenges

We primarily have two large obstacles to overcome.  The first is a time constraint: this project demands a high volume of art to be produced.  To ensure an end result that matches our vision, we have developed a strict production schedule for ourselves and a number of artists that we have brought in to assist with the work load.  The second is a matter of marketing..  The growth of this project is dependent on an active community of supporters and fans.  Fortunately, Michael and I each have the skills to react to these hurdles.

Project Development:
I studied Studio Arts at the University of Illinois in Chicago, where the curriculum was primarily focused on project development and coordination.  I spent my first two years after college showing in and coordinating over twenty group art exhibitions while running a 6 person team at the Fulton Street Collective.  My latest project was a solo artist exhibition that saw a high volume of traffic, nearly selling out on opening night.  In three month's time, I was able to put together a cohesive vision for my show funded only by my savings.

Marketing:
Michael has been worked in sales for over five years, establishing a strong network and working rapport with prominent members of the illustration and comic book industry.  Michael will be using his experience along with my proficiency in Photoshop and Illustrator to reach out to our network, and to extend our reach eventually through continued promotion.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, we certainly understand.  Spreading word about our project will certainly help us reach our goal.  If you'd like to share our message, you can use the Indiegogo share tools, or copy and paste the following links:

http://igg.me/at/banginstudios/
http://www.facebook.com/banginstudios/

Thank you so much!
story_txt:
Short Summary Bangin' Studios is the joint production team of Julius DC Bautista, a Chicago based pop artist and USMC veteran, and Michael J. Zdanowicz, a Chicago based writer and comic book enthusiast.  The two of us have been close friends since we first met at an art exhibit in 2013, immediately finding common ground in blurring the lines between 'high' and 'low' art.  Sharing a passion for narrative analysis and deconstruction, we've tossed around ideas related to reinvigorating various genres of art, and how we could make art more accessible to the public.
Our first project will be a Pop Art Exhibition featuring the installation of a life sized comic, where each panel of the story is its own wall sized painting.  We'll be sharing the first part of a three issue narrative, "La Revolución," a story about several unlikely protagonists who band together under the unified cause of revolting against a fictional totalitarian empire.  As an homage to the world of comics and illustration, our rotating cast of heroes are each designed to allude to various narrative tropes, giving our setting a familiar and nostalgic ambiance.  We've finally developed a plan and structure for what we hope is the first of many ambitious projects, but we need your help in taking our dream to the next level.

Incentives: What You Get
As a gallery style art exhibition, we will be selling the work we produce.  It would be unfair for our contributing supporters to not be compensated for their good faith.  By donating to our project, you will have the first pick on our available works.  We will be promoting images of some of the art as they are produced, and we will be sharing non-public photos of completed works with contributors who are interested in selecting a piece to take home.  Though the art will be up for a month's time, selected works will be listed as NSA (not for sale), and will be reserved to those who donate.  The following is the incentive tier. 

$30: Limited edition autographed graphic novel of La Revolución, or 1 small scale digital print
$50: 2 small scale digital prints or 1 medium scale digital print
$100: One original extra small scale canvas painting (8x10 - 11x14)
$225: One original small scale canvas painting (12x16 - 16x20) 
$350: One original small scale canvas painting (12-16 - 16x20) & One extra small scale canvas painting (8x10 - 11x14).
$500: Original medium scale canvas painting (18x24, 20x20, 22x28)
$750: Original large scale canvas painting (24x30 - 24x36)
$1000: Original extra large scale canvas painting (36x48 in.)

Please expect to receive the works around the beginning of August.  Additionally, contributors of $350 or more have the option of receiving an original commissioned painting instead of a work from the show from the artist of their choosing.     What We Need: We have a location and a date set for our first show, as well as enough supplies to give us some initial traction.  What we need now are funds to support the cost of materials and marketing.MATERIALS:  $500: Canvasses of varying sizes $750: Cost of artistic prints (Limited edition prints of digital work, and archival prints of paintings)

$250: Budget for brushes, paints, inks, paper, pens, and pencils 
While we have the tools and means of marketing ourselves through social media and print, we have an opportunity to set our goals high, so that we can grow and develop our project into a bi-annual release schedule divided into a pre-production and a post-production period.  To reach that goal, we would like to utilize the networks and audiences of established .
MARKETING:


$300: Cost of prints for self marketing (fliers, post cards, collectibles)
$150: Budget for digital advertising space through social media
$250: Budget for digital and printed ad space through established blogs, and news outlets


ADDITIONAL EXPENSES:


$150: Estimated cost of two day truck rental during installation period
$100: Cost of installation supplies (marking tape, labels, wall print for gallery synopses)
$750: Budget for graphic novel print (The exhibition will be converted into a print sized comic for future distribution and promotion of subsequent volumes)
$300: 3 day space rental at upcoming Wizard World convention to further promote our concept

   The Impact Because we are collaborating our efforts from different backgrounds, we hope to revolutionize (sorry for the pun) and reinvigorate attitudes pertaining to both scenes.  We believe that art is constantly evolving, constantly reflecting the attitudes of the society it represents.  With the advent of technology, communication, and social media, we have strong beliefs pertaining to the idea that art of all backgrounds should be more accessible.     Risks & Challenges  We primarily have two large obstacles to overcome.  The first is a time constraint: this project demands a high volume of art to be produced.  To ensure an end result that matches our vision, we have developed a strict production schedule for ourselves and a number of artists that we have brought in to assist with the work load.  The second is a matter of marketing..  The growth of this project is dependent on an active community of supporters and fans.  Fortunately, Michael and I each have the skills to react to these hurdles.Project Development:I studied Studio Arts at the University of Illinois in Chicago, where the curriculum was primarily focused on project development and coordination.  I spent my first two years after college showing in and coordinating over twenty group art exhibitions while running a 6 person team at the Fulton Street Collective.  My latest project was a solo artist exhibition that saw a high volume of traffic, nearly selling out on opening night.  In three month's time, I was able to put together a cohesive vision for my show funded only by my savings.Marketing:Michael has been worked in sales for over five years, establishing a strong network and working rapport with prominent members of the illustration and comic book industry.  Michael will be using his experience along with my proficiency in Photoshop and Illustrator to reach out to our network, and to extend our reach eventually through continued promotion.   Other Ways You Can Help If you are unable to contribute, we certainly understand.  Spreading word about our project will certainly help us reach our goal.  If you'd like to share our message, you can use the Indiegogo share tools, or copy and paste the following links:
http://igg.me/at/banginstudios/http://www.facebook.com/banginstudios/  Thank you so much!

story:
THE SITE_SPECIFIC COLLECTIVE
integrating culture & nature
JOZI LAND ART 2016 & 2017 : ANNUAL EVENTS FUNDRAISER
Johannesburg Botanical Gardens, South Africa
www.sitespecific.org.za

VIDEO: promotion for JOZI Land Art 2014

As cultural practices continue to impact negatively on our natural environment, we are called upon to revisit our approach and attitudes towards nature. 

Site_Specific Collective projects use visual arts as a practice to invite people into natural spaces, asking them to reconsider and reframe their relationship with nature.

For this we rely entirely on the contribution and support of the general public. We ask you to support this endeavour by providing the funds we need to cover basic operational costs, offer our artists material support, and sponsor community workshops.

NOTE: Site_Specific disbanded its NGO structure in 2016 in favour of forming a collective of people passionate about art and the environment. (more info below)

ABOUT
Site_Specific Land & Nature Art
integrating culture & nature

A collective of artists, volunteers & specialists in the practice of land & nature art.

Site_Specific was created to promote land art and its associated site-specific genre’s in a conscious effort to raise awareness around environmental and social issues within a visual arts context. 

By integrating the concepts of culture and nature, Site_Specific wishes to re-align our lost relationship and kinship with nature. 

VOLUNTEERISM & THE GIFT ECONOMY
Site_Specific is a project that relies on the volunteered labour & contributions of its organisers, participants, friends and supporters as part of the gift economy.

 

SHIFTING PARADIGMS
Our hope is to set up a debate using the practice of visual arts and crafts within an environmental context, taking the conversation to communities challenged by the most extreme effects of social and environmental degradation. 

Our project includes the presentation of workshops on the practice of land and nature art, and our purpose is to raise awareness and educate.

As artists we wish to enact the paradigm shifts required to change the narrative behind destructive environmental practices.

 

OPEN & FREE
All our events, workshops, and presentations are open and free to participants and the general public.

ABOUT
To find out more about the Site_Specific project:

 

  • sitespecific.org.za/about

BACKGROUND
Site_Specific International Land Art Biennale’s

In 2011 and 2013 Site_Specific hosted its first two successful International Land Art Biennale’s with the tremendous support and investment of the Plettenberg Bay community and municipality along the Western Cape coast in South Africa. The collaboration between business and art won the BASA (Business & Arts South Africa) Award for Environment and Art in 2012.

 

  • sitespecific.org.za/land-art-biennale-2011
  • sitespecific.org.za/land-art-biennale-2013

 

JOHANNESBURG
Site_Specific JOZI Land Art events, #JoziLandArt
Johannesburg Botanical Gardens, Emmarentia

Site_Specific has inspired regional projects across South Africa, one of which is based in Johannesburg: the annual JOZI Land Art event. Hosted at the Johannesburg Botanical Gardens in Emmarentia, the event engages local artists and communities in the practice and philosophy of land and nature art.

 

  • sitespecific.org.za/jozi-land-art

PREVIOUS EVENTS
The first three Site_Specific JOZI Land Art events took place in 2014 & 2015, running on the goodwill and contribution of artists, organisers, and photographers.

 

  • za.pinterest.com/sitespecificafr/2015-jozilandart
  • za.pinterest.com/sitespecificafr/2014-jozilandart

FOLLOW US
Our online platform is important to us, and we consciously employ it to educate and share:

 

  • www.facebook.com/JOZI.land.art
  • twitter.com/SiteSpecificAfr (@SiteSpecificAfr)
  • za.pinterest.com/sitespecificafr

 

OPEN & FREE
All our JOZI Land Art events are open and free to participating artists and the visiting public.

EVENT BUDGET
Site_Specific JOZI Land Art 2016
Opened Sunday 1st of May at 12h00

This fundraising campaign bid aims to raise a minimum fund of ZAR 50,000 (GBP 2,500) for our next events coming up on the 1st of May 2016 & next year's event in 2017.

 

  • facebook.com/events/193347014374000/

 

FIRST GOAL
OPERATIONAL COSTS

To begin with, we need ZAR 50,000 (GBP 2,500)  to cover the basic admin and media costs of organising each event. 

Operational costs help cover aspects such as website maintenance, event organising, media releases, social media campaigns, videography coverage, signage, and the all-important aspect of documentation and cataloguing central to each of our land art events. 

Land and nature art is an impermanent practice, installations and interventions disintegrate and degrade in the natural context in which they are created. Documentation is central to our practice. Sharing this documentation with our online audience is part of creating a secondary virtual site – contributing to the global conversation and education around culture and nature. 

GOOD PRACTICE GUIDELINES
For each of our events artists are issued with our Good Practice Guidelines document aimed at promoting sensitivity and positive engagement with nature and the communities artists encounter.

SECOND GOAL
ARTIST SUPPORT BUDGET

If we raise ZAR 100,000 (GBP 5,000), we will be able to support participating artists.

South African artists are in particular need of financial support. With these funds we can offer artists a predetermined budget to work with. Land and nature art does not produce permanent artworks that can be sold, and its practitioners rely on sponsorship.

THIRD GOAL
COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT PROJECTS

To invite active community participation, our ideal goal would be to raise a total of ZAR 200,000 (GBP 10,000) for these events.

One of Site_Specific's central mandates is to collaborate with and co-opt regional communities, introducing the philosophy and practice of land and nature art, and engaging in workshops on sustainable crafting techniques using natural materials. 

Workshops and presentations set up the opportunity for conversation and debate around issues of land, sustainable resources, the realities of poverty and access, and the impact on local natural environments by destructive practices.

Workshops encourage participating visual artists and creative craft practitioners to interface with local communities and the general public, extending the conversation and debate across diverse professional, cultural and social practitioners.

OPEN & FREE
As with all our events, these workshops and presentations are open and free to participants and the general public.

PLEASE SHARE & DISTRIBUTE 

Please share & distribute Site_Specific's JOZI Land Art campaign on your social media platforms, and follow us on our facebook page.

"Site_Specific JOZI Land Art, integrating culture & nature, needs your support for their annual land and nature art events at the Johannesburg Botanical Garden in Emmarentia, South Africa. Follow #JoziLandArt and join their facebook page www.facebook.com/JOZI.land.art/ ~ if you can't be there, click here. If you are in the area, please join them, their events are OPEN & FREE to the public."
EVENT LINK: https://www.facebook.com/events/193347014374000/
FUNDRAISING LINK: www.indiegogo.com/projects/art-in-nature-events

CROWD FUND CAMPAIGN
MOTIVATIONS & INTENTIONS

[•]SQUAREDOT MEDIA
Please note that all contributions will be paid into a PayPal account run by Site_Specific's online media co-ordinator, katty vandenberghe of [•]squareDot Media.

WE ARE A COLLECTIVE
Site_Specific dissolved its NGO structure in favour of being a collective of artists and individuals interested in a common purpose. All Site_Specific team members operate under their personal business infrastructures and profiles. 

THE GIFT ECONOMY
We are a volunteer-based organisation operating in the gift economy, receiving the support of individuals and businesses who are passionate about our project.

A KindEarth_intentions FUNDRAISING INITIATIVE
This is the first of many fundraising efforts under a new initiative called 'KindEarth Intentions' run by [•]squareDot Media, a venture focused on fundraising and building online presence for projects engaging concepts that integrate culture and nature.

After many years of supporting NGO, activist and art initiatives through online media and documentation, [•]squareDot Media will be implementing 26 years of experience and skills in design, publishing, arts, education, activism and community projects.

facebook.com/KindEarth-Intentions

CREDIBILITY REFERENCES
For credibility references please contact Site_Specific's national co-ordinator, Anni Snyman.

 

  • sitespecific.org.za/contact

If you have any further queries or concerns, please feel free to contact the campaign manager at Site_Specific's donation@ email account.

 

  • sitespecific.org.za/donation

CAMPAIGN MANAGER
katty vandenberghe
web media co-ordinator & crowd funding campaigns manager
Site_Specific, #SiteSpecificAfrica
www.sitespecific.org.za

 

ONLINE REFERENCES
To find out more about the crowd fund campaign manager, please view their linkedin profile here:  www.linkedin.com/in/kattyvdb

story:
▼When you help me in Japanese, please look at the Motion Gallery website.
　日本語での支援をご希望の方は、以下のリンクから応援をお願い致します。
https://motion-gallery.net/projects/cell_art_ouma

A New Perk RELEASED!

Japanese most popular illustrator drew the characters. 1 special cards and 2 cell art cards. Just $10!

A little about this project

“Cellchain”. It's a unique pair accessory  that connect you to someone else in the world. Just think about it! There is someone else in the world with the same accessory as you!

This is THE project to visualize such unseen bonds.

I want you to be more conscious that you and people around you are supporting each other with this project “Cellchain “, the cell accessory links you with someone else in the world”.

What is “Cellchain”?

It's the pair cell accessory that connect you to someone else in the world!

I use cell as theme to make all these “Cellchain”, there is only one of each pair in the world. They are hand made and I make every one of them with all my heart!

You will receive one of a pair cell accessories and the other half of the pair will be sent to someone you don't know.

Somewhere in the world, someone else will have the same accessory as you.......!
And what if you met the person with the same accessory......!!!
The idea of this project is that you can find out your link with someone you don't know!!

How does “Cellchain” work?
How does it connect me to someone else in the world?

What you get are these cute little cells!

Materials: Resin clay, Acrylic color
Weight:iPS cell is approx.0.6~3.0g. Mitochondria is approx.2.0-7.0g. Purkinje cell is approx.5.0-12.0g. Doggy is approx.7.0-14.0g.
Shipping:They are all shipping included.
*We are trying to keep the weight accurate to the first decimal point, however, because they are all handmade the weight will sometimes be a little above or below the displayed weight.
*Cellchain is a Crowd funding project and there is no plans to sell it anywhere else.

I love cells!! A cell-loving ex-vet is the mother of these cell art!

Hello there!! I'm Ouma and I use cells as the theme of my art work. I used to be a vet. And as a vet it is in my the nature to heal hearts. In 2011 I started to use art to find the way to heal without operations or drugs. When I was a vet I was studying to be a pathologist to analyze cancer cells. Although my dream did not come true, I now use cells in my art work with the theme of “Healing and Unifying” to make the world one!

I'm passionate about all things cells and creatures! It's my dream to travel around the world and meet people in different countries just like blood cells providing oxygen to every single cell in our body. My favorite cell is the Purkinje cell which is located inside of the cerebellum, I remember that I was counting these cells so eagerly for dissertation!!

The nerve fibers growing from Purkinje cells are spontaneous, so beautiful and massive that they are even known as the tree of life.

Why am I using cells as my theme?

It is said a grown up human is made up of 37 trillion cells. The definition of a cell in biology, is it's the smallest unit of life. There is no unnecessary cell in the 37 trillion cells! Liver cell and kidney cell might never encounter each other but they are helping one another to build one human life.

Just like human body is made up of a lot of cells, society is made up of a lot of people who you'll never have chance to get to know. And because of them we can get benefits like eating delicious meat, having warm clothes and living in a nice house.
Source for number of cells: An estimation of the number of cells in human body (2013)

The message I want to spread through this project

When things don't go well at work, breaking up with boyfriend or girlfriend, losing a loved one. No matter how lonely you feel, and when you think it is too hard to live on your own, you are never really and truly “living ALONE”!!! Have a light in front of you. Have something to wear. Even if you don't always realize it, we are all supported by someone who we have never met. At the same time, you are one of the someones who is supporting, too. I would be happy if you could truly realize that you yourself are“one of the lives that are supporting each other” with these cell accessories. The idea of this project is to visualize and to make bonds like this noticeable - bonds you never noticed

Risks and challenges

All the cell accessories are hand made. That means each accessory is slightly different from the others. I hope you enjoy the hand made texture. I hope to be able to ship these orders out within two months. However if there is a lot of contributions, deliveries may take a little longer.

When you scramble to get your own there's never enough, but if you share there's plenty.

Thank you for reading this far. 10% of all contributions will be donated to iPS cell research at Kyoto University. I'm hoping this project helps society, as a living life, to live a healthier life. We appreciate any support greatly.

What Contributions Go For

Motion gallery fee 10%
·Donation to iPS cell research at Kyoto University 10%
Web page (just Giving) :http://justgiving.jp/c/11263
·Materials for accessories and shipping cost
·My daily food (Mostly UDON)
I'm grateful for your support for my campaign to spread cell art around the world!

▼Ouma Home page
http://oumavet.com/

Wishing for our world where nobody feels alone.

Why am I using cells as my theme?
It is said a grown up human is made up of 37 trillion cells. The definition of a cell in biology, is it's the smallest unit of life. There is no unnecessary cell in the 37 trillion cells! Liver cell and kidney cell might never encounter each other but they are helping one another to build one human life.

Just like human body is made up of a lot of cells, society is made up of a lot of people who you'll never have chance to get to know. And because of them we can get benefits like eating delicious meat, having warm clothes and living in a nice house.Source for number of cells: An estimation of the number of cells in human body (2013)
The message I want to spread through this project
When things don't go well at work, breaking up with boyfriend or girlfriend, losing a loved one. No matter how lonely you feel, and when you think it is too hard to live on your own, you are never really and truly “living ALONE”!!! Have a light in front of you. Have something to wear. Even if you don't always realize it, we are all supported by someone who we have never met. At the same time, you are one of the someones who is supporting, too. I would be happy if you could truly realize that you yourself are“one of the lives that are supporting each other” with these cell accessories. The idea of this project is to visualize and to make bonds like this noticeable - bonds you never noticedRisks and challenges
All the cell accessories are hand made. That means each accessory is slightly different from the others. I hope you enjoy the hand made texture. I hope to be able to ship these orders out within two months. However if there is a lot of contributions, deliveries may take a little longer.

When you scramble to get your own there's never enough, but if you share there's plenty.
Thank you for reading this far. 10% of all contributions will be donated to iPS cell research at Kyoto University. I'm hoping this project helps society, as a living life, to live a healthier life. We appreciate any support greatly.
What Contributions Go For
Motion gallery fee 10%
·Donation to iPS cell research at Kyoto University 10%
 Web page (just Giving) :http://justgiving.jp/c/11263
·Materials for accessories and shipping cost
·My daily food (Mostly UDON)
I'm grateful for your support for my campaign to spread cell art around the world!
▼Ouma Home page
http://oumavet.com/
Wishing for our world where nobody feels alone.

story:
OBJECTIF

Le concours est organisé par le Club Art, Culture et Média (ACM) de Réseau ProActif au profit des enfants malades.

Ce club n’est pas uniquement destiné aux professionnels mais aussi aux amateurs tout comme aux personnes qui souhaiteraient admirer et/ou encourager les œuvres des talents cachés.  Il a en effet pour ambition de réunir les amateurs d’art autour des mêmes valeurs de partage et de joie.

Dans cette perspective le club ACM organise ce concours de création de chapeau dont le but est d'aider aux enfants malades et les faire rire.

HISTORIQUE : CONCOURS DE CHAPEAU 2013

Le concours de chapeau a été organisé pour la première fois le 6 avril 2013 par le Club Art, Culture et Média (ACM) de Réseau ProActif. Dans un souci de réaliser un projet à la fois caritatif et artistique, tous les moyens ont été mis à disposition par l’équipe du club ACM. C’est ainsi que plus de vingt professionnels et amateurs se sont réunis pour fabriquer des créations uniques de chapeaux. Lors de la soirée de Gala du 6 avril 2013, les chapeaux confectionnés ont été présentés au public lors d’un défilé. Le jury composé de trois professionnels de la mode ; Marie Odyle DEDEQUERRE, formatrice styliste à l’Ecole de la Chambre Syndicale de la Couture

Parisienne, Bayram OLCER, propriétaire de MONAHONAR, Maison de Prêt-à-porter de Luxe Femme et Héloïse DOUET, professionnelle, couturière professionnelle (employée chez Chanel), sont alors passés par la rude phase d’élimination afin de sélectionner les trois meilleures créations.

Les chapeaux ont été vendus aux enchères et l’argent collecté a été versé à Téléthon.


CONCOURS DE CHAPEAU 2015

Les partenaires : Le Rire Médecin et l'Institut Nénuphar

Le thème choisi pour cette année 2015 est : les contes de fée et les super héros.

Le concours se déroulera alors entre le 9 février 2015 et le 2 mars 2015 et réunira ses premiers à nouveau lors de la soirée de remise de prix qui aura lieu le 7 mars 2015 en présence de personnalités importantes qui constitueront le jury.

Le lauréat du concours sera récompensé par un prix de 300 euros, le deuxième de 200 euros et le troisième de 100 euros.

Les règles de participation :

Veuillez consulter notre site web pour plus de détails : https://www.reseauproactif.org/concours-de-chap...

Composition du jury :

-  Mylène ATANASSOVA - styliste, peintre. A partir de 2002 elle intègre le monde des créateurs et designers. Givenchy, Lanvin, Louis Vuitton, Stella McCartney avec différentes fonctions et puis elle fait un bout de chemin dans plusieurs collections de géant de la mode comme Alexander McQueen, et travaille actuellement comme consultante et professeur-enseignant Art visuel et illustrations de mode.

-  Marie Clémentine BENDO - styliste, Directrice de l'association  AFMSCP Association des Femmes Médiatrices Sociales et Culturelles de Pantin


BUDGET

Budget total : 3250 €

  • Budget : location de la salle : 1000€
  • Prix décernés : 600€
  • Cocktail : 300€
  • Cocktail pour les sessions travail : 3x50€ (salles mises à disposition pour notre partenaire l'Institut Nénuphar)
  • Matériel à mettre à disposition : 300€
  • Frais de pub (design affiche + impression) : 500€
  • Frais de caméraman pendant la soirée : 400€
Plus de la moitié du budget étant déjà assurée par nos sponsors/mécènes, il nous reste à financer 1500 €. L'argent récolté suite aux dons et financements ainsi que la vente aux enchères des chapeaux sera reversé à l'association Le Rire Médecin.

CONTREPARTIES

Nous offrons des billets d'entrée en VIP au Gala du Concours qui aura lieu le 7 mars 2015.

De plus, nous délivrons un rescrit fiscal à tous nos donateurs car nous sommes une association reconnue d'intérêt général.

Également, nous avons des offres uniques pour nos sponsors (Platinum, Gold, Silver). Veuillez nous contacter pour plus de détails sur nos offres.


D'AUTRES FAÇONS D'AIDER


Vous êtes tous invités à la soirée gala et remise de prix du concours qui aura lieu le 7 mars 2015. Ne tardez pas à vous vous inscrire sur notre site internet.

N'hésitez pas à en parler autour de vous et à inviter vos proches.

Venez nombreux !

story:
Creating Higher Ground, Inc. is fiscally sponsored by Unique Projects, Inc, a New York State not-for-profit 501(c)3 organization administrated by Pentacle/DanceWorks, Inc. 


Network. Connect. Collaborate. Present. 

Ever thought, a choreographer, documentarist and a magician would come together in an artistic collaboration?  

Or that the collaboration would focus on the Dominican Republic's most powerful dictator Trujillo who welcomed Holocaust victims as refugees during the Second World War?  

A contemporary choreographer intrigued by creating dance to film audio and dialogue, a documentarian with a film about Dominican and Jewish teens exploring this little known chapter of Holocaust history, and a magician devising a trick inspired by the experience of his relatives who witnessed the Holocaust first hand -- these artists have come together in a whole new project not only to represent history but the rich culture of our neighborhood.

"Sosua" by Lead Artists Gentry Isaiah George, Renee Silverman and Harry Mandel is just one project for the 2015 Higher Ground "Premieres" Performance. 


A Festival to Inspire and Support Artistic Conversations and Collaborations!

We want to see more interdisciplinary works like “Sosua.” 

This campaign is raising $15,000 for the Higher Ground Festival which unites Washington Heights & Inwood artists of all disciplines to network and create original performance-based collaborations to be presented in the local community. The collaborations stem from our overarching goal of bringing artists together and establishing an interconnected network as a resource in defining and expanding the cultural identity of our communities. 

Our inaugural performance of "HG Premieres" is June 27th, 2015 at the Anne Loftus Playground stage. We are the culminating event of the Northern Manhattan Arts Alliance 2015 Uptown Art Stroll.

Presently we have 25 local professional artists involved in the festival. Their disciplines range from dance to film, music to magic. Several of the artists have their own pool of artists to perform with us, bringing our total count of participants to 40 artists. The artists all met though our HG Artist Meet & Greet series where participating artists united to network and bounce around ideas of collaborations for the ultimate performance.  

"I am interested in participating in the festival because I think it is really important to get to know the artists of your community, to be inspired by them and make connections so you may collaborate in the future.  In this business it is always about just who you know, so the more people you know uptown, the more art you can make uptown."- Meghan Ginley, HG Artist, Musical Theater/Acting/Directing

"I became interested in joining [HG Festival] to get out of my comfort zone and experience different artistic disciplines.  I think the festival is good for Washington Heights as it will bring different experiments, create works people alone would not create-- it will bring more creativity to the Washington Heights/Inwood area." - Edwin Urena, HG Artist, Illustrator, Designer of 2015 Uptown Art Stroll Poster


We need $15,000 to make this production happen!

We wish to offer the artists all we can to make these collaborations a brilliant reality. Each chosen project receives donated neighborhood workspace, project stipend and artistic advisory (if requested). 

Your donation will contribute to:

  • Project Stipends: This is very important for us. Each selected collaboration will receive a project stipend to cover creation costs, this can be for materials, artist pay, costumes, etc. We want to offer each project $500, if not more. This stipend gives the artists opportunity to create a fully visualized project. 
  • Production: Our great Production Manager, Joshue Bob Rose, is taking helm behind the scenes. He strives to create the most cost-effective and professional presentation, but there are hard costs associated with performance. We need audio and lighting equipment, proper dance floor, transportation, event rentals and crew to create the production set up these artists deserve. 
  • Administrative Work: The HG festival is in its first year so every small task is coming out-of-pocket, including filing for a nonprofit status, acquiring the right permits and promotional materials. We want to do everything the right way and that takes a little more spend. 

And Hell, it's not all about the green. We are a passionate group... but we are still only so big and we could use all the help we can get! If you wish to contribute in any way, we would be most appreciative:  

  • Volunteer for set up or during the show
  • Spread the word about the festival
  • Supply workspace
  • Supply art materials

It takes a community...nah! It takes two communities.... nah! It takes the greatest effort by all people to build an area's art identity!  


What will an interconnected network of artists bring to the neighborhoods?

Let us introduce you to Washington Heights and Inwood neighborhoods. We are the tippy top, nose bleed section of the great theatre that is New York. Our sidewalks are a ruckus of bachata music, Dominican & Russian food, doctors of Columbia-Presbyterian Hospital, Jewish traditions, two generation families on Saturday strolls, college students & young professionals -- and a grand wave of artists.  

In the last decade, both communities have proven an inviting home to professional artists of NYC.  Residents of the neighborhood take the full spectrum of art careers, and it is felt throughout the streets from the urban art and instrument bearing A-train swingers, to the operatics resounding from the open windows of apartments. Many artists know each other in their fields but few find the opportunity to connect with other creators, especially those just next door.  And that is where Higher Ground Festival steps in-- it is time to unite the artists, and celebrate their talents through collaborations. Together we can establish Washington Heights and Inwood neighborhoods as art and cultural destinations in the city.   



Donor Perks!

Please know that every amount contributed is appreciated, and we want to give back as much as we can in thanks! Donation perks include:

  • Social Media and Website recognition
  • Signed Poster of the Event
  • Photo from the paralleling Photography Project "Artists in Residence" by HG Artist Michael Rosenfeld.  The study offers intimate portraits inside homes of Washington Heights/Inwood artists highlighting how a life of art does imprint itself within one's residence. 
  • Invitation to Donor/Artist Meet & Greets
  • Reserved seating at the June 27th, 2015 performance
  • Invitation to Open Rehearsals
  • Class by HG Artist


Meet the Co-Founders:                                                                                         

Hola! My name is Pablo Francisco Ruvalcaba.  Originally from Tijuana/San Diego, I have been living in Inwood for the last 10-years.  I am a graduate of the Juilliard School, principal dancer of the Jose Limon Dance Company and teacher of the technique, and presently part of the Brooklyn Academy of Music DeVos Fellowship.      

Hello! My name is Temple Kemezis.  6-years ago I discovered Washington Heights as a refuge from the rambunctiousness of NYC, and have slated it my home ever since.  Am originally from Tennessee, but no accent.  I perform with Dances Patrelle, Intermezzo Dance Company, Ballet Neo, Sensedance and several other ballet companies throughout New York City and in Pittsburgh.  My background also includes working as a contributor for Pointe Magazine, and working as PR/Event Manager for Chef Julian Medina. 


About Northern Manhattan Arts Alliance (NoMAA), HG Festival Partner

The Northern Manhattan Arts Alliance (NoMAA) is a non profit arts service organization launched in 2007 with the support of the Hispanic Federation and the Upper Manhattan Empowerment Zone.  NoMAA's mission is to cultivate, support, and promote the works of artists and arts organizations in Northern Manhattan.  NoMAA advocates for support to artists and art groups who live and work in Northern Manhattan and contribute to the vitality and progress of the who community. 

NoMAA's Uptown Arts Stroll is an annual showcase for the arts, artists and rich cultural venues throughout Upper Manhattan.  Since 2003, the mont-long festival promotes the works of artists in all disciplines, and the many community attractions of Washington Heights and Inwood.  Higher Ground Festival will be the culminating performance for the 2015 Uptown Arts Stroll.


Please join our effort!

This project will enliven the community, unite neighbors and connect artists with resources and opportunities to expand.  The community craves this festival, and the support for it has been nothing less than 100%.


THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Short Summary

HI! I'm kemo and I've been a part of the Apogaea community for 8 years. As a member of Ignition, I was the DPW lead for 4 years and I'm currently the Internal Graphic Designer.  I have worked closely with the BOD over the years and in my opinion, it is one of the hardest and most unthankful positions within Apogaea. The Apogaea Board of Directors works year round to ensure the community has an awesome playground to express unique art and a radical culture.

I have been to three Igniton retreats and there has always been "talk" about showing the BOD some sort of appreciation. Well, it's time to "walk that talk" and this will be a great way to say thank you to the people that are on the whipping post 365 days a year. I'd like to propose that we, the community, fund these kicker-ass lapel pins that I have designed.

Although there is a budget for volunteer schwag, the entire budget goes towards other volunteers and departments with nothing directed for just the board members. (Goes to show how selfless the board truly is and has been.) 

What We Need & What You Get

I have designed three unique lapel pins that will be cast in metal that looks like antique bronze, antique silver, and antique gold. The bronze pin is for one year of service, the silver pin for two years, and the gold pin for three years. Each pin is 1.75" tall x 1.5" wide with two rubber clutch attachment posts. 100 pins of each design will be produced (300 total) and all past, current, and future BOD members will receive theirs accordingly. 100 pins of each design is the smallest increment that can be made.

The cost break down: 

  • Custom Soft Enamel Lapel Pins w/ 2nd post- $ 2.36 each
    - 1.2mm thick with gold/silver/bronze metal plating (as per breakdown)
    - (2) 8mm post with rubber clutch attachment
    - Each lapel pin will arrive packaged in an individual poly bag
    - FREE - Custom Mold Fee
    - FREE - Shipping
    - 55.00 each - (2) Additional Mold Fees
    Total:  $ 818.00 (300 x $2.36 + 2 x $55.00)
  • 8.5% sales tax = $69.53
  • Total cost for 300 pins which includes shipping and tax = $887.53.
  • Indiegogo campaign fees could be 4-9% depending on the level of campaign success. I'm adding an additional 9% or $79.88 to the total cost for padding.
  • If I don't reach the full goal, I will take the funds received and produce what I can. I could potentially just make the bronze one year pins and go from there.
  • I have stickers, patches and 3 Ignition lapel pins to offer as perks. You'll also gain the personal satisfaction of showing some appreciation and gratitude. 

Social Impact

A little appreciation goes a long way. When people volunteer hundreds of hours to a cause, a thank you gift is a great way to commend them. Apogaea is a GIFTING COMMUNITY and this would be an awesome gift for the people that have committed their blood, sweat, and tears to the Apogeae Board of Directors.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Please help spread the word and make some noise about this campaign. Please feel free to share this on social media and in emails. Thank you!
story_txt:
Short Summary HI! I'm kemo and I've been a part of the Apogaea community for 8 years. As a member of Ignition, I was the DPW lead for 4 years and I'm currently the Internal Graphic Designer.  I have worked closely with the BOD over the years and in my opinion, it is one of the hardest and most unthankful positions within Apogaea. The Apogaea Board of Directors works year round to ensure the community has an awesome playground to express unique art and a radical culture.
I have been to three Igniton retreats and there has always been "talk" about showing the BOD some sort of appreciation. Well, it's time to "walk that talk" and this will be a great way to say thank you to the people that are on the whipping post 365 days a year. I'd like to propose that we, the community, fund these kicker-ass lapel pins that I have designed.
Although there is a budget for volunteer schwag, the entire budget goes towards other volunteers and departments with nothing directed for just the board members. (Goes to show how selfless the board truly is and has been.)    What We Need & What You Get
I have designed three unique lapel pins that will be cast in metal that looks like antique bronze, antique silver, and antique gold. The bronze pin is for one year of service, the silver pin for two years, and the gold pin for three years. Each pin is 1.75" tall x 1.5" wide with two rubber clutch attachment posts. 100 pins of each design will be produced (300 total) and all past, current, and future BOD members will receive theirs accordingly. 100 pins of each design is the smallest increment that can be made. The cost break down: 

Custom Soft Enamel Lapel Pins w/ 2nd post- $ 2.36 each- 1.2mm thick with gold/silver/bronze metal plating (as per breakdown)- (2) 8mm post with rubber clutch attachment- Each lapel pin will arrive packaged in an individual poly bag- FREE - Custom Mold Fee- FREE - Shipping- 55.00 each - (2) Additional Mold FeesTotal:  $ 818.00 (300 x $2.36 + 2 x $55.00)
8.5% sales tax = $69.53
Total cost for 300 pins which includes shipping and tax = $887.53.
 Indiegogo campaign fees could be 4-9% depending on the level of campaign success. I'm adding an additional 9% or $79.88 to the total cost for padding. If I don't reach the full goal, I will take the funds received and produce what I can. I could potentially just make the bronze one year pins and go from there.
I have stickers, patches and 3 Ignition lapel pins to offer as perks. You'll also gain the personal satisfaction of showing some appreciation and gratitude.     Social Impact A little appreciation goes a long way. When people volunteer hundreds of hours to a cause, a thank you gift is a great way to commend them. Apogaea is a GIFTING COMMUNITY and this would be an awesome gift for the people that have committed their blood, sweat, and tears to the Apogeae Board of Directors.

    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Please help spread the word and make some noise about this campaign. Please feel free to share this on social media and in emails. Thank you!

story:
About Us

Frank Ragano and Mariannah Amster launched the first CURRENTS as a small local show in 2002, in order to create a platform for video and New Media artists who had few options to show their work in Santa Fe, New Mexico. 

www.currentsnewmedia.org

What began with 8 local artists has grown into a dynamic festival that presents the work of over 100 artists, performers, programmers and scholars from all parts of the USA, and all continents of our beautiful globe. The 2016 Festival, which ran June 10-26, included, robotics, multimedia performance, interactive audio, new media and video installations, 3D printing, App and Web art, outdoor projections… and more. 

The CURRENTS festival has no cost of Admission, yeah, IT'S FREE.


Parallel Studios, a nonprofit 501 (c)(3) organization, raises money throughout the year in order to keep the Festival free for all and to continue to offer travel, shipping and lodging support for the artists who come to Santa Fe to install their work. This year the Festival covered these costs for 34 artists.

We strive, not only to keep the Festival free, but we are also proud to be able to give New Media artists an opportunity to create without the pressures of the Marketplace and to give voice to the 21st century in ways only these new creative tools allow. 

Everything, artists logistics, curation, bookkeeping, exhibition design, graphic design – everything) is done in house by Mariannah and Frank (the two founders and Co-Executive Directors) and Hannah Kramm (the Outreach+ Coordinator that keeps everything moving forward). Our small working board is made up of artists, tech heads, dreamers, and philanthropists (who don’t hesitate to get their hands dirty when it’s time to install) with diverse ethnicities and backgrounds.

"Hypnagogic Hypnopompia" by Reilly Donoval / Virtual Reality

Why Are We Running This Campaign?

Running a festival of this scale is expensive, and each year as we continue to grow so do the costs of production. 

Over the years we have been fortunate to be able to keep up with expenses through grant writing, which is still the foundation of our funding. We’re turning to you, our art loving/believing crowd to help us get through this year’s expanded demands in housing and shipping expenditures. 

  • We are running this campaign for $15,000 to help cover the cost of travel and lodging for our 34 artists that came from out of state/country to be here at this festival that they make amazing. (plus our awesome interns!) 


Rental for our exhibition venues goes up every year, this year – $13,500.

Total costs of travel, accommodation and shipping for artists this year -  $30,000.

And then there are costs for production supplies, scissor lift rentals, wifi, craft services and much more -$50,000.

Then, of course, there is advertising, insurance, admin salaries and on and on.

Your contributions will help take this Festival through its 2016 iteration and launch us into 2017, allowing us to stay in the black while we bring New Media Arts into local classrooms, provide access for artists to professional networking and offer the public an exhilarating journey through the interactive, visceral, fearless world of New Media Arts.

"Extraterrestre" by Victoria Karmin / single channel video

Why This is Important

New Media Arts have the power to engage youth, awaken an abandoned love of the arts in a jaded elder, connect the general public to a world of creative thinking and innovative action.

The artists that come to the Festival find collaborators for future projects, developers to help them manifest a once thought impossible vision, friendship and an opportunity to experience the Southwestern landscape that makes your mind open like a fan.

Every year’s Festival is a new take on the Art/Technology world. The Festival focuses on how artists are using technology in an ever changing landscape of innovation and discovery.

We also have a strong youth focused commitment. Through our Youth Media Makers Program we visit regional high schools giving the students the opportunity to see the latest in 21st Century art and offering them the chance to have their own work presented at the Festival. A first this year was a partnership with Youth Shelter's Access program for at risk youth. The teens attended once a week classes in May, taught by Little Globe staff, to familiarize them with AV equipment and then came on as paid interns at the Festival. They even created a wonderful video work that we presented. On top of these two programs we had over 200 youth from the City's Summer Camp Program and two other schools take guided tours of the main exhibition.

Our local audience looks forward to this event every year. Out of town visitors experience the haunting juxtaposition of a rich indigenous culture that persists in the shadow of Los Alamos Labs all laced together at CURRENTS where the timeless drive of creativity melds technology with humanistic vision.

Testimonials:



Perks:

Hwayong Jung  Cosmos_4
http://hyjung.net
(example of original artist prints)

MARFA pillows by Marion Claire Wasserman
marionclairewasserman.com


Max Almy Terri Yarbrow, Portal for Fire 
Distressed Medicine Cabinet with small LCD screen, Gallery price $5000
http://www.maxalmy-teriyarbrow.com/Max_Almy_and_Teri_Yarbrow/Home.html

Woody Vasulka MMouth 

http://www.vasulka.org

Woody Vasulka Slide 81
http://www.vasulka.org

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Sharing this campaign with your friends and family
  • Come volunteer for us! https://currentsnewmedia.org/volunteer/
  • Like our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/currentsnewmedia/
  • Submit work for next year's festival! Our call for submissions opens mid August. Check our website for updates.

story:
My Story

After several years of producing fine art for Disney and other big companies, I've decided to follow my passion and combine my love of art with my love of sports.  Becoming an MLB licensed artist has been a dream come true, but starting up this business has been a costly one.  Between the licensing fees, printing costs and the whopping price of admission just to get into a venue to sell my pieces, it has been a bit overwhelming.  My passion is capturing former, current and future legends of baseball with a vintage vibe that reminds us of the good old days of America's favorite pastime. Your support can help me finally overcome the financial hurdle of starting this new business and allow me to bring my artwork to a vibrant city with endless possibilities.


What I Need

I'm asking for help with part of the costs to set up a booth at the "Art of Baseball" at the 2016 MLB All-Star Game Fanfest in San Diego.  


Where the Money Goes

$5,000 for the booth at Fanfest
$2,000 for shipping artwork across country and booth setup
$3,000 travel and lodging (because someone needs to man the booth, and hopefully I can wow baseball fans and art lovers with my brilliant personality.)

What You Get Out of the Deal

Art, Art and more art.

  • contribute $10 - the eternal gratitude perk: You will receive a shout-out thank you post on The Art of Mike Kupka Facebook and Twitter. (Not to mention his endless devotion.)
  • contribute $40 - the poster perk: You will receive a poster of Mike Kupka's specially designed 2016 All-Star Game logo, signed by Mike.  (And of course, the previously mentioned endless devotion.) LIMITED TO 50 SUPPORTERS                                                                                                                              
      
  • contribute $100 - the team pride perk: You will receive a limited edition giclee on canvas 8x8 mini logo with the team of your choice.   Each comes signed and numbered. (Plus, don't forget, the endless devotion.) LIMITED TO 20 SUPPORTERS


  • contribute $130 - the distressed all-star perk:  You will receive a limited edition giclee on canvas 14x14 distressed 2016 All-Star Game logo or substitute the same size logo of your favorite team.   Each comes signed and numbered. (There's still more endless devotion for you, too.) LIMITED TO 10 SUPPORTERS


  • contribute $500 - the Rivera perk:  You will receive a limited edition giclee on canvas 12x36 edition of "Exit Light, Enter Night" depicting Mariano Rivera doing what he does best, striking out the side.  Each comes signed and numbered. (And yes, the endless devotion).  LIMITED TO 5 SUPPORTERS

  • contribute $1,200 - the raw original perk:  You will receive an original graphite on raw canvas drawing featuring the player of your choice. Signed by Mike Kupka. (Don't forget the endless devotion) LIMITED TO 3 SUPPORTERS

  • contribute $3,500 - the all-star original MVP perk:  You will receive an original 16x20 oil on canvas painting featuring the player of your choice, signed by Mike Kupka (For you, endless devotion times infinity)

(NOTE: unfortunately, the perks above are only available for supporters in the United States due to shipping logistics.)


Risks & Challenges


My portrait of Ozzy Osbourne caught the eye of a Disney Company representative, leading to an eight-year stint as a licensed artist for the Disney.  After that I created several originals and limited edition prints for Lucas Films.  Some of those originals are now in the private collection of George Lucas.  I won first place in Beckett’s 10th annual Sports Gallery Contest and was named one of U.S. Art Magazine’s “25 Artists You Should Know.”  In addition to Disney Fine Art and Lucas Films, I have produced artwork for Topps, the NFL, NBA, NHL and King Features.  My pieces appear worldwide in galleries as well as in the private collections of numerous athletes and celebrities.

I studied at duCret School of Art in Plainfield, NJ where I was introduced to the work of my greatest influences: Rembrandt, Norman Rockwell, Robert McGinnis and James Bama, by my professor and mentor, Peter Caras. 

I'm involved in several charities.  I have donated artwork or portions of sales to The Ashley Lauren Foundation, Ronald McDonald House New York, The Ed Lucas Foundation, The AHRC New York City Foundation and the New York Yankees Foundation.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, I understand! I would love your help to spread the word! Please share the link to my campaign on Facebook and other social media channels! Getting the word out is imperative and will make all the difference in funding my campaign!

story:
En el Museo Nómada nos interesa pensar en temas de arte contemporáneo, planificar intervenciones artísticas y organizar complots para mejorar las condiciones de vida en la ciudad. Las actividades toman tres formas concretas: comisión de obras de arte, exhibiciones pop-up y charlas/conferencias. Los fundadores del proyecto somos la artista Rosa Jijón, el urbanista Jaime Izurieta y la curadora Anamaría Garzón. 

Derivas es nuestro primer proyecto público. Invitamos a siete artistas para que hagan cartografías de la ciudad, ellos son Fabiano Kueva, Santiago del Hierro, Roberto Vega, Sofía Acosta (La Suerte), Wendy Ribadeneira, Pamela Cevallos y Pablo Andino. Derivas pone un lente sobre aspectos de la vida en el espacio urbano, muestra modos de ocupar y entender la ciudad y las relaciones que se tejen en lo cotidiano. 

Para financiar nuestros proyectos, aplicamos a grants y auspicios, pero también creemos que es importante que más personas se involucren, para eso creamos el Club de Amigos del Museo Nómada. Con tu aporte al club recibes distintos tipos de beneficios y formas parte fundamental de este proyecto. 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes 

  • Necesitamos 7000 dólares para diseñar e imprimir el catálogo de Derivas y financiar los siguientes proyectos del Museo Nómada.  
  • Entre las recompensas tenemos una tarjeta del Club de Amigos del Museo Nómada con beneficios en Librería Rayuela, Hansel&Gretel y Casa Warmi. 
  • Al entrar en el Club de Amigos del Museo Nómada recibes también pins, bolsos, catálogos... Los regalos dependen del tipo de donación.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Lizz Brady, I am an artist from Manchester, UK.

I am offering original works of art in return for your help to keep funding my studio and to keep making art. Recently I had my disability living allowance cut, and lost the subsequent appeal, so I am struggling to pay for materials and studio rent.

I am the founder of Broken Grey Wires, a contemporary art organisation responding to and exploring mental health. We also work closely with the community and critically acclaimed artists like David Shrigley, The Chapman Brothers and Stuart Semple, to open up a dialogue and provide inspiration and opportunities for people with mental health difficulties.

Renowned psychiatrist R.D Laing proclaimed that “Madness need not be all breakdown. It may also be break-through.” 

This concept follows our ethos for Broken Grey Wires, creating a space for people to feel comfortable and participate in the project, for art to become a facilitator for recovery, and for Broken Grey Wires to encourage people to make something special for themselves.

I founded Broken Grey Wires so I could create a focus for myself, I have been very ill with personal mental health difficulties and after a stay in a psychiatric hospital, I needed motivation and inspiration.

With your help, I will be able to keep my studio space and keep making work and delivering exhibitions and workshops.

What We Need & What You Get

I am looking to raise £2000 which will cover studio rent and materials needed to make new installation work ready for a major exhibition in London in 2017.

In return for your kind contributions to my campaign you will receive limited edition prints on 300 gsm recycled board, visits to my studio, a lunch date, one of pieces of original work made specially for you, and thank you notes within the exhibition catalogue.

www.lizzbrady.com

www.brokengreywires.com




Mono print

Collage

Collage

Collage

Collage

Digital print

Digital print

Digital print

Digital print

Digital print of installation

Digital print of installation



TESTEMONIALS

Kirsty Harris (Artist and curator)

Lizz is one of the hardest working artists I know and takes her practice very seriously. Here is your chance to own an original art work by her - which I believe is a really great investment as these pieces are bound to be worth a lot more in the future.

story:
Introduction

Hi, my name's Lisa Frost, I live in the beautiful Hinterland of the Gold Coast, Australia, and I create fine art landscape photography and poetry. My goal as an artist is to uplift and bring joy. I aim for my art to enhance the viewer's connection with nature and spirit, bringing them a sense of peace and space.p

Exhibiting my art has been on hold for a few years as other aspects of my life have taken priority, so I am just itching to get back out and share my work again! It starts with taking part in the Artyzan Fair being held on the Gold Coast in October where I'm putting together a collection of some of my best photographs I've entitled, "Serenity: Our World at Peace". 

Because it has been awhile I am basically starting from scratch, and printing and framing is not a cheap endeavour, which is why I need your help! And I thought what better way to raise funds than by offering prints from the exhibition at a discounted rate, as well as my lovely little gift book, "Love This Moment", which makes an awesome Christmas present!

 

My Objective

I am passionate about creating art that is peaceful and beautiful and allows people to forget all about the one-hundred-and-one things normally going around in their head and instead get transported to a distant and tranquil place. This is my vision for the "Serenity" exhibition, which will give me the start I need to once again be sharing my work more regularly.

I have spent a great many hours searching for the most beautiful and impactful ways of displaying my images, and have definitely found them in metallic prints framed or acrylic facemounted. And whilst the results are breath-taking they are also expensive...that's why I need your help!

 

Your Contribution

Your contribution towards this campaign is crucial, as the majority of funds raised will be going towards creating the prints for the exhibition. I am planning on having all the prints available as Master-Sized Unframed Prints (see below for an explanation of sizes), as well as a selection of Framed Prints and Framed Poetry: how many will depend on how much money is raised.

Ideally I'd also love to have a couple of Acrylic Facemounts on display as they are truly amazing! If we reach my goal then we can do this!!

A small portion of funds raised will also be going towards some display items (backdrops, tablecloths, art stands etc). Reaching my funding goal will mean I can purchase some decent lighting, which will make a big difference to just how wonderful this exhibition will look!

 

What You Receive!

When you contribute to this campaign you will receive a beautiful piece of art in return. An explanation of the different types available can be found below, along with all the images and poems included in the "Serenity" exhibition for you to choose from!
 

Love This Moment Book

"Love This Moment" is a simple and inspiring poem about finding true joy in life. Accompanied by 21 landscape photographs from earlier in my career, it is uplifting and life-affirming. The book also contains the moving story of what inspired me to write Love This Moment. With Christmas fast approaching it makes the perfect gift for family and friends!


 

Framed Poetry

Your choice of one of my poems from the "Serenity" exhibition, printed on Fuji Crystal Archive paper then matted and framed in an elegant white matte and frame. The frame is 8x10" while the print is 6x8". 

Further down the page are all the poems you can choose from. After you've chosen this perk I will email you asking which poem you'd like.

Unframed Prints

Your choice of one of my photographs from the "Serenity" exhibition printed on Kodak Professional Endura Premier Metallic paper. This paper has amazing vibrancy and depth, making it feel like you're almost there in the photo! It also has excellent archival qualities, being resistant to fading for 100 years in the typical home environment. 

Sizes

All perks are listed using a size name. See the table below for the actual size of the print you choose.

Further down the page are all the images in the "Serenity" exhibition you can choose from. After you've chosen one of these perks I will email you asking which image you'd like.

Framed Prints

Your choice of one of my photographs from the "Serenity" exhibition to be printed on Kodak Professional Endura Premier Metallic paper, then framed in your choice of either a mocha or white modern frame using only acid-free products for superior archival quality. I use high-grade acrylic instead of glass as it is very clear, lighter than glass and much harder to break! 

The white frame uses a double-matte with matching inner and outer mattes.

The mocha frame uses a double-matte consisting of a sand coloured outer matte and off-white inner matte.

Sizes

All perks are listed using a size name. See the table below for the actual size of the print and frame you choose.

Further down the page are all the images in the "Serenity" exhibition you can choose from. After you've chosen one of these perks I will email you asking which image you'd like.

Acrylic Facemounts

Acrylic Facemounts are a sleek and modern way to display fine art prints, as well as being visually stunning! You choose one of my photographs from the "Serenity" exhibition to be printed on fine art metallic paper, which is then facemounted onto a polished sheet of high-grade acrylic, giving it an almost magical luminescence. Acrylic Facemounts have a definite WOW factor!

Sizes

All perks are listed using a size name. See the table below for the actual size of the acrylic facemount you choose.

See below for all the images in the "Serenity" exhibition you can choose from. After you've chosen one of these perks I will email you asking which image you'd like.


Images

These are all the images in the "Serenity" exhibition; they span 12 years of my photographic work. You can choose from any of these images with any perk that includes an Unframed or Framed Print, or an Acrylic Facemount. After you've chosen one of these perks I will email you asking which image you'd like.

"The Beauty of Life"  
Wharariki Beach, New Zealand

"Rest"
Shimna River, Tollymore Forest, Northern Ireland, UK

"Glory"
Spicer's Gap, Australia

"Reflection"
Tallebudgera Creek, Gold Coast, Australia

"Quiet Moments of Reflection"
Severn River, Sundown National Park, Australia

"Welcome the Light"
Mount Tibrogargan, Glass House Mountains, Australia

"The Fairy's Garden"
Tollymore Forest, Northern Ireland, UK

"Be True"
Burleigh Heads, Gold Coast, Australia

"Just Be"
Miami, Gold Coast, Australia

"Enchanted Glen"
Clamp Hole, Glenbarrow, Ireland

"The Heart's Path"
Lahaina, Maui, USA

"Enough"
Mudgeeraba, Gold Coast, Australia

"Days of Glory"
Kinbane Headland, Northern Ireland, UK

"Ghostly Calm"
Dunluce Castle, Northern Ireland, UK

"Nature's Breath"
Springbrook, Gold Coast, Australia
 

Poems

These are all the poems included in the "Serenity" exhibition. You can choose from any of these poems when you get the "Companion Poem" perk - after you've chosen this perk I will email you asking which poem you'd like.

Little Spaces

Read the poem

Your Value

Read the poem

Remember Me

Read the poem

To Know Peace

Read the poem

Your Truth

Read the poem

Share Your Gospel

Read the poem

The Voice of Friendship

Read the poem

Come Back To Love

Read the poem

Wisdom of the Soul

Read the poem

Prayer of Abundance

Read the poem

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help financially you can still lend a hand! It would be awesome if you could share this campaign with your networks and fellow lovers of nature and fine art photography to help get the word out.

There are handy buttons at the top of the page for sharing: click one and I will be extremely grateful!
